Reviews.Title: “Made my business trip”
Reviews.Author: marezion
Reviews.Content: What a fun, relaxing place to stay! Lobby is a blast with bar serving yummy cocktails, plenty of seats, outdoor area with DJ and heat lamps. This place has a ton of nightlife so if you're into that you will be well situated. I stayed away from the nightclub upstairs but did enjoy the lobby. There's also free coffee at breakfast which is a nice plus. Rooms: I could live here. White modern furniture, low lacquer bed, lots of pillows and throws, chaise lounger. My room had a MASSIVE bathtub, which I used every day. Twice if possible. Sometimes hard to get the hot water going in the shower and no place to stash your toiletries except for a wee rolling cart. Counter space is definitely missed here. Robes and towels plentiful and plush. Food: I ate in the charming lobby restaurant, delish. I also ordered the room service Huevos Rancheros - amazing. Service: Fab, attentive, friendly, promptly brought toothpaste and earplugs on a weekend night when the partying below got loud. Free car service from the hotel was provided - a nice touch! Also nice were the bookmarks placed in reading material by room service :) Location: I could see the Hollywood sign from my room, across the street from the Frolic Room bar, reasonably close to Paramount Studios where I was working. Spa: Bliss. I love. Had a gifted body scrub treatment and enjoyed the heck out of the vichy/steam showers. Bought some wonderful products. (Big thanks for introducing me to Nuxe Huile Prodigeuse, which is my new favorite, and to the Bliss Body Cream as well.) Expensive but worth it. Wish the facility were bigger and had views but a perfectly comforting experience during a stressful trip! Overall, highly highly recommended. I joined the W Hotels frequent visitor program immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Russell T
Reviews.Content: Day 5 of my 7 day stay and thoroughly enjoying it. I am here for musexpo music conference and this is smack dab in the middle of Hollywood, the subway station is right next door. Hotel has great facilities rooms are fabulous and beds especially comfortable with great bedding. Excellent bathroom and large screen tv. Gym on 11th floor and heated pool on roof which is good early morning before the crowds arrive. Staff in peeled on red dresses and high heels keep the boys busy and my stella Artois ended up costing $16 but that goes with the territory. The 217 bus across the road goes to famers market and the grove and 5 blocks up is the Kodak centre and tourist heaven. Katsuyas Japanese is 50 meters away and the $15 bento box lunch special is sensational. Well worth the stay

Reviews.Title: “Best W Property I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: GoKoko
Reviews.Content: This is definitely the best W property I've stayed in. All the staff we encountered were warm and friendly. They also seemed to really pay attention to detail and were constantly cleaning things ( even the room doors with Mr. Clean magic erasers). The lobby is also great (and a nice retreat from the outside tourist trap where this hotel lies). Many others have talked about noise being a problem but we didn't encounter this problem and nothing but radio silence from our room on the 10th floor. Pros: 1) Hotel is immaculate and all the staff are wonderful. 2) Rooms smell great and are of decent size. 3) Quick elevators. 4) Efficient and friendly check-in. 5) Literally the BEST hotel bed I've ever slept in (and that includes all the 5 star properties I've stayed in. It was so comfortable and the sheets were just perfect). 6) Trader Joe's is right around the corner so you can always grab some vino for the room on the cheap or a well-priced sandwich for bfast/lunch. 7) The gym is large and top notch. 8) Great water pressure and shower. Cons: 1) Valet is quite steep at $35.00/nt. My friend and I each had a car so our valet charges per night were $70.00 plus tax. With tips included, we spent a total of about $165 in total valet charges during our two night stay. 2) While it's the best W I've stayed in, the location really leaves something to be desired unless you just really want to stay in Hollywood or be on Ave. of the Stars. It's in a tourist crap trap area and you can't walk 10 feet down the street without someone asking you to take their bus/shuttle tour of LA. There were also lots of homeless hanging around the hotel. 3) While we didn't really care, some people wouldn't be comfortable with the bathroom set-up if traveling with friend(s) and/or family in the same room. There is a window - only about half of which is frosted - that looks into the shower/bathroom from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable experience due to horrid nightclub crowd...”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: I am not the W Hollywood's typical demographic in that I am an adult who thinks and is considerate of my fellow human beings. The crowd that this place attracts on weekends is simply disgraceful. Rich, spoiled, bratty, obnoxious and semi-literate, ill-mannered and loud. I stayed here due to Starwood loyalty and its location close to where I needed to be for work. I will not make that mistake again. I checked in on a Saturday afternoon in late April. The woman running the valet ($35 a night? Come on!) was harried, rude and a bad listener. Simply put, her attitude just sucked. Check-in took much longer than it should have - sweet women working at the desk, but I found them somewhat clueless. I will say that the concierge Zachary was terrific. He exudes positive energy and gave me some great restaurant suggestions and other LA tips. The room was actually nice. Great bed, beautiful bathroom. But at 2:00AM on both Saturday and Sunday nights I was awakened out of a deep sleep by the animals leaving the nightclub and/or lobby when they closed. I cannot believe I am the only one to whom this happened. I complained the second time and to the manager's credit they comped me more than a few SPG points, but I did not get back to sleep for hours. The loud and persistent sex noises coming from an adjoining room did not help matters much. He admitted to me that this is an ongoing problem at this hotel. The owner needs to make a decision - market it to grown-ups, or to the party kids, but NOT BOTH. No wonder they can't sell the attached condos...who would subject themselves to this BS week in and week out? One of the worst hotel experiences I have had. The W South Beach in Miami is fun and yet manages to remain a haven for grown-ups. Go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Better service at a red roof in”
Reviews.Author: lauren m
Reviews.Content: This was one of the worst hotel experiences i have ever had. Was in town for business and would have rather been at a holiday inn. The staff was extremely ditzy and slow. They were unhelpful in all aspects of their job. Several of my collegues were turned away at check in because of overbooking and sent to a different hotel at 2am. I am extremely disappointed and expected much more. As someone who travels frequently for work it is hard to upset me but the w really rubbed me the wrong way.

Reviews.Title: “It's even pointed out on the open top bus tour!”
Reviews.Author: kingfan
Reviews.Content: We had some reward points to use and seeing as this hotel is on Hollywood Blvd thought it would be a great place to use them. We arrived after a 5 hour car journey, slightly crumpled and a bit hot and bothered to find ourselves surround be a lot of trendy looking people, but feeling anything but trendy!! We had to wait about 15 mins for our room but what a room to wait for. We were very impressed, not the best view over a car park but the room itself was great. The mini bar was well stocked with virtually everything you could think of but, as you would expect, was on the price side. After a freshen up we went for an explore. Yes the walk of fame is right outside the door, but the surrounding area is quite seedy, you have to walk a bit of a way to get out of it and I don't think I would be happy to walk through at night. We were quite impressed that it was pointed out on the open top but tour though. We were only there for one night and having seen the surrounding area decided to eat at Delphines. The bar staff in the restaurant were lovely and we had quite a chat with them, they were willing to make cocktails not on the menu too. Food was of a high standard and reasonably priced. After dinner we sat on the patio with a drink, despite the fire pits it was still a bit chilly so returned inside where there was a band playing. There was a nice vibe and the singer was excellent. Parking was valet only, and they were very quick to deliver the car back to us the following morning when we wanted to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent traveler and visitor to the W Hollywood. Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Dizzum
Reviews.Content: I stay at the W Hollywood about 3 times a month for business with the studios and the W Hollywood's accommodations, service and staff never miss a beat. As a senior platinum starwood preferred member, that is no easy task. Leon and his staff are great at addressing your travel needs, whatever/whenever they are!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretentious crowd.”
Reviews.Author: 21Seagull
Reviews.Content: Being right on Hollywood Blvd is great. Trader Joe's in the same complex. Walking distance from IRIS, Grauman's, Walk of Fame etc. Gorgeous rooms, though overlooking the valet was loud at night. The bed was amazingly comfortable. Rooftop pool is great, though we had many conflicting statements about the times it was open. The W is branded as trendy, no doubt. The lobby is filled with Hollywood wannabes. The room is filled with everything you could need, all with ridicoulous price tags - alcohol, face wash, water, condoms, CDs, you name it. For a $300 minimum do you think you could get free Internet? Didn't try the free Acura shuttle, but it seems to be a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “everything but the pool...”
Reviews.Author: hpotterva
Reviews.Content: ...which you have to walk through the restaurant to get to. Oh, and by the way, was closed at 6 one evening for a private dinner. When it was open the next day, there was no one to staff the place. If we wanted anything, we could use a telephone in the restaurant to call down to room service using the in-room dining menu to have things delivered up there. It was all very strange, not what i'd expect from a W at all (and this was in the middle of the afternoon). Aside from this one hiccough, service was above par. Gym was nice, the finishings in the hotel were nice, and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for kids”
Reviews.Author: Lori-T-01
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful, but it is definitely not a place for kids. I had my two teenage sons with me, so they were ok with it, but they were not really all that excited for the place. Not much for them to do. The location was ideal. You walk out the door and see all the stars in the sidewalk. The staff was exceptional and treated everyone with equal respect. Even the valet parkers had class. They worked hard - running to get people their cars in a timely manner. I asked for help several times and the staff were always courteous and helpful. The rooms were on the smaller side, but it was nicely decorated in a contemporary theme. Clean. The only thing I really didn't like was the pool. It was small with not many chairs around it. There were cabanas, but they're pricey to rent. Starting at something like $200 and up to in the $1000s. Definitely not kid friendly. Keep in mind in the summer months, the weekends are reserved for adult only parties at the pool, so the kids are definitely not allowed in then. The restaurant attached to the pool was very cool looking and trendy, but again, after a certain time, there is a hefty cover charge and the kids are not allowed in. If I stayed there again, I would either go only with my husband or go with friends. Definitely not the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: mylo5765
Reviews.Content: I must admit that after reading reviews on this hotel I was very hesitant about our stay. To our surprise everything was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful; The gym is stat of the art; the Acura shuttle was a great perk; all of the staff were friendly and helpful. Please remember the nightclub is only open on W-Fri-Sat-Sun. We stayed Sun-Tues. We asked for a room away from the nightclub and were put in room 1030. I admit I could hear a remote screaching noise in the background but could sleep. On our 2nd night there the guests next door were having a very loud party. The walls at this hotel were very thin. We could hear everything they were saying. Lucky for us due to the negative reviews we had read we brought ear plugs and they did help. The area right outside the hotel was a little seedy. We had our 12 year old daughter with us so we came back to our room by 9:00 every night. Overall this was a good stay. We would stay again, I mean afterall loud guests next door could happen at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Posh spot in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NickSakis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 consecutive nights. It was a great experience aside from some credit card billing errors which saw the hotel staff pre-auth my credit card for a few thousand dollars which in return was frozen by my bank due to suspicious activity. The hotel got involved and made a call to the bank which released the hold. The front desk manager, Brian, who helped me was absolutely fantastic. He made it all right within about an hour. If you are looking for a family retreat and have young kids you may want to chose elsewhere as this hotel is full of excitement and constant good times.

Reviews.Title: “Sleazy locale and overrated”
Reviews.Author: Vivien S
Reviews.Content: THis hotel is in a sleazy, remote location and is overhyped, overrated. THe staff are poorly informed and ambivalent towards mere mortals (yes I'm talking about you men at the door). We were given totally incorrect information by the desk about getting to our basketball game at the Staples Centre. Given the room rates it has the audacity to charge you for internet in the room at $14 per day leaving you to use the bar where it is free but immersed in darkness (at night). Just on the bar it does have a good vibe and the waitresses (together with cafe staff) provide the exception to my earlier comment about service, they were cheery and charming. The beds are very comfy, however, the chair was covered in loads of cut black hair, disgusting! As to the cafe the breakfast menu is good and plentiful but overpriced, however, you are captive as there is no where in the area decent for breakfast. Finally, the hotel lost an item of our laundry which, behold, was found as we were completing check out. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great as expected”
Reviews.Author: dnkonvaca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hollywood again and were not disappointed. Our room was a Cool Corner suite this time around and it was impressive. The view of the Hollywood sign, the Capitol Records building and the Pantages theater just can't be beat. The room is very well layed out with a separate lounge area that includes a very cool circular couch and a wet bar. The bed was extremely comfortable and we both enjoyed a very relaxing night of sleep. One note, the hotel is right on Hollywood Blvd, and the noise from the street can be a bit loud. Just bring some ear plugs and realize you're in the middle of a vibrant city and you'll be just fine. As always, the valet parking was extremely convenient as we needed to get our car out several times and everytime it was waiting for us a few minutes after we called from the room. The service is always great. Joey, our bellman, gave us a full rundown of how to work everything in the suite and also gave us a description of the different types of rooms available at the hotel. He was extremely helpful. All of the staff was very helpful and accomodating. Our room wasn't quite ready when we arrived at noon, but we gave them our mobile phone number and they called as soon as it was available at 2pm. To sum it up, great hotel, great location, and great staff! We'll be coming back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: PointsAddict
Reviews.Content: Ok, I liked this hotel....not loved. As with all W's it has a stylish lobby....the rooms are a little too dark ie. not enough lighting, but it was very large and comfortable. The best part about this W was the pool deck....great layout with cabanas and great djs.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gina M
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel to be told cool corner suite I had booked on the Internet was not available. I was asked to stay 1 night in one room and move the next day. When I vented my frustration at the staff they quickly sorted out the problem and gave me the room I had requested. don't know how they did it or why they couldn't do it when we first arrived. After that the staff were very helpful and attentive, we stayed on the sixth floor very very quiet no noise or disturbances even over the weekend. Staff and the concierge were very attentive couldn't do more to make our stay better. Went up to the pool one day and there was a couple of very loud guests the management made a point of apologising for,the guests behaviour even though they didn't need to. Room service was quick and very good food. Overall our stay was excellent would definitely come back, ask for a quiet room the staff know which rooms they are. We were on the 6th flor and it was very quiet and the beds are amazing you really get a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy nightclubs and being overcharged...”
Reviews.Author: Wordlywise_12
Reviews.Content: You will love this Hotel. Don't stay here. I am just completing a stay and the place is a joke. The lobby becomes a nightclub on Friday and Saturday evenings so when checking in on those evenings you have to scream to be heard by the check in team. I was placed in room 318 and had two nights of dreadful sleep. The noise from the lobby below and car entry courtyard drifts up the side of the building. The acoustics and sound insulation of this building are appalling. I complained after my second night (woken at 0235 and again at 0600 by guests around me) and was moved to level 9. Its better here but there are far better Hotels to choose from in Hollywood and in LA than this W. The pros are that it is above the Hollywood/ Vine Metro. You can walk to the Chinese Theatre in 15 minutes and enjoy the Hollywood Walk of Fame - its right outside the Hotel front door. The cons are that the restaurant prices are too high, the rooms drab and depressing, there are no views to speak of for most of the hotel rooms, the acoustics are appalling and you can hear people flushing their loos right next door to you and the staff are stuck up and snooty. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest and intend to lodge a formal letter of complaint with the Hotel Group about this Hotel. Don't come here for peace and quiet. Come here if you want to party with a pretentious Hollywood bunch of losers.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel, Hollywood good location for younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: dachinghwa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at W Hollywood for seven days in March 2012. Our room was 390 quare feet and had a two person shower but no bath.This is a hotel that caters to a young crowd many of whom appear to be in the entertainment industry. The lobby was jammed at night with young folk uniformly dressed in tight Spandex dresss and four inch stiletto heels (women) and grey suits(men). We were on the tenth floor and did not have any noise problems. The hotel has a small gymn and the top floor is an outdoor pool club loaded with young people. The pool area is actually quite small as they must have used some digital magic to increase the size. THe staff were uniformly pleasant and eager to please. We had an amusing water bottle problem that would make a good Curb Your Enthusaism plot. Part of the difficulty stemmed from modest English language skills of the cleaning lady. We ate breakfast several times in the Dephine Resturant without problems. The W Hotel Hollywood is on top of the Red Line's Hollywood /Vine station.There is a Trader Joe's around the corner. During our vist Acura had a promotion that allowed guests to have a trip of up to five miles in an Acura.

Reviews.Title: “No more W's for me; this is surely the worst of the lot”
Reviews.Author: HKguy
Reviews.Content: Relative to the US$350 room rate, this is the worst value hotel I have ever stayed in. It may be worth US$89 on a good day. Maybe. W needs to understand that "design-driven", even if minimalist, is NOT an excuse to scam us on the cheap. Their usual cute trick is to "renovate" old Holiday Inns (or whatever) into "luxury properties" but after staying at 3 now, I am convinced this is a scam to go low budget on cost and try to use "hipness" to sell crappy hotel rooms at astronomical prices. So, shame on me for being fooled, I guess. Apart from location, this property is a disaster. The rooms are dark and poorly constructed. Everything is thin and low-end feeling. White painted MBF furniture abounds, covered in white vinyl. A lot of it is chipped or stained and showing wear. The bed has a soft mattress with a hole in it, like sleeping in a hammock. Car parking is US$45 per day (on top of the $350!). There is NO pool (OK, they have one, but they have sublet it to a nightclub contractor, and guests cannot use it). For the four days we were there, the front door itself was actually broken, with a cutesy sign on it that said, "I have issues", (go around). For four days, you cannot fix the front door of your hotel? Really? They are understaffed, and what staff they have really couldn't care about guests at all. You have to give anyone $5 to get them to do anything. Their annoying refrain "Whatever, whenever" comes across more like, "Yeah, whatever". In spite of this - perhaps Hollywood plastic types are tragically stupid as well as hip - the place is packed. In particular they always seem to have a big event going on, but guests are neither invited nor allowed. Problem is that when you rent out your common areas to "exclusive" events, where do you ask your guests to go relax? Seems they haven't thought that one through. The nightclub on the roof of the hotel isn't related to the hotel at all, they claim. You have no special privileges there (despite the $350 room charge). You have to actually physically leave the hotel front door and go outside around the block to line up at a side entrance of the hotel building if you want to go up. At 11 pm, in this neighborhood, that means past 2 hookers, 6 homeless people begging, and a guy selling K (actual list from our experience). The place was empty after all that. Didn't stop all the staff form being arrogant, though. The only positive to this experience is that at checkout - I am guessing due to incompetence - they simply omitted to charge us over US$170 in various things like parking, drinks, a meal, etc. Hotel fun fact: All-nude stripper place across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Hollwood without the W.”
Reviews.Author: VikingsEnjoyingLife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here quite a few time. Mainly because we get some good offers here now and then. Always some waiting at the lobby before we get our room. Maby 2 out of 3 times we have ended up with a room close to the elevators. Lots of traffic and drunk people, NOT recomended, because the doors at this hotel must be made of cardboard! you can even hear people breathing trough them! At christmas a guy stalked my wife and tried knocking down the door. She called security, nobody came. I had to go up and do what was necesarry. The morning after they offered us free breakfast.. like that would help the night before if he managed to hunt her down. The rooms are nice, nothing to complain about here.

Reviews.Title: “shocking !! this is not a W to be visiting”
Reviews.Author: paulgillbanks
Reviews.Content: so my shocker is still going on ! im still here and im sure it wont get better ! we all had great hopes of a great stay for our one night m as im a tour manager and stay in 6 different hotels a week and so do my artists ! the atrists in working with at the moment actuallly asked me to book "the W" we arrived at 530 pm and were told even at this time our Suite wasnt ready and were told to go wait ! , we also need a room for some interviews , i was informed that public areas we are a nogo as the w had a policy that didnt allow this , i said no problem and was please when the receptionist suggested we used the wired room , half way thru the organised 15 different interviews whicjh had took some co-ordinating i can tell you , a security guy came in and said im shutting this down ! and didnt want to listen to anything else and was quite frankly rude , i went to see the manager who was very unhelpful and said he couldnt say anything that would contradict his security as his hands were tied ! he then offered me a romm to do the interviews in foir 500 dollors , im sure this isnt W policy !!

Reviews.Title: “THIS PLACE IS G-L-A-M-O-R-O-U-S”
Reviews.Author: MyHotelGuy
Reviews.Content: You'll want to pack your best trendy clothes before setting foot in this hotel. Rooms: The rooms were designed in true W fashion with low beds and modern electronic comforts (e.g. iPod docking station and an “any charge” contraption). The key thing that I always worry about when staying at a W is if the room is functional. Surprisingly there was an ample amount of desk space to actually get work done. Food: There are several dining options around the property as it is in the heart of Hollywood Boulevard. However, I decided to dine at the W’s Delphine, which was a solid selection, just right off the lobby. The French toast that was certainly nothing to write home about but filled my tummy nonetheless. If you’re not interested in food, please don’t pass up the opportunity to have a drink in the lobby living room and at least pretend you are an L.A. V.I.P. Bottom Line: All right, the W Hollywood is definitely a cool place to hang out and sleep if you are so inclined. I would not suggest this place for families with kids as it’s not that type of hotel. This hotel is perfect for those visiting Los Angeles for the weekend who want to be close to the nightlife. With rates starting around $200, this hotel is a pretty good deal for what it offers (e.g. awesome location and posh L.A. scene). Other Tid Bits: -Got a car? Overnight valet parking is $35.00 -Trader Joe’s is a couple of blocks from the hotel (good for getting booze or food) -Avoid this hotel on New Years Eve! There are always several parties at the hotel, and -although the hotel does an excellent job of trying to keep the peace (i.e. guest noise contracts and wristbands), not everything is foolproof -The rooftop pool is amazing, so bring your swimsuit -Drai’s (one of L.A.’s hottest clubs) is located on the rooftop of the W Hollywood Check out more reviews like these at MyHotelGuy.com Twitter: @MyHotelGuy

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenuga
Reviews.Content: 2 days here as my family began spring break trip in la area. The hotel was what I thought it would be. We rolled in at almost 1 am Saturday morning and it seemed we were Valeting at a private Hollywood party. Red carpet, a lamborghini on he right, Audi r8 on the left. Quick valet scooted us in the lobby, quick check in, pretty cool. Too bad my wife and I were beat after a delayed 6 hour cross country flight. Good:staff was always friendly, never an issue. Room was overall cool, comfy, a bit small. Not so good: had requested a room with some sort of view twice, was given a view of a wall. We all had sinus issues after night 1 and 2, assume something in the room. Requested some sort of air purifier, non was available. Requested a basic cupcake ( or something basic) in room upon arrival as it was my sons big double digit 10th birthday, nada. As a gold Starwood member expect some basic requests to be filled and was let down neither request was fulfilled. Bottom line: hollywood atmosphere, admirable enough of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready for a party”
Reviews.Author: Austintxrr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few weeks ago for the Grammys. We knew that W hotels are always a good time, but this was like staying in a club. It is a great looking hotel with nice rooms. Do not expect to get great sleep if you have a room over the courtyard. We were sleeping with noise canceling headphones to block out the music and noise. It is in a good spot if you are wanting to explore the Hollywood area, but seemed far from everywhere else in the city. It was a fun place to stay, but I don't think I would opt to stay there again. I might drop by for a drink and people watching, it does get an interesting crowd!

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: SandwedgeonRye
Reviews.Content: I looking at the rest of the reviews, a common topic was 'party hotel' wherein the lobby turned into a party; the concierge turned into bouncers. Another common theme- an apparent aloofness among the staff, especially with valet. Yet another common theme was plenty of noise- especially from unruly guests. I didn't find any of these common themes to be accurate- that isn't to say the people who posted those comments are wrong, it is to say that it is apparent that the W Hollywood is trying to change their market. I hope so- the party scene doesn't fit the Starwood culture (but if it drives occupancy and rate, well.....<shrug>). I was at the W for a lodging industry conference- the hotel performed very well- in all respects. One thing I do recommend- GM or Rooms Director- start replying to these Tripadvisor comments. It looks as if in the past some good reviews were commented upon, but we know incosistency is not the way to go. If group business is what you're after, planners (especially independents) use Tripadvisor a lot to look for commonalities in these hotel reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very "New" Feeling; Very Eclectic”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_In_Dallas
Reviews.Content: We were in town to see a show at the Pantages Theatre. This is the PERFECT hotel since they are literally right across the street from the theatre. We were booked at a cheaper hotel elsewhere, but by the time we assessed the cost of parking plus the hassle factor of LA traffic, the slightly more expensive nightly rate ended up being worth it. The room itself was nice. The view though, not so much. Just based on where we were, our view was of the wall of the rooms across the way. When we looked to the right, we were overlooking the main entrance and to the left was the back of the hotel. So, we were in a room that had a view of the "alley" between the buildings for the property. Not a big deal - jsut be aware you might not have much to look at. The bed itself was very comfortable. It was different though; very low to the ground. It looked somewhat like a futon but definately made up for it in comfort. The bathroom was nicely appointed and had all the amenities you would expect. The room was primarily a "heavy white plastic". While it looks very classy and eclectic now, it will start showing the wear and tear soon unless the hotel keeps up on it's maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Fun”
Reviews.Author: gwilsonDallas
Reviews.Content: Great people watching. Perfect location. Loved the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfgd61
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood was my first "W" experience. Our first room had a nasty odour, when mentioned to Reception, we were moved to another room immediately. The rooms are well designed and very comfortable. I loved the lobby bar and outdoor terace. The pool deck was also good, but very crowded. The complimentary Acura transfer was a great benefit and our driver was very obliging and knowledgeable. The only disappointment was the 'whatever' desk was not very helpful when approached. The response to every question about transport was, "hire a limo"! I found out after I returned home that one of my options would have been to catch a train from the subway directly under the Hotel. I should have researched it before I left, but ..... I asked a local instead!

Reviews.Title: “W Glam”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen F
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is located in the heart of the California action. The atmosphere, staff, and overall amenities were amazing. I love beautiful hotels especially when you are treated as if you are a regular at the establishment. The front desk agent was very funny and polite. We were able to walk over to the night club and get right in for an amazing party for Ducati. I would definitely stay here again whenever I am in LA.

Reviews.Title: “W done right”
Reviews.Author: Benpatton
Reviews.Content: W hotels are meant for young travelers looking for a trendy scene and hotels furnished with modern/hip amenities. This hotel had that covered. The location is great if you want to be in Hollywood and if you're staying here I strongly recommend going to Katsuya nearby for dinner. The gym on the 11th floor was well equipped and spotless. The rooms were great and beds were fantastic! You know how sometimes you sleep in a hotel bed and wonder 'Wow - this bed is REALLY comfy!'...yep, you get that SAME FEELING here! The only complaint I have is that the front desk is sometimes undermanned and for simple things like getting another key you could be waiting in line for longer than you like.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but big problems”
Reviews.Author: Lavendertigerlily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this W Hotel for work this week. Because it was Los Angeles, I had to have a car. To get to the office early I had the valet's bring my car to me around 5:30 am. The valet's took my hotel card out of the car as if I were checking out so that when I returned they gave me a new card... and started charging me two parking fees per night. When I checked out this morning and was telling the woman at the counter about the people in my hall talking loudly she folded my bill away into an envelope without allowing me to see it first. SO it was not until I got home I discovered the double parking charge. The place is nice, the room was pretty but smelled liked dirty socks. The people in the hallway in the middle of the night happened more than once. It was close to things to walk to, but I might find another place to stay when

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the middle of the action in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: MadisonvilleGary
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day business meeting at the W Hollywood. If you are doing the touristy-Hollywood thing, the location of this property could not be better at the corner of Hollywood and Vine, directly above a Metro stop. The hotel is clean and well-run and I can easily recommend it. I had a single king (Room 842) and it was spacious and well-designed. The bathroom was very clean with quality fixtures. It also caters to the "hip" crowd and there were lots of folks in their 20-30s there for the party atmosphere. The whole lobby is a giant bar/club until 2 am. Not my cup of tea (anymore) but that did not detract from my experiences of the property. MadisonvilleGary

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on all counts”
Reviews.Author: Dukes24-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, was immediately upgraded on arrival due to being an spg gold member, Excellent service upon arrival and also at check in. Very friendly and efficient. Great lobby area and bar, the place to be in the evening's if you just want to chill. Room was great, very modern, nice bathroom and great seating area on window sill to chill. Not huge but nice..! Ate in the Delphine Brasserie restaurant, great food and service.! Pool area fab, and also home to Drai's nightclub hollywood which we visited on the saturday evening, Also ate at Drai's, food was ok, a bit over priced, much better at other LA restaurants, but nightclub is great. Pool party was on the sunday which we got in free as had access early due to having a room, great party and weather, and great people, couldn't ask for anything better to do on a sunday, Location is right on Hollywood Blvd, 15min walk to walk of fame/kodak theatre etc. Prefer to stay in Beverly Hills as area much nicer, and nice to go for stroll, however here still safe, and very busy down the Hollywood Blvd. Sports bar across the road where we watched the champs league final just incase your interested, cheap drinks there also. We paid 300$ a night and consider this to be a great value for money hotel as The W is very hip, and looks amazing, would definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Bird78701
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the W. The service was impeccable and the room was fantastic. Look forward to my next visit to LA and will definitely be staying at the W again!! Was t.ough going home after the experience

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Pantages”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned a Saturday overnight trip to Hollywood to see “Wicked” at the Pantages Theater. We wanted to stay in a nice hotel and to be within walking distance of the theater. The W Hotel Hollywood worked out perfectly. Almost too short of a walk! Check in and valet parking went smoothly. Room was clean and well appointed. Dined at the lobby/outdoor bar for late lunch (not the best service) and dined at Delphine’s after the show. Delphine’s had a limited menu as it was 11:00PM, but the food and service was fantastic. Walking back into the hotel from the restaurant I was surprised by the amount of people in the lobby/bar. Definitely a 20 something hangout and was loud and high energy… They had a security/doorman at the elevator and the elevator only works when using your door key. Nice touch. Bed was very comfortable. Check out was smooth as well. Helpful Hint: Trader Joe’s is on the same block. Stock up on water and snacks for a fifth the cost … I would not stay at this hotel with my young children, but would stay again for another weekend getaway with my wife.

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood hits the spot”
Reviews.Author: Debaser72
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. The room and lobby decor are very modern but with a classic Hollywood feel. The atmosphere is one of big cocktail party. So much so that there was a fair amount of noise audible from the room late into the night (even on a Tuesday) but the bed was so comfortable falling asleep was not an issue. The concierge may have reminded us this was "hollywood" a couple too many times but he seemed genuinely interested in helping out and made sure we had our desired dinner spot. Otherwise, Staff was generally friendly, but didn't go out of their way. Ate at the Delphine on property. Started with a service problem that was quickly rectified and more than made up for. Food was excellent. Not sure I'd pay anywhere near the rack rate but for the hotwire price, the W was an amazing value (although the parking cost was exorbitant) The location and ease to the Burbank airport are a huge plus.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Matt O
Reviews.Content: It is a W so still fun, but for a W in Hollywood, it is right on the edges of some less than nice places and you may feel less enclined to venture out - especially as the bar inside is big and fun. Very pleasant staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: bcinsd15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W. Got a killer deal on Hotwire. Not sure the room itself would be worth the rack rate, they are pretty small. Room was clean, but the white furniture needed to be clean. Check in was easy. Valet guys were friendly. It is definitely an 'adult' themed hotel. I would agree with the other reviews that the hotel is loud on the weekend. Great location across from Pantages. Would have liked a refrigerator in the room to keep leftovers.

Reviews.Title: “Pure comfort”
Reviews.Author: Elina53
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel, trendy and cool rooms, very clean, nice views, and Bliss products in your bathroom. We had an amazing deal on it via hotwire (about $150 shared between 4! well worth it!) Just check out location though because it could be quite far if you are thinking about walking to The Chinese theater, Beverly hills side of Hollywood blvd, etc., although it's dead easy to get to wherever you want to go by metro or by car. If you want to be this side of town, e.g. for theater venues it's perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Swank”
Reviews.Author: ABethC
Reviews.Content: Very hip & chic hotel. Great location as well. Loved the outdoor bar/dance party they had going on Saturday night. We went to the pool on the roof of Drais next door, which was a little less than relaxing since it required a dress code....but I guess that is LA.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe spending money is just a Hollywood pastime...”
Reviews.Author: James_Busby
Reviews.Content: Seriously? Now I stayed here for work as it was where the rest of the team was, but I was paying my own way... Where do I start? $305 +tax a night. That's a good start. What does that include? A room. That's it. WiFi is extra, parking is $35 a night, a latte, which was average, was over $8 so $10 with tip.... The staff were lovely, that was the highlight, but the rest felt like once in you were captive and going to be charged for anything they could think of..... I love how a cheap hotel has free parking, free wifi and a coffee machine in the room to get your business. Saddest of all was the hotel just isn't up to scratch. I have two pairs of German made jeans with me that are the only jeans I buy, they cost the same as a night at this hotel, but would normally last a lot longer than one night. First night I sat at my desk in room my jeans ripped on some hokey bit of metal angle used to mount a DVD player under the desk. I was assured compensation would be forthcoming, but still I wait, and the email address they gave me for the manager bounces! Then be careful entering the foyer cafe, as those tables are sharp on the corner and I ripped my other pair of jeans. Yep, just perfect. Luckily I can sew. So, if you have a roll of hundreds in your pocket and just want to get rid of them, and ruin some clothing, I'd highly recommend this hotel. Otherwise, speak up.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, small rooms and no view”
Reviews.Author: emma m
Reviews.Content: A very fancy start as you arrive, fab location in Hollywood. The room had everything I needed but slightly on the small side for an American hotel. Overall I would stay here again for the location however the room had no view - just an inner wall....

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: ChadRogers
Reviews.Content: Central location over the metro station, other than the Pantages and a couple of restaurants this is the bad end of the blvd. Nice complex, very well trained and competent staff. Concierge was generally uninterested and unhelpful for straightforward requests like tickets. Valets were super fast and check was effortless. For SPG platinum got a so so room with a truly bad view (parking lot).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: itzmej
Reviews.Content: I got a Starwood Platinum upgrade to an almost suite. 10th floor looking out to the Hollywood sign. Major brownie points. Room was spacious. Room also had stuff on the carpet from the previous guest (crumbs and weird tiny little plastic pieces). Has an exposed metal bracket under the desk, cut myself on it just by pulling my chair in when I first sat down. And my room was LOUD. I regularly nap at major league baseball games, so I can sleep through a lot. I could not sleep due to the noise from the nightclub. They stopped the music at 2:38am, which is when I finally got some sleep. Being as how I had to leave at 5am not much sleep, but the bed was comfortable for the 2hrs of sleep I did get. Full disclosure: did not request to be moved because, quite frankly, if I was gonna take the time to pick up my room it made just as much sense to get my car and make the 2.5hr drive home. So $400 for 2hrs sleep in a nice room I couldn't use to sleep in. Not my idea of a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, well positioned and great hotel features”
Reviews.Author: StevenBSydney
Reviews.Content: At the quieter (there's such a thing?) end of Hollywood Blvd, the W is a great spot. Smart, stylish and hip. The rooms are larger than expected and the hotel features are uber cool. The pool and bar (Dry, Wet) is remarkable. The gym is great and well stocked with water, fruit and ear phones. In room cinema, minibar and other features are great. Only thing I didn't like: W and other SPG hotels ongoing fascination with too-soft pillows...tough to get a decent sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite with nice staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with DH at this excellent hotel. Platinum upgrade to a gorgeous suite - even the bathroom had a hallway! Comfortable bedding, swank sitting area, spotless bathroom with Bliss products. Common rooms were gorgeous - loved hanging out in the lobby to play checkers, or a drink I guess. We were there during a very quiet time when the rooftop club was closed so room on the 12th floor was ok, otherwise staff said they put guests wanting a quiet room on the 7th floor so try to book that ahead of time. Location was perfect if you want to visit Hollywood Boulevard sites (you can just walk out the door), Griffith Park, Laugh Factory, and the Hollywood sign are a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Class hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyToTravel06
Reviews.Content: the hotel is situated at the heart of the hollywood bolevard...checking in is hassle free...the room is amazingly styled and contemporary to justify the location...it is just above the Metro train station so it will be easy for going around if you dont have car. they have valet parking as well...they have round the clock room service so you will never feel letdown.... all the sanitory items smelled lemon...i am not sure everyone will like that....also i could not find the shower cap considering the shower head....cofee will be free in the morning time near concierge desk... overall it is a class hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the Hollywood treatment!!”
Reviews.Author: ThorCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my 40 th birthday weekend as an attempt to feel young and hip instead of domestic and middle aged! The hotel didn't disappoint. They self-identify as a "high energy hotel" so don't expect the Westin you stay at for business. Funky decor, great staff and comfy heavenly beds! Great value for its great location. Highly recommended for anyone hoping to escape their suburban grind for a weekend on the town :)

Reviews.Title: “Laughably Pathetic”
Reviews.Author: Steve R
Reviews.Content: This place would be better off calling itself the "WTF?" instead of the "W". First off, I've never spent so much money to be treated as horribly as I was this week. The thing that stuck in my mind through most of the trip here was the fact that I never felt welcome, at all. When my vacation here began, the lady who checked me in was Marisol. She was reliable and smart and I enjoyed when she helped me. The deposit, was 500 dollars which is way more than any other hotel I've been to in LA. Wheels, is HORRIBLE! Do not park here at the W, if you can help it. LAZ parking owns wheels, and all of their employees are disrespectful and unwashed. They will leave your car smelling like a hollywood hippie. Charge you for leaving your car overnight, even if you never parked it there overnight. Seriously, a truly unprofessional company, that is not owned by the W, and why they would have such riff raff, trash the nice people's personal property is beyond me. They act like they have a monopoly, becasue they basically do. I was overcharged, again and again by these ridiculous fools. Definitely put a sour taste in my mouth for the whole trip. No one in the Hotel takes any responsibility, they will only tell you, "our valet service, isn't part of our company" When we checked out, they actually made us wait over an hour to have someone go and "inspect" our room? Seriously? Places infinitely better, don't act this ridiculous. So aside from being a complete waste of money, I was also called a very nasty derogatory comment, by one of the Wheels employees who thought that he could argue my rationality by telling me something so rude, that it caused me to basically start shouting uncontrollably. I was over charged over 150 dollars, and I never parked my car there for more than a few hours. I think if Marisol, had been around, I would gotten all of my charges reversed. But I unfortunately had the ill-pleasure of Maureen, being my receptionist. This front desk personal, is another winner. It seems that they have the absolute most terrible employees, working during checkout. Maureen, not only took from 12:30 to past 1:30 just to check us out. She didn't help us reverse any overcharged the hotel made... like charging us for a phone call to the hotels reservation desk. (another 2 bucks) Easy stuff like that was beyond here reach. I swear it looks like they take all of the unemployed morons in hollywood, that can't seem to competently make it in the entertainment industry and turn them loose on the "more successful" entertainers for the horror of their own benefit. When you get a room here, you are not guaranteed any sort of passes for entrance into Drai's. Drai's isn't more than just a pool, during the day. They were remodeling, and the place was a mess. The pool was open, but there was a film on top of the water from the construction. Nothing I like more than having my nephews swim in a swirl of muck. I love staying in hotels in Hollywood. But this is the easily the worst experience I've ever had staying in this part of California. Stay away from here and keep yourself very happy by staying somewhere you can get your money's worth, which for sure... isnt here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: zimzum42
Reviews.Content: It's all good, bit too stylish in some ways, and you have to pay for everything (one dollar per page printing, plus have to pay for the time you use the computer - jokes)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Brooktrout92118
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from the Pantages Theater, which makes it perfect for visitors planning to see a show. It is also directly above the Metro station, so it would be possible to take a train to LA Union Station and Metro to the hotel, thus avoiding traffic and $35.00 overnight parking. The room was modern, and luxurious, with mood lighting, large flat screen TV and stocked minibar. No coffee service, but the Coffee Bean is 1.5 blocks away. We stayed on points, which was good because everything about the hotel is expensive - from $9.00 Fiji water to $300+ for a bottle of liquor upstairs in the amazingly decadent nightclub (which we visited before it opened - what do they do in those little cabanas with the beds?). Quite an amazing bar scene in the lobby late at night - my wife couldn't sleep because of the transmitted noise. I think we would try it again, if only for the location, but don't come here looking for total peace and tranquility!

Reviews.Title: “SPG loyalty WELL rewarded”
Reviews.Author: InNYfromGA
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay closer to LAX when in LA for business. I was working in near Burbank so I decided to try W Hollywood. I'm glad I did. I got the customary email from manager Christopher Nelson regarding my upcoming stay. I asked him if W Hollywood upgraded platinum guests. Boy do they. He emailed me back immediately and advised that pending availability, of course, I was would be in a suite. Kudos to him. My room was ridiculous. A semi-circle couch with privacy curtain is in the center of the room. Definitely had an entertaining vibe to it. Bathroom had a huge tub and tile shower. Tons of cool lighting sets the mood. The bed was a very comfortable king. Upon checkin I was slightly skeptical of how much I'd be able to sleep since I was given a list of rules regarding excessive noise and guests in each room. The lobby was heating up when I checked in around 4:30pm. I had no issues with noise. Slept like a baby. Very quiet. I had to leave around 4:30 the next morning for my flight. As I was checking out, the late night nose-candy crowd was just checking in. Entertaining. Hotel security was quick to tell the young lad strumming his guitar in the lobby (at 4:30am) to give it a rest. W Hollywood has a train station/light rail (whatever LA calls their transit rail) immediately below the hotel. Convenient. Not convenient if you need to get to the airport since there are no train stations at LAX or Burbank. Cab to Burbank Airport (at 5am, with no traffic) was around $30. Awesome hotel. The Hollywood stars are immediately in front of the hotel. Great location. Will definitely stay here again. Upon pulling in to the valet lot I advised the attendant that I was only checking in then immediately leaving. He told me he'd keep it close at no charge. When I went back to get my car 20 mins later, I was directed to the cashier and paid $15, I think. Slightly irritating. The wetbar counter had lots of damage from guests not taking care of the room. Not W's fault. Just saying. SPG should take note of the customer service provided by CHRISTOPHER NELSON. Well done sir. Wish other hotels were as accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy and management didn't seem to care!”
Reviews.Author: Bajaboater
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying I am a long-term Starwood Platinum Preferred Guest and have stayed in many W properties around the world. I was excited to try this hotel since I had a company function not far away and it gave an excuse to stay in Hollywood instead of my usual hotels in Pasadena or by LAX. The night started off well in the Lobby Bar with a delightful waitress who served us wine, cheese and olives that were terrific. We moved on to Delphine Brasserie for dinner and had a wonderful meal with terrific service. All was going well until I went up to my room for a good night's sleep. I had an early morning flight, so I retired about 9:30pm and within minutes of putting my head on the pillow, there was yelling and screaming going on in the hall. I patiently waited for it to stop - but after 30 minutes decided to call the front desk to report the issue. They said they would take care of it - and did for about 15 minutes - and then it started again. The entire night there was partying, yelling, singing, screaming, running, etc. going on in the hall and surrounding area. My colleagues and I were unable to sleep and after several calls to the front desk to complain, it was obvious that management wasn't going to address the situation. I checked out early in the morning and when asked how my stay was, I replied "noisy and awful". All the lady at the front desk did was shrug her shoulders and say "sorry". If you are 25 years old and want to party all night, this might be your hotel. If you want to get any sleep, I'd find a different place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “So So hotel - not as good as I hoped”
Reviews.Author: CathSi_Sth_America
Reviews.Content: The location is central hollywood and the Service is excellent - but the rooms only so so. The furniture a bit IKEA which is fine just not expected at the W I was not impressed and checked out after 1 night

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: SEHSEH
Reviews.Content: Great location for checking out LA and Santa Barbara. Odd that one side have all the 'must-see' sites and the other side, a bit deserted! Regardless, a great location for getting around by foot or car. Place was ideal to get into the groove of the LA/Hollywood experience...fun and lots availalble for the ones who want to party, party in the evenings and w/ends. Rooms are great, but rooms on the west side (I believe), felt a bit dark - needed the natural light! Good toiletries and the Health Club was great. Ideal place for a break from the normal life and a real swanky feel up in the Pool Area!

Reviews.Title: “Very Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: PrestonW
Reviews.Content: I was planning my first visit to the LA area and wanted to spend a 3 days in Hollywood. This was one of a few hotels recommended to me by an acquaintance who lives in the area. I deliberated over the decision when I read the reviews here; finally I chose this hotel based on location and booked a suite. The customer service does shine, but now I understand some of the previous reviews that had given me pause. My visit got off to a bad start. I waited nearly 2 hours for my room to be ready when I arrived and was afraid I was going to need to ask to stay elsewhere. It is a busy hotel I understand, and these things happen and happily the rest of the visit went very well. What stood out for me was the friendly service and that anything I asked for seemed to become a priority to the team working at this hotel, from an umbrella to dinner reservations. I found all I had to do is ask, they don't anticipate but do respond extremely well to requests. The manager on duty was kind enough to escort me up to the roof so I could take some pictures of the LA skyline, mountains, and Hollywood sign since the roof was closed due to filming and it was first day the sun had come out of my visit. The concierge helped me with my airline reservations and with scheduling a haircut. Indeed - there is a busy party scene in the hotel lobby and the roof was off limits at night but to club patrons. However, that is not why I chose this hotel. I found that I was able to sleep well on the 9th floor, far enough away from the nightclub and lobby bar noise and actually had a very peaceful - if uneventful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Experience”
Reviews.Author: SBAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I normally do not stay at “party hotels” but was in town for a social event and thought it would be fun for a night to have the full Hollywood experience. The W does a great job of creating a unique and fun experience and offering a quality room with high service. Most of the staff is younger and truly seemed genuine in their efforts to make your stay a good experience. Room Tip: If you want a quite room, ask not to be placed near the top floor or above the lobby level. Both of these areas have loud music long into the night. I specifically asked for a quite room and was given what they call a “Fabulous Suite” on the 9th floor. The room was spacious, comfortable and very quite. Overall I really enjoyed my stay for the night. However, I would stay here only if you are in the mood to have a good time. This is not a business hotel or a romantic getaway type of property. Dinner Tip: We had an amazing sushi diner at a nearby restaurant called Katsuya. It was expensive, but the service was excellent and the food was creative and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: drumaville
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried after I booked through Priceline, and started to read some reviews. My wife and I were there with our 7 year old for 2 nights. The hotel is great, the rooms were large, and decorated very modern. The staff were 99% fantastic, from valet, front desk, housekeeping, and yes, even the big guys working the velvet rope when you tried to get back into the place. My wife was a little bemused when she asked Concierge the quickest way back from Universal Studios and got the answer, "Don't you have navigation?" My experience with Concierge was great. The few downsides were the cost of in room amenities, $9 for a bottle of water, c'mon. There is a Trader Joes around the corner on Vine, and plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Valet cost is the only other complaint, $35 a night. I'd rather park across the street and tip the Bellman $35 to bring my stuff to the room. You'd get great service and save money. I'll still stay there in the future though.

Reviews.Title: “Not for quiet people!”
Reviews.Author: J_Legal
Reviews.Content: With a prime location on Hollywood Blvd, this hotel is definitely a place for partygoers. If you're not (like me, when on a business trip), well, go somewhere else! First things first, I was there on business during Halloween weekend. The place was crawling with party animals... Both inside and outside! For some unknown reason, my room turned out to be very quiet even with in-room parties just à few doors down the hallway! Travelling on business is very différent than travelling for leisure! But the thing than bugged me the most is the HEAVY in-room mercantilsm! The rooms are mini-malls! You are afraid of being charged to use the soapbar in the washroom! If you are a party animal with unlimited financial resources with a craving need to see and be seen, this is your place! If not, consider other options! As the tag attached to the spare roll of toilet paper says, you need a "back up plan"!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hype not as high end as you'd expect”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm too old for the W. It is a scene. The entire lobby. Think Hard Rock hotel style. When we walk in the hotel lobby was a party pretty much of a cross of industry people, hipsters, college co-eds and cougars. Very fancy decor and lots of good people watching. The rooms were so-so. The furniture was uber modern and some of it could've been from IKEA which is fine just not expected at the W. They did have a perch of a couch which doubled as a single bed when we had a friend that was unable to drive home stay. All the bathroom products are Bliss products so that was nice. We had a lovely view of the Valet. In terms of location, it's right on Hollywood Blvd in the middle of everything. There's a farmers' market a few blocks away on Sundays which is one of the best in LA. The Palladium is only 2 blocks away. So if you are looking for a scene you will get here. Go to be scene.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Glam!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal801
Reviews.Content: From our pre checklist email to check out, service was spectacular. The staff at the hotel really do work to make your dreams come true. Prior to our arrival, I received an email, from the W Insider" basically asking me if I would like anything particular in my room. I had a short list of items that generally are only time consuming when having to wait for delivery (shower cap, wine glasses, additional pillows) all which were in our room upon arrival. So refreshing! Upon check in we were upgraded to a wonderful suite which was retro Hollywood glam. White leather couch, floor to ceiling, curtain room divider, huge tub, with separate rain shower, wet bar, ..everything set us for a great weekend. We had dinner reservations and used the complimentary Acura Transportation. The driver was extremely nice, and did not want to take the gratuity from us. Hotel: Like our room. Hollywood glam Lobby is a great place for a cocktail and people watching. Definetly a gathering place for a hip crowd. Outside bar and patio have a great ambiance especially the evening. Something to note, as a personal preference. The outside lounge has great music, but very difficult to carry on a conversation. Oddly, there was guy trying to play a saxophone to the music. Kind of disturbing. Not sure if his presence was intentional or not. Room: Higher floors need access via the elevator. We were on the second floor where all access was available. Lots of partying noise happening. The presence of security would have helped. Bed: Super Comfortable with great linens. Bath: Commode is separate from bath and shower. Bath products are Bliss Spa. Lemony Fresh. Draiis Restaurant: Though we did not get a chance to dine there we heard very good things about the food. Around 11PM the restaurant becomes a night club. You can hear the club all through the hotel, including rooms. Plan on enjoying the evening until the music stops. We wanted to go to the club, and were told that, as guests, we would have VIP entrance, but did not get a chance to take advantage of the service. We were told the cover charge is $20 each. There is a restaurant on the lobby level where we tried to have breakfast, but as soon as we got to the door it was closed. We were told that there was a very large group attending apx 90, that they forgot were coming. The concierge was very nice and made some recommendations for local breakfast. This was the only "glitch" during our stay. Area: Everything on Hollywood Blvd is within walking distance. Pantages Theater across the street. Walk of stars right outside the hotel. Shopping: Touristy Junk-my opinion. For any really shopping you will need to drive. Parking. Valet at $40 per night. Across the street $10-unsecured, Not worth it in my book. The area can get a bit "iffy" at night. Just be smart and aware and you will be fine. Is this a re do? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time is a charm :)”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that my 1st experience with the W Hollywood was less than steller , but in their defense it was in the 1st few days of opening and as a club venue property i am sure it is easy to have things go haywire at the beginning....after voicing my frustration to a degree i spoke to Jim the GM at depth about my concerns and thoughts...I was suprised at how open minded he was about the criticism and his eagerness to change my views on the property and staff. I did revisit the property under my fiancee's name and SPG acct so that we wouldnt get any special consideration due to speaking with Jim....happy to say that we had a great time...were given a great upgraded room (my Fiancee is also a platinum SPG so upgrade was available)...staff was very friendly and room service was quik "and' good....now remember this is a Niteclub venue as well...and you should know that when booking your resv...the hotel tries its best to accomodate its guests in regards to the venue and the pool but as in LV, the venue also has a greater degree of control on access etc so make nice to the venue mgrs via the hotel staff or the WW staff... Pool is a bit small but has a goood vibe and yes lots n lots of beautiful people....even some that were never invited to the party,,lol yes the curb and valet staff do need some work and some lessons on manners but remember most of them its their first job and with a property like the W they probably wont last long or wil be trained appropriately as time goes on...remember staff reflects mgmt and the Mgmt there definately wants to put its best foot forward so suffice to say that nothing is perfect but sometiems a willingness to be perfect is just as good... i will definately recommend W Hollywood to my friends....my only regret is that i didnt get to meet Jim McPartlin (GM) sooner as he is a great guy who has had to practically re learn his job to deal with all of the new age way of running a Niteclub Venue Hotel and i must say he has done a wonderful job...The good thing is that he will be going to the W NYC soon so since we are there often i am sure that we will still be able to enjoy another venue run by a Top Notch W Veteran such as Jim.... Thx Guys and see you again soon...

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Seattle1313
Reviews.Content: I was not satisfied with this hotel. The room was tiny (as well as the bathroom) and the view was of a non-descript building about 40 feet away. The lighting makes the room feel cold and eerie. The rooms come equipped with plug-ins for mobile phone but the iPhone cord did not work. The food from room service was not good. I ordered an omelet for dinner (due to limited options) and huevos rancheros for dinner. I would not recommend either. I was well away from the elevator, on one of the lower floors, and there were odd (and loud) sounds throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood - First Class Fun!!!”
Reviews.Author: zw206177
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W in Hollywood for 3 nights on our way back from Bora Bora (End of Honeymoon). The hotel had awesome parties in the lobby each night that had a real "Hollywood" feel to them. The location is perfect for walking to restaurants/bars along with their complimentary Acura shuttle service... The pool on the rooftop was straight out of an episode of HBO's Entourage and turned into quite a party at night. The place had something for everyone. Was even more impressed with the service. Everyone from the front desk, to the bell hops to the concierge remembered our name. They would get our car ready when we walked into the lobby and really made you feel like you were catching some of the Hollywood A-List treatment. Most impressive was their concierge service. They booked us dinner reservations at a totally full restaurant (we were denied reservations earlier in the night). They even helped us get back stage passes/front row seats at the Jay Leno show (we got to meet Jay). Not only over the top friendly service, but they had over the top RESULTS. My wife is a gym nut, and loved the SWEAT gym. Was big enough to be a high school workout room. All in all, if you want a real taste of Hollywood, forget the over priced Beverley Wilshire, stay at the W in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice even if you are not a hipster.”
Reviews.Author: PaVistor19460
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in downtown Hollywood. We stayed for 7 days. The room was really nice. The view not so much. It was a parking lot. Room service was delivered on time and was very good. The restaurant inside the hotel had very good food and a very bad server. She was terrible. The manager realized this after out of 7 people 2 of us had not gotten our dinners. He quickly had our meals made and comped us for our drinks and dessert. The lobby is a great place to sit and watch all kinds of people. The lobby is a very cool place. Mirrors & stairs and a large open area. The management was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Hollywood Experience with the Young, Hip, Beautiful People”
Reviews.Author: lvsigchi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel Hollywood on a Friday night. Check in was a breeze, we actually checked in 30 minutes early. The hotel was very nice and upscale. It is right is the heart of Hollywood, across the street from the Pantages Theater. Plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance. I would recommend Dillon's Irish Pub and Miceli's Italian Restaurant. Our room was on the 6th floor and had a king size bed. The room was very large and very modern. The view was of the courtyard and Hollywood Blvd. One thing to be aware of is the hotel is very noisy at night. From our room, we could hear the people in the courtyard bar and the club music. Also valet parking is $35 a night and there is no self parking. I guess this is now the norm for LA/Hollywood, but never-the-less, I think this is excessive. If you are coming into town and want to experience the real Hollywood with a hip, young, beautiful crowd this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Guards”
Reviews.Author: Sadid A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here since it is close to many locatations. I did like the hotel but was amazaed the way the security guards treated me, and the night guard was extremely rude and unprofessional in his conduct. these guys should realize that anyone could be a guest. mostly i observed that the guards were busy talking to women that hung in the lobby rather than focus attentively on who is entering the guest only areas (vegas does a much better job at this). The front desk is very polite and try to help you in anyway they can. I got luck and got a room that was quiet. basically set your expecations to a minimum because this hotel is not a typlical starwood property, this hotel tries to uses the exclusivity of hollywood as a reason for not being able to accomodate your request even if you're a big spender. as for the rooms, they are not something special, in fact it's better if you go outside the country and spend as much because at least in a foregin country you'd get better decor. oh any other request you have is not accomodate because W is a green certified hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W-ow!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica L
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews on this site, I had my reservations about the W Hollywood. However, staying at the W turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. Prior to the trip I spoke with Jim, the General Manager, and asked for his recommendation on a room. He put us on the 8th floor, with incredible views of the Hills and surrounding areas. From the moment we walked in, our room was everything we could have wanted and more. A comfortable bed, beautiful crisp decorations, and nice bathroom - along with great amenities. The location of the hotel is great for Graumans, the Hollywood Farmers Market, Katsuya, and other attractions on and around Hollywood Blvd. We were able to walk each morning, and even spotted a few celebraties near the hotel. For further distances (up to 5 miles) the Acura experience is certainly worth trying, and a great way to save a cab fare. As far as the nose compliant, we never had any trouble with it (though we are still in our 20s so we enjoy a good bar). In fact, we spent one night drinking downstairs at the Living Room and really enjoyed the feel, not to mention the fact that we were only an elevator ride to our room. Finally, and most importantly, the staff at the hotel goes above and beyond, In all of my travels I have never met so many nice people, willing to go out of their way to insure you have a wonderful vacation, especially Jim. They made sure every part of our trip was even more magical than we had hoped, and I cannot wait to visit again very soon. So if you are on the fence about visiting, I certainly recommend you try the W for yourself. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “From DC to LA”
Reviews.Author: LiberalElitist
Reviews.Content: and I decided to stay at the W-Hollywood, which was a nice hotel, however, the room was sparsely decorated and the bed wasn't comfortable. I was in town for the Syracuse/USC game so it was pretty exciting to be in Hollywood/LA. The staff at the W-Hollywood was courteous and the food at The Living Room was good. I had the cheeseburger, I know-only a cheeseburger, but it was really good or maybe I was just really hungry after a long flight from the East Coast. The scene in The Living Room was your standard "come to be seen crowd" with attractive women, high priced drinks, and lots of velvet ropes. One of the marquee clubs "Drai's" which is adjoined to the W-Hollywood offered no express admittance to W guests. You had to get on line like everyone else, which was kind of shocking being that you would think the two entities would have a good working relationship. For the price I paid to stay at the W-Hollywood there was nothing exceptional to make me want to stay there again othere than to say "oooh I stayed at The W-Hollywood".

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel”
Reviews.Author: losangelesgirl20
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the fall for 3 nights and had a good experience. The rooms are big and comfortable, though there was only a shower and no soaking tub like I've enjoyed at other W hotels. The service was very helpful and friendly. My only 2 warnings would be that the vibe in the lobby is a bit cheesy hollywood, so probably wouldn't recommend for families. Also, I was disappointed that you couldn't visit the spa without a treatment appointment. At other W's I've stayed at, you can go relax in the sauna after a long day of work, which is always a plus. All in all, I would stay at this hotel again. It was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Loved it and Coming back soon!!”
Reviews.Author: hujout
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here once and had a fantastic time. The location is perfect if you ask me being easily accessible to both the Hollywood sites and great food. I essentially live in a Westin during the week for work and we've been able to stay at W's and Le Meredian's on my Starwood points just about everywhere (San Francisco, NYC, Washington DC, London, Munich, etc) and the W Hollywood is literally probably my favorite hotel in the world. The only unfortunate part of our stay was that the pool was closed so I didn't get to experience that and we weren't able to get a view of Hollywood Blvd. That being said we were offered points upon check-in for the inconvenience. I've been looking forward to next weekend's return visit for months and probably over selling it to my girlfriend. I can see this hotel becoming our regular for visits to Los Angeles!

Reviews.Title: “Total taken care of...”
Reviews.Author: Kwalter827
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an outstanding experience during our stay at this W hotel. I travel a lot and have stayed at numerous W hotels. You can expect the same high level of comfort and service here and then some. This place is obviously well managed as the staff are spot on with all of their mad service skills and attention to details. They also know how to engage you in a way that makes you feel comfortable and "at home" or like one of the many celebrities they must pamper. Kudos out to Cassie and Marci as some of the best servers and hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Atmosphere & Service Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the W in Hollywood. I stayed there from Thursday, Septemmber 22 to Monday September 26. I actually was supposed to leave on the sunday, but due to delays trying to get to the airport I ended up staying another night. Quite frankly, I didn't mind missing my flight :). The atmosphere at the W was incredible. Every night was a party down in the lobby and on the patio out back. I can't say enough about the service from all the staff. In particular, Zach at the concierge was great. He got us a last minute res at Boa in West Hollywood - great place by the way. He also arranged for me to stay another night when requested. On the patio out back, Beth was an amazing server and remembered us and our drinks. Maureen at the front desk was fantastic as well. All staff were great really. I will definitely stay there again! By the way, don't waste your time going to Drai's - not as good as the lobby or patio bars!

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Fun, Relaxed - Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: awydler
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just spent a weekend at this great hotel, and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay. First of all, this hip property is perfectly managed - from the check in to room service to reservations for restaurants and cabanas at the uber-fab pool, the friendly and energetic staff was right "on it" and got things done right away. Then, the rooms are very modern, stylish, comfortable, and well equipped, with a huge, chic, white marble bathroom. And finally, the roof-top pool, a veritble model/actor runway of LA's hip and fabulous, is a scene by itself, with Drai's, the restaurant and night club next to it, serving some of the best food in LA. Not inexpensive (as other reviewers have noted) but worth every penny if you're in for the ultimate LA experience.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant surprise”
Reviews.Author: luxurytravelguru
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was plesantly surprised as we had just arrived from the fabulous Four Seasons in New York. Yes it is a tad glitzy and red but the rooms and public spaces are great and clean.
