Cocktails and snacks at the outside lounge more than I expected and perhaps the music and vibe a bit loud for some, but I enjoyed it. My travel companion was upgraded to a suite because of my Starwood status which was nice and the rooms more than adequate and yes flashy. We spent an afternoon by the pool in a cabana and although there was some maintenance going on we had a very plesant time with the rate including all you can eat and drink and so quite good value! The valet, bell hop, maintenance services etc were all very good. I would definitely recommend this place for the 20-40 somethings.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hollywood at it's finest!”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Ddog
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the "Fabulous" rooms, I think it was called. I loved the modern feel of the room and the whole hotel. The bed was awesome and really comfortable. The complimentary coffee the next morning was fantastic! We were however, very disappointed by the pool area. We went up to enjoy a drink and the view and ended up sitting there for about 15-20 minutes without being acknowledged once. The guy who was working up there made eye contact with me at least three times and still never came over to us. We ended up going downstairs and enjoyed drinks and appetizers in the outside area. The Kobe cheeseburger was amazing! My boyfriend and I still talk about it! Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the W and hope to enjoy it again sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel - poor service with staff too busy managing functions to even notice they have hotel guests”
Reviews.Author: HewiLondon
Reviews.Content: Great pool, just a shame that they sell tickets to use it to the general public- makes it almost unusable for hotel guests! We had to sit on the floor because there were no seats by the pool

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: maki2
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 days and it was just fabulous! The rooms are very stylish and the beds super comfy. I loved the bath bliss goodies. Check-in was very quick and friendly. A big thanks goes to the great concierge she did everything to feel you welcome at the hotel. Even organized us the hotel car without asking - what a nice surprise. The fitnessroom was also well equipped and really clean. The complimentary morning coffee was a nice thing too. The only con to mention is the club and the appendant poolarea. The club employees are so snoby and there is hardly ever any space at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “If your one of the beautiful rich then you will love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: linda31west
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights, lovely and clean. The room was very modern and comfortable. Any extras in the room are costly and there is no facility to make a hot drink. Water in your room is costly so purchase from the shop a few doors down. We didnt use the bar over the weekend as it was full of young, very overdressed americans. Found out later this was the party place in hollywood. We werent disturbed at night and found the staff very helpful when we asked for any advise. I would recommmend this hotel if you want a good party hotel at the weekend. it does quiet down in the week. It is a bit out of the way but catch the metro train or bus down to the main part of Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Jkampf
Reviews.Content: Funky hotel in a great location. The bars and restaurants are awesome, the staff are great and we will definitely be staying here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place but if you go to bed early”
Reviews.Author: Cherie017
Reviews.Content: and are a light sleeper... bring some earplugs. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms comfortable and new but if you are a light sleeper beware of the noise from Drai's the nightclub in the hotel. We were on the 6th floor and the club is attached and on the rooftop. We heard the music and the people till the wee hours. I am sure there must be some rooms where you don't hear it but the club is popular so be prepared for lots of action at night.

Reviews.Title: “LA - Celebrity style”
Reviews.Author: baudolino1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W as a family, the room had 2 queen size beds and it was decorated in typical W style. Our 2 girls loved it! As in all W's you get great toiletries, decor, and ambience. Everybody who works at the hotel looks like they are just waiting for a movie director to hire them, which gives the hotel an even further Hollywood feeling. The concierge service was below average for a W (we saw a guy, who did not pay much attention to us and a woman the next day who was more service-oriented). It still puzzles me why the W chain insists in ripping off guests with things like a $9 bottle of water in the room. If you stay at this chain and pay what they charge, you are already in a more select crowd, however, regardless of how much money you have, nobody enjoys the feeling of being taken advantage of. I think that either complimentary water or a $4 charge is more appropriate. Other than that, the pool is superb, great beds and lounge chairs to enjoy the pretty people... The lounge/lobby is great for a late night drink and people watching...

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Defn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel between 22nd August and 1st September 2011. I was a little aprehensive at first, not by the staff, they were lovely but by the items in the room that were for sale. I found it quite unnerving to be surrounded by items for sale in my room and had to be so careful not to open anything accidentally or it would be charged to my debit card and believe me, the prices were astronomical i.e. $9 for a bottle of water... WATER!!!! Not sure how closely Delphine is affiliated with the hotel itself but it seemed to be the same company... anyway, we had our first meal there and decided never to return. VERY expensive, food poor, service ok but not worth the prices. Our bill came to $110 and i didn't even have a starter and only one drink!!! My advice re eating? Drive to Mels Diner on Sunset, open 24/7 and the prices are amazing, food spot-on and service is the best. Anyway - hotel charge $5.95 for 15 minutes use of internet and $0.50 per printed black&white a4 sheet of paper... Disgusting!!!! So it cost me nearly $10 just to print our bording passes off to fly home. The room was nice, bathroom lovely and great shower but i found bed a bit hard. Apart from that though, room was great. Valet parking is $25 overnight with in/out which is pretty good but car park opposite charges $20 for 24 hours with in/out and is secure. There is a constant line of taxis that park alongside the car park at night so you can rest assured no damage will come to your car. Nice big TV in room with dvd player which was great. If you want to go to the pool on the roof, you can use it even though it is a different company to the hotel but beware, they will try to get you to buy food/drinks which are soooo expensive i.e. cocktails are $17 each, average bottle of spirit is around $500 EACH!!!! We sunbathed and used the pool for a couple of hours but felt uncomfortable not buying anything when we kept being asked. I think the hotel need to make it quite clear that the pool is nothing to do with them instead of using it as a huge selling point on website etc. Also the hotel seemed to be filled with people who have absolutely no consideration for other guests when returning to their rooms in the early hours of the morning because we were woken several times most nights!!! Weights in the gym could do with being a bit heavier and equipment varied more. Overall, my opinion was good but could do a whole let better.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting hotel”
Reviews.Author: enjoyTravelling2011
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, specially the party atmosphere. Also, the room decoration and the staff from the hotel (our luggage were lost and they help us with the airlines). If you stay here, go to the Dry’s Club, is fabulous

Reviews.Title: “LA Attitude at its worst”
Reviews.Author: matt2012ad
Reviews.Content: I have lived in LA for 16 years and am acustom to its good and bad points. But when friends were visiting they said they always stay at W hotels wherever they travel and asked me to arrange a stay at the Hollywood or West Hollywood W for them. I know the Hollywood location is brand new so that is what we went with. Sadly it turned out to be more attitude then substance. Each time we pulled in to the valet you could here the valets talking trash about the guests they had served previously. When you enter the Hotel there is not the usual friendly W hotel greeting, The room was surprisingly noy up to par in cleanliness. Most of all make no mistake especially on the weekends, this is a party hotel.. expect loud guests in all areas of the hotel, expect a club scene downstairs, and expect a lot of street noise entering your room.

Reviews.Title: “No Loyalty, Never Staying Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Loyalty_1st
Reviews.Content: I am a Gold SPG member. Maybe if I was Platinum I would have received better service. I am a frequent business traveler. I’m very loyal to SPG and only choose SPG hotels when traveling and would drive hrs to stay at a SPG hotel. But I wouldn’t drive 5 minutes to stay at W Hollywood again. I’ve stayed at several W Hotels but W Hollywood is the worst experience I’ve had with any SPG hotel. I was very excited to stay at W Hollywood since this was my first stay. I reserved an upgrade room 1 month in advance and was very disappointed at check in. I reserved a high floor and I was placed in a downgrade room on the 2nd floor. When I asked to be placed on a higher floor I was told all rooms were committed for late check out. A little puzzled by the response since I was checking in around 4:30, I asked what time is late check? I also stated I did not mind waiting for them to check out and to place my bags in a hospitality room while waiting for a clean room. I was told this was not an option and the only room available was a Cool Corner room which is $700 a night and they don’t upgrade guest to those rooms. I asked would I have access to Drai’s. I was told no that access to Drai’s is based on a reserved list and first come first serve. They made me feel as if it was a privilege to stay at their hotel rather than making me feel like a valued guest. I do not recommend this hotel if loyalty is what you want……….

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Hotel - Mixed Feelings Overall”
Reviews.Author: Jenick44
Reviews.Content: We are a couple in our late 20’s who are always up for a good time. We stayed here for 2 nights. Pros: Beautiful Hotel Great location Hollywood Blvd Comfy beds, clean room Lively atmosphere Friendly Staff Cons: #1 complaint – WARNING: The pool area does not feel like it is truly part of the hotel. It is managed/owned by Drai’s Nightclub (Las Vegas establishment). This means that it is more like a cocktail party than a swimming pool which is OK however they close the pool at 6pm on weekdays which means you are out of luck if you want a relaxing evening swim. Also on weekends they close the pool at NOON for a “Private Pool Party”. Cover charges apply and no more than 2 guests per room may attend. You also must have a reservation. This was my number one complaint. We felt that they sold out their guests to accommodate this night club. A major con in my books and for this reason I would NOT stay here again. Very Expensive - $9 bottles of water, $15 cocktails at Drai’s, $10 beers at Drai’s, $35 per night for parking plus tips, the list goes on…. Party Place – which we expected so it wasn’t a big deal but I would not recommend this hotel to a family. We were disturbed in our sleep by loud guests.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous/fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A-M-Gaby
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is absolutely the best hotel I have visited. The Bell/concierge/front desk associates offered outstanding guest services, they were all very friendly, respectful and very knowledgable. The pool is amazing, Drai's their rooftop restaurant was such a great unique dinning experience and the bar in the lobby was a very nice place to have a drink. I have noticed that a lot of the locals take advantages of the hotel restaurants/bar which in my opinion demonstrates how great they are! I had a small issue with my bill, emailed directly to GM and was pleased to receive a response within hours. You will feel glamorous and special when staying there. It is a fabulous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: SMM01
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the W Hollywood. All I can is "WOW". The suite was awesome, ultra contemporary furnishings, superb in room storage, fantastic service from the moment you drive up to hotel to the moment you depart, a definite hot spot for individuals of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Spin with Iconic Location!”
Reviews.Author: cityboyctr
Reviews.Content: The W Holly wood was a fabulous place to kick off a great vacation in the Los Angeles Area. It is Brand new, clean, and very in the now. From the decor to the small boutiques near the beautiful "living room" area of the lobby, you felt as if you were in a club atmosphere. This is not a place for families. The Pool Deck on the top floor has a bouncer and "fashionable Attire is Required". I stayed there with 3 other people and found the hotel to be in a great area and full of vibrance. Every night we returned to our room the exterior was filled with celebs and party goers hitting up the amazing restaurants and clubs connected to the W. The room was a little small but definitely worth the price. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Sionel
Reviews.Content: It's a W hotel so you know what you are getting in advance, and this one doesn't disappoint. Great service throughout, lovely rooms and an excellent on-site restaurant (that also delivers breakfast). The outdoor bar/lounge area is a good place to lap up the hot days and warm nights over great Californian wines. The location is excellent and what isn't made quite so clear is that it is bang on top of the metro station, meaning a trip into Downtown LA is maybe 15 minutes away from the hotel door at a cost of a couple of dollars. If you can afford this place and need a base from which to explore LA, it's excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilianapdl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and beautiful people. Everything was expensive but that is what the W is all about. Great service and had no problems with the staff. Parked across the street for $20 a day with in and out privledges. Beds are comfy. Loved the hair blow dry place below. Metro is right outside and a quick ride to the heart of hollywood. Stayed on 4th floor and never heard any noise from the hall or club. Was there for 7 nights. Would recommend and would love to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “SEX AND THE CITY FUN”
Reviews.Author: 2SPICY25
Reviews.Content: I visted the W HOTEL IN HOLLYWOOD for a girls nite out for my birthday.We LOVE LOVE LOVED IT.The hotel has a fun vibe all the way around.Theres an inside lounge were you can relax have a cocktail and see whos who.Than theres an outside lounge with a live dj when your ready to party.Theres a club on the outside (drais)but the hotel does a great job of keeping the club over flow out of the hotel.On the downside the pool closes a little early(5PM) the sun doesnt set until 8:30 on the west coast . The r ooms are a little more pricer than the Westwood location,but hey its Hollywood and the vibe is much better.Plus the cucumber martinis are to die for.Over all im from LA but this will be a future girls night out spot fasure.Fun Times

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for nightlife!”
Reviews.Author: QueenAsh
Reviews.Content: Pros- drais, living room, outdoor lounge are great to hangout. Great decor in main areas & rooftop pool is nice! Cons- rooms were not as great as I was expecting from a W. We could not get into drais unless we bought a bottle. They did not stamp the guys & then two of our guys could not get back in. Drais staff are incompetent. Overall- I would say this is a great place to stay if u wan t to party all weekend.

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: judyk77
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the W ,it was an amazing hotel, staff very helpful and friendly. we were with a group of business CEOs and their partners. The newness and cleanliness was great. We were lucky enough to have a suite, which was so large and roomy. we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great rooms especially during the week”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanhattanNyc
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is a hot spot on the weekend, which, unfortunately means that those staying in the hotel can't use the pool and the lounges. (Most people don't even want to go up there despite the amazing views, so this isn't a place to take kids during the weekend for a vacation.) The noise from the craziness at the pool during the day and the lounge at night isn't a factor up in the rooms, which is fantastic. If you are there during the week, it is a most amazing hotel. Weekday or weekend, the service is among the best I've seen. The staff remembers you between visits, they go out of their way to make your stay comfortable and pleasant. The beds are fabulous. The lighting nice and the temps in the rooms perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: NoCalJen
Reviews.Content: My 3 teenage girls and I stayed here for a couple nights. It is beautiful and will stay here again (normal hotel of choice has always been The Roosevelt.) A+ valet service - very nice, professional and fast! A+ front desk service - friendly & welcoming! A+ room service Beautiful hotel, rooms, restaurant and pool 1/2 mile walk to the Kodak Theatre/shops Last thing, there was a busy crowded party happening when we were walking back from shopping/dinner. I was a little nervous but the security let us right in the second we walked up, no wait, no stress - easy! Highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to party or go with their family.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to checking back in!”
Reviews.Author: Amaracampsbay
Reviews.Content: We loved our 12 night stay at the W Hollywood and the friendly staff, especially Matt, Matthew and Joey. We stayed with our 5 year old son and did not even use the nightclub but still enjoyed the vibe and love the excellent decor. We look forward to checking back in as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Tredy Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlohaGiselle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. All the staff are young and attractive. They wanted to be discovered from the Hollywood producers. However, the service is not like the other W hotels. I think the staff's main motive is to be discovered so they are not customer service. If you are in any entertainment business, this hotel is recommended. Personally I prefer Bevery Hills area hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Epic place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Buenosnachos
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of friends for a birthday party and couldn't have asked for more. Friendly valet, pro bellman, front desk agent pleasant. Suite ready early for check in as requested. Adjoining room as requested. View of Hollywood, Griffith park observatory and downtown LA as requested.W insider Chris N took us up to Drai's pool party and past short line to get in. Dj playing and sun shining. Pretty laid back good vibe and some very good looking people. Back to room to shower etc and out to dinner. Used complimentary Acura service to local restaurant which saved a few bucks. Taxi back. A couple of cocktails in room and back down to meet Chris N and go to Drai's. Past super long X games weekend lines to front and up elevator to the club. Drai's is separate from the W so no promises to get into club disclosed up front but Chris worked his magic and for a 1 bottle service fee we had the prime poolside canopy daybed by the door of the club. Yes it cost about $500 for bottle after tax/tip but no cover for 8 of us and we got a bottle of booze and a place to chill so totally worth it. Pro waitress was pro, friendly and unhollywood. Diverse and friendly crowd. Wifey got a pic with one of the actors from Glee? OK. Next morning breakfast at Delphine. Maybe best breakfast I've had - scramble in puff pastry. Again, pro waitress. Thanks W hotel. We had an excellent time. No it's not cheap if you want to do it right. Hotel is for young party crowd but service was comparable to ritz or 4 seasons from my experience. Got a killer rate from Brigitte Brown at Magellan vacations and she put in all the special requests that we got hooked up with. Who are these people? I found them by googling but you have to call and speak to agent. Rate for suite was seriously $200 less than through star wood or expedia. I suggest calling Brigitte at Magellan if going to this W. I think i will check with h before booking any travel in future. Hope I get to back sometime but it was such a good time i doubt it can be topped so probably won't.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Hollywood!!! such a gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: mandy70
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood was absolutely gorgeous! We booked the Wonderful Room for 6 nights. We flew in on a flight from Sydney Australia and we couldn’t wait to freshen up at our hotel. We arrived at the door of our room and we noticed the peep hole had diamontes around it! very stylish touch to Hollywood! As we walked into our room we were completely blown away at how cute and neat everything was. The bathroom was gorgeous and very very clean, the bed was to die for – so comfy and relaxing and the Grey Goose vodka bottle sitting on the stylish bar caught our eye immediately!! They also changed the mats on the elevator floor to say "Good Morning" "Good Afternoon" "Good Evening" cute little touch! Straight away we freshened up and made our way out to explore Hollywood Boulevard!! The lobby was gorgeous – a nice bar, couches and people everywhere. Free WIFI is also in the lobby area but if you want to use it in your room then you’ll need to pay a charge. Along Hollywood Boulevard there are a couple of dining options. There was a great little chicken eatery – good selection of chicken and chips! YUM!! A little further down I have to recommend KATSUYA – the best sushi I have ever tasted. I recommend trying the Panko Chicken – very delish!!!! DRAI’S nightclub is also a part of the hotel. Don’t expect to get in straight away just because you are a hotel guest. Luckily we are girls and had an aussie accent – that got us in after a little wait! Great great great club!!! Funky atmosphere and a lot of fun! I would definitely recommend staying at the W – beautiful hotel, friendly people, a couple of food options and a cute place to experience the “Hollywood” lifestyle!

Reviews.Title: “A very happening place”
Reviews.Author: PALMSPRINGSCOUPLE48
Reviews.Content: The staff were the greatest...made you feel very special....Social party pool scene on Friday and Saturday afternoons are something to watch...everyone just talks and hang with total strangers...the lobby area is the place to be seen in the evennings...my wife and I will return soon as we live in Palm Springs Ca

Reviews.Title: “They really made our trip fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: dougnkris
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently took my two young nieces (ages 7 and 9) to see Shrek at the Pantages, and we stayed across the street at the W Hollywood. After making my reservation, I emailed the hotel manager and ask if the room we booked would give my nieces a nice view, since it was their first time to Hollywood, or if we should change to a different type of room. Not only did they ensure we had a fantastic room with a perfect view of the Pantages and Capital Records, but they even sent over treats for us to enjoy before the theatre! My nieces were in heaven, prancing around in their hotel robes and sipping sparkling cider from martini glasses. The hotel staff were all very helpful and very nice. The maid for our floor even got to know our names and chatted with my nieces every time she saw them. We had a great time and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Samuli208
Reviews.Content: This was a superb experience. Friendly staff and everything works as expected. All Hollywood just on your doorstep. The rooms are nice and fashionable. You can see the Hollywood sign from the rooftop terrace. Overall this is what you would expect from a 4 star design hotel. I wouldn't know about the extra services they offer, but I could expect them to be on the highest standards as well. I will definately stay in W hotels around the world also in the future. I would recommend to anyone, who is tired of empty promises from other hotel chains. W hotels are guaranteed quality!

Reviews.Title: “Very hip”
Reviews.Author: Valerie C
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed here while visiting our kids who live in L.A. I must say, the lobby is very impressive! It is bustling with people. The bar area is very open and part of the lobby, plus there is a very cool bar area outside with couches and fire pits. We were upgraded to a suite and it was amazing. There was a circular sofa in the middle of the huge room with a sheer white curtain around it and a disco ball overhead! Very over the top. We only had an issue with our tv--could never get it to work. Finally, we called down and a worker was sent up. All it needed was a new battery. However, when we went to turn it on the next day, it said Set Lock: On and still wouldn't work. We just gave up. A minor issue. The bath products are all Bliss and fantastic. Bathroom was also huge.The workout room is okay, not that big, but acceptable. I went up to the pool on my last day and wish I hadn't waited to see it. It is on the roof with a gorgeous view, lots of cabanas, and almost feels decadent. I did not go to the Drai nightclub, but I peeked in during the day (it's apparently VERY popular), and it was really neat. I wish I could have stayed here more than 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome...will be returning soon.”
Reviews.Author: 1deluxcaligirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in great centrally located area. Easy to access from the metro redline (the station is below the hotel). Hotel was clean, decor was ecclectic & rooms contained many amenities. The in-room bath products were many of the items I regularly use by BLISS! We had a fantastic time at the hotel, we were in town to see a show & while there were many establishments close to the hotel we came back to enjoy the lounge & outdoor pool deck. Our expereince was pleasurable & we'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “If it is a night club what you are looking for then you ll love this hotel!?!”
Reviews.Author: SigoSema
Reviews.Content: Stayed in W Hollywood from 20th to 23rd on July 2011. Lets start with the upsides: It is a new and chic hotel in the center of Hollywood. Location is just perfect. Surrounded with many sightseeing points, nice bars and restaurants and many more. It is on the Hollywod boulevard, what else would you want?:) Fabulous king rooms are big enough for 2 people. Everything is brand new in the room, bed is super comfy, bathroom is equipped well with everything you need, electronic stuff is cool and fun. Downsides: Dont expect to see any nice, smiling or helpful staff. Every time you ask questions about anything they seem like you are bothering them or your question is too silly to ask. Especially reception staff! We stayed for 3 days and maybe we got the chance to see them all but they are all same. Shame for the name of W. There are 2 nightclubs in the hotel. One in the entrance area and one in the rooftop. These 2 clubs are always active and crowded in the evening and at night. Especially because of the one in the entrance area; reception, elevators, sitting area etc are always crowded. You see kids and adults (strange mix of people) wandering around with drinks in hand. Some of them drunk and speaking loudly or bothering you in the elevator while transfering to the roof bar from the down bar. Some of these party people are also staying at the hotel for a night and if they are staying next to your room, you are in trouble. There are no rules or regulations at the hotel to put all of these in order. Unfortunately it seemed to us that customers who come to nightclubs and spend a couple of hours in this hotel are more valuable than the customers who actually stay in this hotel and pay much more than the party animals. Dont even think about touching the drinking water in the room. It is 9 dollars. All extras are too expensive. Buy your own stuff from the supermarkets around and keep your money to yourself. Noise of the music from the clubs will always come to your room. Be prepared for that. If you are sensitive, you wont be able to sleep easily after a long day of discovering the city. I kept the most shocking thing to the end. When we entered the room, we found a post it on the LA guide book written by the previous guest saying: "Dont let your 200 dollars to puff in the air!!" How is that? :) If i go to LA again, i wont be staying in W for sure. But of course it always depends on your taste. It just wasnt for us!

Reviews.Title: “nicest w we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: TStroud
Reviews.Content: wow. this was the nicest w we've ever stayed at, and one of the nicest hotels. The staff was amazing. Anything that we needed ( the Lexus is a nice touch) we had immediately. thank you for everything! if we're ever back in this area, we will definitely be back again. loved the w hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “In Europe, this would be a five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: cerv
Reviews.Content: My first time in America confirmed that everything really is bigger there. The hotel felf very comfortable, with roomy, well appointed room, sumptuous minibar and wonderfull breakfast menu. No buffet, though, a la carte only. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Ford design, equipment, roominess, convenience and all that really matters this hotel felt more like what I know is good five-star standard in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Focus is on bar/club life, not on being a good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AliTexas
Reviews.Content: My family did what a lot of people do - search online looking for a good hotel to stay during a family vacation. Wanting to stay in Hollywood (in all the action) we thought the W Hollywood would be a good choice as they generally have a good reputation. We were completely wrong. We would have switched hotels had I not been stupid and prepaid before our arrival. The rooms are tiny, no newspaper unless you ask, no coffee make unless you ask, $35 a day for them to park your car via valet (didn't see that one coming). Rude staff that didn't seem to care. The focus at this hotel is the nightclub/bar scene, not being a good hotel. The staff acted like you were bothering them if you had a question/concern. Upon our arrival the floor we were staying on smelled like vomit/stale beer. I had to ask three times for it to be taken care of. Ridiculous. The cleaning staff must have learned how to clean by watching Sanford and Son TV show. Dirty used glasses left to greet us at night upon our arrival back to the hotel and trash left around the room. Light bulbs out in the bathroom as well - another call downstairs. Not good for families who want to go swimming either. The pool closes at 6 p.m. - have to get ready for the bar/club scene again! Also, something that is one of the craziest room designs I have ever seen - there is a window to the bathroom where everyone in the room can watch you - nice, huh? Whatever. Needless to say, but this place has guaranteed that we will never stay in a W hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Sebs312
Reviews.Content: Having read most of the reviews online I was not sure what to expect from this hotel. However, I found the hotel to be one of the best stays I've had. The service was excellent, and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. The gym is adequately equipped although located in a remote area of the hotel. There is little noise from Drai's club even beneath it. The hotel is ideally located for tourists near tour bus stops. The major downside of the hotel is the cost of food and parking valet. The rooms themselves are styled to perfection and provide comfortable nights. I do think that the hotel needs to improve on accommodating the younger guests, as there is little to do, and there are many young adults roaming around.

Reviews.Title: “Party City”
Reviews.Author: maverickguy
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice and clean. Staff, super friendly. The restaurant Delphine, is very good (they make the best omelette ever). BUT one major problem, the hotel was overrun with 20 something party kids. How they can afford the rates there I don't know (our theory is that a big group gets one room and all cram in for the night). Maybe there was a spoiled brat convention in town. There were hordes of noisy drunken "kids" all night long prowling the hotel. There was even a fight going on in the hall outside our room in the wee hours. Another time in the middle of the night a big group came into the room nextdoor with all of them yelling and laughing at the top of their voices. Kids today! I don't know if it is like that all the time there, but that was our experience.

Reviews.Title: “W on top of their game.”
Reviews.Author: Isramerican
Reviews.Content: First, I have stayed in various W hotels before, but I can honestly say that this was the best stay to date. The service was great.....concierge was friendly, knowledgeable (perfect breakfast recommendations) and courteous. Front desk staff was attentive, welcoming and, yes....beautiful. Pool is amazing and the staff was nice. Restaurant food (and food by the pool) was great. Overall, another great W experience and I will choose the W again when I come back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best...”
Reviews.Author: Missie1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is "ok". No coffee in room, nor any ever in the lobby, noisy, no newspapers. Overpriced for what one receives to say the least. Have stayed in much nicer hotels with lesser price and more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “never again...”
Reviews.Author: expresspanda
Reviews.Content: I had booked a king-bed room online and requested an extra bed. Since nobody answered my e-mail I called from overseas and was promised a double queen-bedroom. "sorry, there's nothing we can do for you ma'am" was the answer upon arrival - my work-colleague had to sleep on the windowseat! Staff was not very helpful, they don't bother to speak more slowly with tourists who are not in perfect command of the language, no smiles... The room was nice, I must admit but the bedsheet had stains and the prices of the mini-bar are horrifying (9$ for water) Furthermore they wanted to charge us for the valet parking which we had not used but what shocked me most is that you have to pay 15$ for wi-fi access! Unheard of! If you become a Premium member it's free... wrong marketing strategy I guess for I will never go back to any W hotel, sorry...

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the middle of Hollywood chaos”
Reviews.Author: TOtravelerToronto
Reviews.Content: Our family loves W Hotels and stays at them whenever we can. There were four of us, including 2 kids under 10, and while we didn't exactly fit the target demographic of the hotel, we were still made to feel absolutely welcome by the staff. The hotel -- especially the rooftop bar/pool -- feels like a stylish club. Our room featured two queen beds, and a sitting area by the window -- plenty of space, considering W rooms aren't known for being large. The location is tough to beat -- Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater, Hollywood Bowl, Universal Studios, Pantages are all just a few minutes away by car or by foot. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Stylish & Classy”
Reviews.Author: imprsv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at W Hollywood for 5 nights on the start of my USA trip and boy What a fantastic hotel. This Hotel was the standout for all hotels that i stayed at over my 5 week vacation over the US, the bed was comfortable the amentites were excellent being up to date. The staff were a highlight of the trip, with us arriving early at 9am they accommodated us and found us a room promptly, both of the concierges knew their stuff extremely well and made it a pleasure to get around LA. If only i had of known there was a W in every place i visited, i would have just stayed there if i knew it was going to be so good.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, excellent hotel if you don't mind lots of noise”
Reviews.Author: Wijaho
Reviews.Content: Everyone is great about this hotel except the noise both inside and outside. Ensure you get a room away from the plaza as well as from noisy neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, very good positioned”
Reviews.Author: DieterHoffmann
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the W-Hotel in End of June. The hotel is very modern furnished, the rooms have a good size and all services are available ( eg. WiFi is free ) The breakfast ist very good, may even a bit expensive. The Hotel is very central located; direct at the Hollywood Boulevard and Sunset. Attractions like the Univeral Studios are only 15 min by Taxi away or 2 stops with the underground. The Hotel staff is very friendly and very helpful. If you visit Hollywood, its an exellent hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “So pretty!”
Reviews.Author: jenziebenzie
Reviews.Content: The trip was great, other than some of the people going up to the rooftop party Thursday night, but the view from the rooftop pool is pretty amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you like a party scene, otherwise it's too loud and you can't get into the pool!”
Reviews.Author: wdseattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with Starwood points and choose this hotel because we wanted to be in Hollywood to be close to restaurants and bars in the area. The W in Hollywood has the biggest "scene" I've ever seen, the pool was having a pool party on the day we arrived and even if we could have found somewhere to sit or lay down the music was so loud we wouldn't have wanted to. This is not a good place to stay for families or couples who want great service, romance or relaxation. If you want a party and you like dressing to be seen stay here - I would have loved this in my early 20's. Service was mediocre. Music was too loud. Rooms are nice and clean - very modern, not cozy. There is a lot of noise because of the club on the top level - which is owned by someone else so you can't get in if you are a hotel guest anyways unless you are famous or a model. Skip this hotel unless you are in entertainment. Stay at the Westwood W - we heard it's gorgeous and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: The W chain are not hotels! They are nightclubs with rooms. And this one is the worst. During a 3 night stay I need to return to the lobby 5 times to get a key to work. The front desk apologized each time and said "This happens all the time." One entrance is all the glitz and glamour you would expect in Hollywood the other side is the entrance to the subway and is peopled with homeless begging and yelling at you for staying in a ritzy hotel. The courtyard play LOUD music until midnight and even on the 5th floor the bass vibrated. Don't go higher because the lounge on the top assails you there. Don't expect to be able to see in the bathroom because the lighting is awful. They advertise coffee in the lobby but like the hotels slogan WHATEVER WHENEVER it means WHATEVER W WANTS WHENEVER W WANTS IT. Do expect to see beautiful looking staff because that seems to be the ONLY criteria used to get a job here. Brains are extra.

Reviews.Title: “very glamorous in a not so glamourous part of town...”
Reviews.Author: Swisswifey
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a not so nice end of Hollywood Boulevard. There is a great place next door for tapas but little else very close by. Great location for universal studios. The hotel appears to attract a more rowdy guest than we are used to and we listened to room doors being opened and closed - loudly- for most of the night. Earplugs were definitely needed. Someone needs to teach the breakfast staff that toast isn't just warm bread !! Also its not really much of an upgrade if you offer us a suite but explain that the jazz band will keep us awake until 2.30 if we accept. Its not cheap but it was a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Robin8300
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel from the moment we checked in they made our kids feel so special and played up the glamourous part of the first time to Holloywood trip. Beautiful rooms and spacious common areas. Drai's restaurant was fabulous and why go anywhere else when you can the elevator to the "rooftop" for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Hip, Comfy, Slick”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Octon
Reviews.Content: The W on Hollywood Blvd is awesome. Brilliant location. You're exactly where you want to be to go anywhere you want in LA. Our room was huge, comfy, modern, slick, reminded me of a room I once had in Vegas, but nicer. The devil is in the details, after all, and the W is all about the details. For instance, the look-holes in the doors are embedded with sparkly rhinestones! So cool. I love the carpeted hallways, the modern lighting, the bar, The Living Room, Delphine Restaurant, the outdoor hang out deck, the pool, the gym. The place is stocked! I highly recommend. Staff is friendly, attractive, and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “The "W" hotel rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: neecypie
Reviews.Content: My stay at the w was awesome. the staff was awesome, nice, friendly. I felt like a queen. and my room was so pretty. I loved it. Id love to get a suite one day. maybe next time for an anniversary or something. The guy that drove us around in the acura the first day was funny, cute, and very cool. He was informative and had a great personality. the pool was amazing! I loved the lobby when they played music and had tons of people. Id go back just to hang out at the pool, and enjoy the beautiful atmosphere, and music. waitresses were so nice to us and even took lots of pics of us by most of the staff. My husband said drinks were expensive, but overall had nothing bad to say about the hotel. he's even hard to please, so i guess that counts for someting right? I love u "W" hotel! it was nice meeting you! oxoxoxoxox until next time! Your new friend "Denise"!

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GPKjr
Reviews.Content: Walking into the W Hotel is a treat like no other. The decor is nothing less then spectacular-- modern and chic. The restaurant, spa and people watching are top notch! The service was some of the best we have experienced. There are numerous spots to eat and have a drink. Kudos to the chef who prepared a dinner for us that was one of the best we have had. The location was right in the heart of Hollywood in walking distance to the main attractions. The room was done to perfection with beds that are the ultimate in comfy. We highly recommend this hotel if your visiting La or if you live close by and just want to treat yourself to a night or two away. You can't miss with this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Treat!”
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel celebrating our 47th wedding anniversary. This definitely was the highlight of our trip! The hotel is perfectly situated on the corner of Hollywood & Vine, with a Metro stop under the hotel. The rooms are fabulous! to die for! Immaculately clean, tastefully decorated, we had a "wonderful" room, great bathroom, excellent Concierge service, everything a person could want for. The only down-side is the $35+ tax per night PARKING. We parked once, and left vehicle for the duration. Every employee has a fabulous attitude, friendly, helpful, and an asset to the Sheraton family. Go there, you'll be so happy you did! Can't wait to make a return visit. :*)

Reviews.Title: “"do you want to spend a lot of money to sleep on a window sill??"”
Reviews.Author: mermaidian
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our last stop before coming home. It was the most expensive and hence supposed to be the best! I was travelling with my wife and my mother visiting our extended family in the US. We were booked (and double checked) months in advance to be in a double Queen room. Instead we were sent up to our "King" single room!! No apology, no offer to change rooms. My options were simply "sleep between my mother and my wife!" (not a pleasant thought!) or "sleep on the window sill or floor"!!! For the most expensive hotel it was without doubt the WORST experience ever and I would certainly advise anyone wanting to spend their money on a nice hotel to look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “The Good & the Bad”
Reviews.Author: wormcreative
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W on a Sunday night for a quick girlfriends getaway. We had heard the W was THEE place to stay in Hollywood. We were also told the service could be very snotty but decided to book there anyways. Thankfully all the employees we encountered were very friendly and happy to give suggestions on where to go etc. (Anthony, our bell captain who helped us with loads of luggage was especially welcoming). Our room was small and despite being on the 11th floor the view wasn't good, it overlooked a rooftop. For $300+ a night I guess I was expecting a little more from the room. It was very stark, cramped and typical (although the beds were wonderful). Anyways, after checking in we were excited to put on our suits and head up to the pool. But, then found out they were charging $20 per person cover charge to use the pool, yes, even for hotel guests. That's just crazy and had we known ahead of time we probably would have booked elsewhere. There was also no lounges available so our visions of lounging poolside, reading magazines and drinking girly cocktails were crushed and we just headed out to explore instead. Parking at the hotel is $35 (plus tax) and maybe that's the going rate for Hollywood but it seemed like the hotel was trying to nickel and dime every chance it got (even a charge for wi-fi). That night the lobby bar was going strong and had an amazing jazz group playing. They were cabaret style and super fun. We checked out the following morning and headed to the beach where we could actually catch some rays. So long story short, If you're ever in Hollywood on a Sunday night I highly recommend you head to the W for the jazz performance. But if lounging by the pool is part of your plans you may want to stay elsewhere. P.S. Had an amazing dinner at Cleo across the street and there is also an irish pub across the street with $3 (premium) pints all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worse hotel I ever been in L.A...”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre09
Reviews.Content: ...unless you watt to go party every night from Thursday to Sunday. This is The Hangover, meets Spring Break. Watch your step on Saturday night when you want to go back to tour room : you may encounter very easy young girls or walk in disgusting substances on the floor. Saturday afternoon on the top floor with swimming pool is just a sort of MTV beach party with a DJ and girls dancing around. That is a real social experience of some American way of living I guess. Hotel is very noisy as you can imagine. Room service is just terrible : they just cannot get the right order. 3 times wrong out of 5 . Car valet ... Nice guys but amateurs. They need more than 15 minutes to bring one car. One advise, call from your room in advance ! You have to pay for wi-fi in your room. Water bottles are not complementary either. I doubt I would go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trying too hard”
Reviews.Author: Kevboyburgess
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this hotel came at the end of a wonderful Highway 1 road trip for my wife and I. We got a great deal on price, but having stayed in hotels of this (apparent) standard before, we had certain expectations. Many of these were not met, so here's a summary of them. Location: a hotel of this standard would be expected to be in a nice location. Don't be misled, the W is not in the cleaner, nicer West Hollywood area, but in the run down area of Hollywood Blvd, about a mile from the main Hollywood bustle. If you're into smoke shops, 'adult' shops and tattoo parlors, this is for you. If not, you may not (like us) enjoy the area so much. Surprising therefore that a 'designer' hotel would be located in this part of the city...in fact, we did not like the atmosphere outside of the hotel complex after dark. The hotel complex: nice restaurants and bar areas (if you're happy to pay $15 upwards for a drink) but full of wannabe types and those who reckon it looks good to be seen in this place. We were unimpressed by this. Compared to hotels such as the Gamercy Park in New York this one seemed to try too hard to be something it wasn't. Rooms: nice room, not massive, but had a nice look and feel, retro-futuristic design. We really liked the room. We had a courtyard view, which was nicer than the view onto a parking lot or the rather run down hollywood and vine area. Also this aspect meant it was quiet at night,so we got good sleep. Cleanliness: we couldn't honestly say whether our room was actually serviced or not. If it was, it was certainly a rushed job! Overall, nice rooms, wrong location, a hotel which attracts wanabe A-listers, but tries too hard to be something the location won't allow it to be. A good 3-star hotel at best, with some good price deals at the moment. Just don't expect the same feel as Sunset Blvd or West hollywood here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service & Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: SrfnEsq
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is Wonderful. In particular, its General Manager is receptive and helpful. Also, the management and staff for Drais (which is an amazing pool party) are professional and hospitable. A truly enjoyable experience all around. I highly recommend checking out and staying at this Hollywood-cool hotel and its superb facilities and staff.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING EXPERIENCE :)”
Reviews.Author: charlottelakes
Reviews.Content: Some people would expect the staff at the W to be snotty or rude. However, I found that they were really very nice. I went for my 16th birthday and it was the perfect place. We had gotten the Cool Corner Suite for me and my friends except we ended up in the Fantastic Suite. This is because the hotel called us right before we got there saying that they would upgrade us for very little money because someone cancelled. They said they thought of me immediately because it was my birthday celebration! That's one of the examples of how they were so sweet. So we got upgraded to the Fantastic Suite and it was really cool! and also really spacious. It easily accommodated me and my two friends. It could have easily fit two more people at least on a roll away bed. Another great thing about the W is the environment is really cool. It is filled with L.A.'s stars. Most likely, you will see at least one famous person. Or meet someone who knows a famous person. haha. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service ever!”
Reviews.Author: PaulBrown_PZ
Reviews.Content: 6 out 5 for service! - Best Service Ever - Great concierge.......... Rooms fair price for the size in a major city. Alyssa Kiefer was extremely helpful throughout the booking! the hotel is fun, stylist and have a good mix of cool people - we stayed on the fourth floor and didnt hear the nightclub as we slept! but to be fair if your staying in a W hotel you should be partying! Drais Pool was amazing surely it is the best pool in LA! - very cool with great staff. Location was good for walks around Hollywood and Sunset strip. one point which was a small disappointment - Showers were not powerful - which I mentioned but they said it was Eco friendly .......... I would have preferred to use the same towel for a couple of days and off set a powerful shower. I also got an over charge of 38 dollas on items from the room which I will get hopefully refunded. In General 5 out of 5, highly recommended - Drais is a Must!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Chelene1
Reviews.Content: I recently visitied the hotel with my sister for a quick get away and was treated like royalty by the hotel staff. This is a gorgeous hotel with all the perks and I'll happily return!

Reviews.Title: “Experience the W Hollywood It will Change your Life”
Reviews.Author: LesMor55
Reviews.Content: I have never been treated so kindly by any hotel staff and I have been many places inteh world and stayed with hotels ranging from 3-5plus stars and by far this is the only hotel whose staff will go above and beyond their roles to ensure you are well taken care of. I felt like a princess and travelling alone they ensured I was safe and had access to any amenities that I may have needed through out my stay. The GM of the hotel was an exceptional person who followed up on my stay through out until the morning I checked out. The rooms are phenomenal, I stayed in a regular King room in April and upgraded to the Marvelous Suite this time and there is a reason it is called that... Please stay here!! It is the best hotel in Hollywood with access to everything you need. Clean and Safe and friendly with an amazing pool, food, and entertainment. I cant say enough about this hotel other than you must stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendly nightclub that just happens to have room above it.”
Reviews.Author: rslain
Reviews.Content: I believe that people are blinded by the fact that it is in deed a "pretty" hotel but I believe they spent most of their budget on decorations and not structure. On the 11th floor you could hear the nightclub that is on the main floor, blasting it's hip hop beats until closing. I don't like hotel rooms that are like walking into a over priced retail store. In the bathroom, on the table in the main room and even the entire refrigerator was stuffed full of items that you could purchase. Almost afraid to move the "retail" out of the frig to put my own things in, in fear of being charged because I moved them out. The water pressure was horrible!!! All this "going green" crap ends up making you take a shower 3 times as long because it takes that long to rinse off. Depending on what time you took a shower you never knew if the water would be luke warm or scolding at any given moment during the course of the shower. One of the evenings I was met with the heavy cloud of marijuana as I approached my door and entered my room. This was due to the fact that the suite next to us had propped their door open to let the smoke escape. Moments later I could hear people leaving and the mention that "they worked here" was over heard through my door. As I opened my door I could see 2 men in the night club "uniform" of all black, rounding the corner along with a couple of female companions. I don't care what people do in their rooms, but I don't want my room smelling like it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Diane11SanDiego
Reviews.Content: My friends and I drove up from San Diego and stayed at the W. I have to say it was a WONDERFUL experience. The hospitality was AMAZING and the roof top pool was great! Although the weather was not as nice as it could have been, they had a COMPLIMENTARY happy hour where ALL drinks were FREE! We wanted to go to Drai's night club in the hotel and was told that it was a seperate entity and the hotel could not gaurantee entrance. When we saw the line of 100 + people outside trying to get in, we got worried. However, W Insider, CHRIS NELSON, was sooooo cool and got us right in without hesitation! He was the BEST! I would definitely recommend this hotel to all! The only issue that we did have was the service at the restaurant, Delphine. Food was good but service was less than average.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is a "Night Club with Beds" but I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sameera3000
Reviews.Content: I opted to stay at the W Hollywood in the week prior to the Oscars for a business trip. If you're looking for a sedate business hotel then please stay away. However if, like me, you want your hotel to be a hub of celebrity activity, noise and fun then I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it. The partying went on into the early hours and it's the only decent hotel in Central Hollywood. The rooms and bathrooms are decent and what you'd expect from a 5 star hotel. However, everything (and I mean EVERYTHING) is a costly extra (no complimentary water, no free WIFI etc, on site parking etc). The Food is nothing to sing about, overpriced (especially room service) but acceptable. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful - although I have seen mixed reviews. The central reception/bar area are packed with people in the evening and parties do tend to continue in the rooms (and the walls are pretty thin). You must try out the spa. Expensive but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer focus - and best for the young at heart.”
Reviews.Author: sazer1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at hundreds of hotels for work and pleasure, and I would put the service quality of the W Hollywood at the top tier of the list. At most hotels, you're lucky to run into one or two people who provide excellent service. At the W, it started from the valet to check in to room service to housekeeping to check out and every stop in between. It's the 'can do,' it's no problem, whatever whenever service that other hotels (and other W's) only talk about. W Hollywood delivers. Too many examples to even list here. The hotel is very central to the Hollywood Palladium, and the Pantages Theatre, and it's right on a Metro Line. It can be very lively and noisy, but they will address any noise complaints from the rooms immediately. There is also a good amount of street and traffic noise, ask for a room away from the parking lot side of the hotel. Dress is more formal throughout the property, and next time I will ask about bringing my dog, as they have a dog menu in the room service guide! Parking is valet only and roughly $40, but don't stay here if the prices will get to you, everything is quite pricey but the service greatly exceed expectations. W Hollywood, you've got it going on. Kudos to your management and your people for impressing some jaded travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Luxury”
Reviews.Author: pixietravel
Reviews.Content: If you're planning a trip to Los Angeles, the W Hollywood is the place to stay. The hotel is not only chic but friendly. A rare combination. From the moment we entered we were treated as favored guests. The staff was always available to answer your questions and to offer help if needed. Our room was immaculate and the bed was very comfortable. It made it easy to sleep well and wake refreshed. There is free internet access in the library/reception area and the Delphine Restaurant offers delicious entrees and once again great service. Highly recommend the chocolate cake. :) Enjoy! .

Reviews.Title: “An Experience of a LIFETIME !!!”
Reviews.Author: Doreen0015
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively around the United States & Overseas ... stayed in some of the Best Hotels .... and the W Hollywood Stay & Experience will make you think you have entered a "Dream World" !! First off, the Amazing Design of the Hotel ( lobby, restaurants, rooftop pool & restaurant/club, bar, spa, etc. ) was Breathtaking !!! My room itself ( from the bathroom, beds, TV, lamps, dressers, etc. ) was so Terrific, I took pictures to show people how Beautiful it Looked . The staff ( valet, front desk, concierge, hostess/waiter, Spa employees, Bellman ) should be nominated for "Best Example of Customer Service" I have ever Seen ... Extremely Friendly, Helpful, & Best of All - They went "Above & Beyond" in terms of making my stay at the W Hollywood a "Memorable One" !!!

Reviews.Title: “For the business traveller or the young singleton wanting a Hollywood Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cemlinder
Reviews.Content: I stayed on my own for three days as a treat in between staying with friends in LA. My room was very good and had decent views and I had a very comfy bed and slept like a princess. Overall i had a lovely stay it was very glam and very "LA" also very comfortable and central. Most of the staff were very helpful but there were some things that could improve: 1. The treatment on reception: The girl on reception who spoke to me when I checked in was not very friendly. I had forgotten to authorize my card for use abroad and so it didn´t work to reserve the money they needed for one night and there was no flexibility there at all although my bank was not going to be able to authorize my card abroad until they opened later that day due to time difference. luckily I managed to sort it out, I´m sure I would have not been able to check in at all and left out on the street?. 2. Phone cost: I made a phonecall to a landline in Spain from my room for not more than 10 minutes due to an emergency and they tried to charge me 155 dollars!!! I complained and managed to get it down to 75 dollars which I´m still not happy about and have requested a detailed description of the call so be careful when making a call... In spite of these Two comments overall in all it was a lovely stay and I have stayed at W hotels before and like them. It is however not for families!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Lobby Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: antd1958
Reviews.Content: This W has a great lobby and goes well the the Hollywood theme. It has a red carpet, huge chandelier, and really nice bar at the back wall. The inside part is cozy, but my favorite part was the outdoor terrace. There is another bar there and lounge furniture as well. Definitely a young crowd but we had fun anyway. The rooms are typical W - modern, white, etc. I was not a fan of Cafe Entourage. Blah food, blah menu selection, blah execution. HOWEVER, Delphine was great! Brunch was delicious - they have a burger with a fried egg! - and really good drinks. One weird thing... I guess the W doesn't own the pool, the nightclub Drae's does, and hotel guests aren't guaranteed to use the pool on Sunday's, when Drae's has their pool party. Everyone has to wait in line to get in. Probably not a big deal for all the cool young kids that go there, but I guess a grandpa like me won't be swimming on sundays!

Reviews.Title: “Snazzy, happening - makes you feel like a celeb”
Reviews.Author: Happy King
Reviews.Content: From the moment you drive up, you feel like you're entering some entertainment event. Red carpet, glitzy lobby with crystal and mirrors, spiral staircase (like in Radio City) carpeted in red. Very modern look - I like different. Check-in was a breeze. SPG Gold was useless as the hotel was completely booked. We had two rooms - 3rd and 8th. Neither were noisy as saw in other comments - perhaps I got the "right" side - facing the drive-up. But that meant no view either - we were Ok with that - barely in the room for the two nights we were there. The hotel lobby is fantastic, but the room corridors were slightly dull - you can tell this was an older property that was redone. But once you enter the room it was a nice change. Plentiful closet space. Two king platform beds - very comfortable - not sure if there were Westin Heavenly beds, but close enough. The desk had all the amenities for charging your various devices (didn't have to pull out any iPod or BB chargers). Large screen TV and nice cushioned platform sitting area by window - nice touches. Bathroom was not large but nothing to complain about. Concierge helpful in finding and suggesting various meal options including where the "celebs" go - that was important to some in my party (no, we didn't see anyone). Kitchen24 is a good breakfast option - 7 min walking distance. Next day was at "The Griddle" where celebs go - we made reservations and the place was packed - got the back room. But by the time we were done, there was a line of 50-60 people waiting outside. So must be a "got-to-go" place if in LA. For dinner we walked about 10-15 mins on Hollywood Blvd to Palm Thai - strange feeling when you enter - family style seating (long tables) and a singing Elvis, but the food was fantastic - must go. This is also walking distance (but a good 10-15 min walk on the other side of Palm Thai) to the "happening" area of Hollywood Blvd with the Chinese and Kodak Theatres. The stars walk is also there right outside the hotel on both sides of the street, so you're not missing out on that. There's a metro stop near the hotel which makes it convenient not to use your car if you're headed into LA. Parking is a -itch. $35/day even if you're a guest. That's ludicrous!! Valet is the only option. Street parking is available but not easy to find. Go get glamored!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you don't plan on sleeping”
Reviews.Author: 9apricots
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is gorgeous. The staff was attentive and helpful throughout our trip. Rooms are gorgeous (super cozy beds) - unfortunately, I didn't get the quality sleep I was hoping for. I was on the 4th floor and noise from the parking lot below (I don't believe it's owned by the hotel) was INSANE. It sounded like a parking lot party was going on. Screaming valets, bass, pounding music. As the lot isn't owned by the hotel, that is no reflection on the staff or their attentiveness - just an unfortunate neighborhood. To their credit, colleagues on 2 other floors had loud partiers in their hallways - and within a few minutes of calling the front desk to complain, those noise issues were corrected. The neighborhood definitely leaves something to be desired. It's pretty much a mix of stripper clothiers, tourist shops, tattoo parlors and a Trader Joes. The hotel itself is amazing, however. Morning and afternoons are lovely, quiet and mellow. In the evening it turns into a hot spot packed with hipsters looking to see and be seen. The Bliss Spa on the 4th floor is delightful. The restaurant on the roof has a great view, but beware the dresscode by the pool. This is definitely not a kid-friendly hotel, which was fine with us. Certainly not the place to bring the family if you're doing the California Disney circuit. Also, you will probably not feel comfortable schlepping around the W in shorts and a t-shirt. It's a hotspot, and the clientele dresses and acts accordingly. The cost of internet is $15 a day. For what they charge for a room, that seems a little ridiculous to me. Not to mention the $9 bottle of Fiji water in the bathroom...

Reviews.Title: “brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: cairncross
Reviews.Content: after being over booked in a different hotel we got put here best deceing ever stayed here with my mum on 25th april for my 21st brilliant hotel great deco staff were billiant after a long flight had noice on the 4th night didnt mind as it wasnt the first night food was huge compaired to what im used to but nice very posh hotel but worve the money best hotel i've stayed in for the stay in america best 21st birthday present thanks w.hollywood for making it special will defferently stay here again was wowed as soon as i walked in

Reviews.Title: “LA native- Modern hotel, excellent service, would change the bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: travelbug_ca_5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hollywood for 2 nights in April. I was instantly impressed with the lobby, as it was decorated in deep red colors with glitzy crystal chandeliers. The service was excellent (as their motto, "W hotel, Whatever, Whenever!" implies), and the staff was more than helpful. The room was nice, and the decor was modern-retro. There was a comfortable window bench with an amazing view of Hollywood. There are numerous delicious restaurants nearby and most of them epitomize Los Angeles (as an LA native, I can attest to this). The location is central, and if you are looking for a home base hotel with easy access to other places in LA this is a great choice. However, I had a slight problem with the bathrooms, as the privacy left something to be desired. The bathroom walls don't really do much, so you can hear everything in the bathroom even with the doors closed, and vice-versa. The shower is visible from the room and is only covered by frosted glass. There is a 2 foot opening at the bottom of the shower that needless to say left me a little unsettled (can you imagine reaching for the soap and accidentally showing off a little too much?) I think the design would have been nice had I been traveling with a significant other, but with friends I would have preferred a more conservative bathroom. The club on the roof of the hotel (Drais) is awesome, classy and interesting and I would definitely frequent it again. It is a destination to many more than hotel guests, and often times people stay in the hotel just to go to Drais. If you are looking for a fun-filled LA weekend, the W Hollywood is a great destination, and one I would like to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to scratch.”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights mid April. Had a few problems during our stay. Except for the noise at 2.30AM from a room next door (the occupants were evicted) the problems were minor but many. Tess looked after us well in the compensation area, but after staying in two other hotels during our stay (Residence Inn B/Hills and Sheraton Marina San Diego) our expectations weren't quite met here. The late checkout (6PM) was part of the compensation and it was gratefully accepted as we were flying back to Australia that night. The "service" needs to be on the same level as the "style"

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience”
Reviews.Author: WalkAboutNorCal
Reviews.Content: Business guy, travel a lot. Midweek visit with my family on our way to Disneyland. Awesome hotel - staff was very helpful and treated the kids really well. Room was fantastic, as were the views from our 8th floor room and the pool area. Had a great breakfast in the dining room. I can't wait to stay here on my next business trip, and will definitely bring the family back next time we go to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad & The Wannabe's”
Reviews.Author: Layover
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and this was my first stay at the W. I travel 100+ days a year so I'm not a novice at this stuff. I usually stay in Century City and was very excited to be at a W, which are obviously legendary. Here's my view. Bad: This is not a family hotel. If you are from Minneapolis and are taking the kids out west to see Disney and Hollywood, do NOT stay here. Good: One of the nicest rooms I've stayed in and I've stayed in a lot. Bad: $28 for the equivelent of a continental breakfast. Enjoy the $75,000 bottle of champagne at the roof top pool. Good: Spa was beautiful and the staff was great. Bad: Longest most impersonal check-in I've ever had. And I'm Starwood elite. "Can you break a $100 bill". "No. I don't have change." Really? Bad: Asked the desk person to put an X on my rental company map so I could have some bearings when driving back to the hotel from Malibu. She didn't know where the hotel was on the map. Good: Banquet food? Good GAWD. Best ever. Good: Concierge. Me: "Is there a place within walking distance that has a great burger and a good beer." He thought...."You'd love Bowry's" and gave me the walking directions. Best. Damn. Burger. Ever. Bad: The attitude. Look at the positive reviews and how many are from LA. This is a local hotel. I've never felt "intimidated" at a hotel pool. I was informed that I could walk over and speak to a co-worker who was sunning herself, but that I would have to leave because of the dress code. At a hotel pool. It's a sea of hipster-doofus-posers from LA who then pour onto the street beneath your window at 3 am and their poodles get into fights. I kid you not. Good: Room accoutrement. The universal selection of rechargers? Genius. The toiletries? Great.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the Ordinary into Wonderment and Wonderland”
Reviews.Author: romazzino
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this exceptional hotel in the true heart of Hollywood. I arrived at the hotel very early after a trans-Pacific flight and was greeted with a warm smile and welcome by Matt who immediately asked my name and introduced himself. I then met Abby at the reception who was also very friendly and welcoming. Due to the early time of my arrival, I had purposely planned to spend my morning at the Bliss Spa and unexpectedly and to my surprise, Abby was able to check me in. Upon entering my room, I was impressed by the design, all the amenities, the well thought out technology elements in the room and the apparent care of the housekeeping staff as my accommodations were immaculately taken care of as well as all the common areas of the hotel. I then went on to the Bliss Spa where I treated myself to a Blissage 75 by the most intuitive therapist I have ever had. His name is Moe, he possibly the best massage I've ever had so get ready to be taken to Nirvana and back under his skillful care. Since I had just spent five and a half hours on an airplane, an Oxygen Blast was in order. The aesthetician was also extremely friendly, unfortunately I can't remember her name. My experience here was so absolutely fantastic that I decided to take a short break to meet with friends and then returned to Bliss for a great manicure and pedicure by Lisa. During my break between treatments and while meeting with friends in the very glamorous living room where an impressive chandelier drapes from the very tall ceiling flowing like an Academy Awards gown over a beautiful red staircase that brings you back to the nostalgia of Old Hollywood I decided a noon cocktail was in order. Now, don't let the "Old Hollywood" comment foul you, the space is very eclectic and chic with very rich leather furniture, elements of chrome and marble that all flows beautifully. The service at the bar was wonderful and attentive as well, the cocktail list impressive though I chose to have one of the best Cosmopolitan's I've ever tasted....made to perfection. The pool area, seductive and relaxing and at night full of energy. I read someone say the place was full of "Hollywood wannabe's".....well, I'd like to say that everyone I encountered was fun, friendly and just being no more than themselves while having a great time with friends or a loved one. It is also obvious that many people come to this hotel for business and I would attribute that to destination and great service. Upon my departure, the experience was as flawless as the arrival. Abby also checked me out, she acknowledged me from the moment she saw me from a distance and greeted me again as I approached the desk. No name asked, no room number asked. She knew who I was and addressed me by name, just like Matt at the front the numerous times he saw me. As far as everyone else, even if they don't know your name you will see that you will be acknowledged with a greeting every time. Thank you for a fantastic time! I can't wait to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite as good as other W's”
Reviews.Author: FuzZler
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed views of this hotel - I've stayed at a few different W Hotels and this was the least impressive of them all, but I never received poor service or had a 'bad experience' as such. It was just OK. The rooms are very very stark and minimalist. I absolutely love modern, minimalist design - but this hotel has done it very poorly. It feels cold and clinical - much like you are in an insane asylum! There is no artwork on the walls and very little color - it's all white basically. The bed in very low and there are a lot of fluorescent lighting (just to make it seem even colder). The shower had the worst pressure I've ever experienced - it was just better than a dribble! Was such a let down as the shower head looked so big and luxurious. The toilet blocked a few times and we had to call for maintenance to unclog it. The maintenance Service was prompt and followed by a courtesy call to see if everything was OK - a nice touch. The airconitioning was the loudest, most annoying system you'll ever hear - it stopped and started throughout the night with a big clunk and rattling sound like an old, noisy refrigerator. We ended up turning it off over night as it kept us awake! Whilst LA is very spread out, and its hard to find a good location for everything, the location of the hotel is terrible. It's sleazy and dirty. I felt a little unsafe at night. There's very little around in terms of shopping and eating - it is however, very conveniently located above Hollywood & Vine underground railway which you can take to Hollywood & Highland, for instance, where there is plenty more choice. The area looks to be improving though. I guess in 10 years it will be OK! For a good location - the Sofitel much better. I also didn't like that the pool was shared by Drais nightclub. Whilst a very funky looking area and a great night spot, it seemed like the pool wasn't part of the hotel. I didn't want to use it as it wasn't private enough (that's just me - there were people laid beside it). It's not all bad though. The service was exceptional - very warm and friendly and personal. We never had any issues with service in any way, but we never do at W properties. The Bliss products used in the rooms are very good, and there are like 6 different products they give you each day which is great. We also loved the special multiple-charger station which had about 10 different connections to charge your phone or camera etc and the iPod dock beside the bed (seems to be standard at most hotels these days). Overall I wouldnt stay again - it just didnt seem homely like some hotels are. I did like the party feel of the hotel - it's basically a nightclub not a hotel but it just wasn't wow-ing enough for me. I wouldn't recommend against staying here, but I wouldn't be recommending it like I would with some other LA hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure if there is anything wrong with this place”
Reviews.Author: bsetting
Reviews.Content: The W has amazing service, exception taste, a great lobby, comfortable beds, spacious rooms, a subway station beneath it and amazing restaurants and night clubs around it. Not to mention Drai's which is right on the property. Will have several more sales meetings there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRSTROKE
Reviews.Content: Nice room, gym, facility, and great staff. Lobby is beautiful and night life/bar area is great. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get any sleep don't stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Lush21
Reviews.Content: I travel to LA about 6 times a year for business. This was my first stay in Hollywood. I frequent the W Hotel in Dallas so I decided to try the Hollywood location. BAD IDEA. I walk in on a Wednesday night to check in and had no idea what I'd gotten myself into. The lobby basically turns into a club at night full of a bunch of Hollywood wannabes. You can hear the music on the first few floors. I was put on the 11th floor in a room right next to the fitness center. All I heard all night was the sound of people running on the treadmill, and worse...the sounds of people dropping weights. It was so loud it sounded like someone was throwing bowling balls at our wall. Mix that in with the party goers outside yelling on the sidewalks and you're sure to get no sleep!
