I'm actually a young partier myself...but this was ridiculous. Its apparently the hot spot for locals to hang. I am a stylish woman with plenty of money yet still felt out of place and uncomfortable to even walk in the lobby. The staff was rude. The atmosphere is pretentious and snobbish and the locals make you feel unwelcome as a guest. The location is blocks away from any attractions or shopping on Hollywood Blvd. Overall...unless you want to party like Charlie Sheen or Guns N Roses don't stay here. Its not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: inkedtc
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps one of the most upscale hotels I have ever stayed in and it was an absolutely amazing experience! I have no complaints what so ever and I cant wait to be back in LA to stay at my favorite W again!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, urbane luxury.”
Reviews.Author: LACat
Reviews.Content: I live locally, and due to a fire in my building, this Cat needed a place to stay for a night while the smoke cleared. The W hotels accept pets, not just dogs! Yes, there is a cleaning fee for pets, but the staff was so welcoming and friendly to me, I didn't mind. They even have a special room service menu for us furry types. As for you human-type visitors, take the time to learn about your hotel and its location! This is a very hip, modern hotel--great for young couples or singles, NOT families! Hollywood has become a nightlife hot-spot, and lots of locals go to the W Hollywood for the clubs (Drai's, the pool, the outdoor Hollywood Station lounge, the Living Room lobby) and to eat at Delphine. It is a see-and-be-seen kind of place. Visitors should keep in mind, however, that Hollywood is still gritty in parts and not completely gentrified. LA also has the largest population of homeless in the USA (well, where would you live if you had no home?), which is something beyond the hotel's control. The security in the lobby and the elevators make sure street traffic doesn't bother guests at the W. The Rooms: The W decor is modern minimalism with a neutral palette. Everything is brand-new and super clean. The bed was ultra comfortable. The window seat was a nice touch, even if the view from Room 320 is of the valet parking area. Noise from there was minimal, but echoed. Room wasn't huge, but enough to move around. The Bliss bath products are great (and so's the spa) and the walk-in shower is spacious. I wish there was a tub, though. If I had to complain about anything, the lighting (the bathroom in particular) was dim. The noise from the hallways was loud (keep it down, people!). The clock radio/iPod dock did not work. The phone on the desk only worked in Speaker mode. Those are little things that need to be checked and fixed regularly. The extras are also pricey- $9 for a lg bottle of Figi water, a $25 face mask sample by the sink. My Blackberry, which gets excellent reception anywhere else in H'wood, could not get a 3G signal in my room. The only free WiFi is in the lobby. Breakfast room service was fast and delish. Great French press of coffee. All the staff I encountered were very friendly and excellent, to both of us (furry and non-furry). **There is a locals-only rate, which is a great bargain. You will have to show your license to prove you live in LA, though. All in all, this is a great place to stay and feel Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W on Hollywood Blvd”
Reviews.Author: goodgreekguy
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the W on Hollywood! Location was as amazing as the hotel. The hotel is run like a swiss clock. The layout, staff, gym, room and management are accomodating and friendly. Order room service....food is amazing and reasonable. Oh a real star hangout too!

Reviews.Title: “W for Gen Y”
Reviews.Author: Willieo873
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in February and thought it was a fantastic hotel. The foyer has a real "wow" factor when you walk in and the staff were great. I slept great every night and did not hear anything from the downstairs bar which we were very close to or the nightclub. There are a lot of wannabes who hang around at the downstairs bar and it is interesting to see people with their luggage who have travelled and are tired have to push past people all dressed up and looking to make the scene. Great place for young couples and Gen Y in general, definitely not for business types or anyone with kids. Valets were also super friendly also which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We nabbed this hotel on hotwire.com for $187.50 a night. The location is excellent, just above Hollywood/Vine metro station (on the red line). The hotel is gorgeous, diamantés rim the peepholes, the downstairs bar is attractive and the toiletries provided were nice. I love that there is face scrub provided for guests. The staff were friendly and helpful, and our window view was novel (we saw filming on the street on the second morning). I would recommend W Hollywood for people who want prime location, soft comfortable beds and a great time in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Treat Yourself Like A Hollywood Star”
Reviews.Author: lurcherm
Reviews.Content: The W hotel is a modern beautifully decorated gem located on Hollywood Blvd. Very chick and upscale in design and decoration. The staff are impeccably dressed and extrememly helpful. The hotel is geared towards the adult traveler who enjoys a great night life. It is located on the east end of Hollywood Blvd so it is a 10-15 minute walk to the heart of the tourist section. The blocks in between are quite run down, with many panhandlers, but quite safe in the daylight. I would highly recommend this as a romantic adult get away, a fun place for a girl's weekend, or bachelor's party, but not for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Had to try and sleep in the bathtub to escape the noise of a band!”
Reviews.Author: crash311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I heard of this fairly new hotel that was described as contemporary and beautiful. It was in a neighborhood near our son and daughter-in-law, so we thought it would be perfect because we could walk to their home. We are used to upscale hotels around the world. We have NEVER had such poor service. And unless you are under 30 and live for the nightlife, you should not stay there. A hotel should be primarily for a good, restful night's sleep. Instead the constant beat of music from the band playing in the outside courtyard continued until at least 3:00 in the morning. I even took pillows and blankets into the bathtub to try and escape the noise and get a little sleep. The front desk told us that all rooms are exposed to this entertainment area, so moving us would not solve the problem. We did not get any sleep at all, and no allowance was given to us for this horrible night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: nltheis
Reviews.Content: I love the W. They did a fantastic job from the time I pulled in to when I checked out (late - oops!). Enjoyed all the hotel has to offer including restaurants, lounges, and spa. Couldn't have asked for a more well appointed room either. Outstanding stay, thanks W!

Reviews.Title: “Very W, very Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: kbatlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the very touristy Hollywood and vine area, but the hotel is amazing. Much nicer Thant the w in westwood. I was spoiled, because they upgraded me to an absolutely amazing suite with a round couch, huge bathroom, 50 inch tv, it was incredible. The lobby was gorgeous, and the staff very helpful. My only complaint was the difficulty gettin the wi fi signal, which seemed very weak and slow. Now one of my favorite hotels in California.

Reviews.Title: “W hotel was so fabulous-amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Rm_Taher
Reviews.Content: I had such an amazing time at the w. It was my first time to visit the states and my gosh was that an introduction. I went with friends and I would definitely recommend it for girly/boys holiday. Definately not for kids! There was a really cool club in the hotel that had really good music and lively atmosphere. Although the location isn't the best (it is alittle run down) it was very easy to access areas of Hollywood. All these things were great about the trip but the best part about this whole trip that is making me plan my next visit was the STAFF!! oh my, they were amazing! They were so friendly and so helpful. They would always greet us and make sure we were ok. Even the security guards on the door were so friendly. When we were getting advise on where we should go or distances on places we wanted to go they would go above and beyond to give great service! Thank u w for making my first trip to America once in a life time experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT for kids”
Reviews.Author: TryItMom
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to this stay, but we cut our visit short and checked-out early. I wish we had read these reviews before we booked our stay because we most definitely wouldn't have chosen this hotel. We were disappointed by the location of the hotel. It was definitely not a safe place to walk around. We left briefly to look for somewhere to eat outside of the hotel, found nothing, and were greeted by homeless men sleeping literally outside the hotel gates upon our return. The room was everything we expect when we stay at a W, and we were happy with all of the amenities. However, we were not aware that the pool was part of the club and would be unavailable after 6pm. We tried to visit the pool area during the afternoon, but there was a photo shoot in progress with equipment and wires everywhere, so not a safe place for our toddler to be running around. We were traveling with an infant and a toddler, so we couldn't take advantage of the free car rides (no car seats), couldn't walk anywhere, and couldn't use the pool in the evening, so it felt like we were stuck in our room. We did try sitting in the living room area after dinner, but it got too noisy/crowded for the kids. Also, when we were checking out, an employee told us that it was a good idea since the hotel gets pretty crazy and very loud on the weekends. I wish someone would have warned us of that when we were checking in for a weekend stay with our kids. The staff was very friendly and ooo-ed and awww-ed over our boys every time we passed through the lobby, and they did offer restaurant vouchers and some points back for our trouble, but it took a lot of time away from our vacation to re-work our itinerary, deal with SPG, and pack up and move to a different hotel. The service in the restaurant, bell hop, valet, etc. was all exceptional, and the food in the restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The "W" wowed me!”
Reviews.Author: Mschlesinger
Reviews.Content: Gr8 location! Friendly and attentive staff even with all of Hollywood a flitted with the Acadamy Awards happening just blocks away. Every guest was a star!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - the W Hollywood is THE place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Sarah32530
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is the best. The hotel itself is light and bright and the lobby is a great place to hang out and people watch. The staff are wonderful, nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are chic and very well equipped and the beds are so comfortable. The location is fantastic - just a short drive to Beverly Hills and a two block walk to Katsuya. If you don't want to leave the hotel the in-room dining is great, as is the food at Delphine. The Bliss goodies in the room are, well, bliss. This is the second time I have stayed at the W Hollywood and it will defintely not be the last. The W is my number one choice when i'm in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever / Whenever”
Reviews.Author: KoziakProductions
Reviews.Content: What W has done to create an entire "experience" is fantastic. No matter who you are or why you are staying, it feels as though everyone is part of your own personal staff trying to make things easier and better for you. LOVE the decore. LOVE the layout of the hotel. Had breakfast and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travelers, AVOID THIS HOTEL!! Its HORRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: busyguy74
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, Wednesday, and it was the worst experience I have had in while. I travel for work and I am a SPG Platinum member. I have stayed at W's all over the US and this is the worst. First one thing to get out of the way. This hotel is located in one of the worst areas in Hollywood. DO NOT WALK AROUND AT NIGHT. Its very run down and crime ridden. Ok, I checked in and was upgraded to what I was told was the best suite in the hotel, room 1101. Great, so I had to wait for the room to be ready, but it was fine and got all checked in. The room itself was huge and pretty cool. Very modern interior and nice ammenities. Had excellent views of LA and the bathroom was big with a tub in the middle of the room. All great. I settled in and did some work, there is free internet if you are a platinum member, and its very fast (not common of any hotel). So from here on out, it went down hill. The room is not very insulated. You can hear the outside traffic and street noise. I was down on the end of the hall, but could still hear people outside walking around. I took a shower and there was no water pressure what so ever. I am use to it, but something that should be addressed. I went to bed at around 10:45pm. At around 11:00pm I heard some huge thumping and super loud music. I thought it was a car outside, but it would not stop. I finally realized that it was coming from upstairs. It was so loud that I could barely think. It just got ouder and louder. The bass was so bad that the glass and furniture in the room were rattling. I called down and was told that there was a club, literely above my head, and it goes to 3am. Its called Drais?? The girl was nice enough to offer my earplugs, but that was she could not do anything. I told her, BS, and spoke to someone else. They were confused and thought I new about this club and the noise. I had to tell them that I had no clue and was here for business, not clubbing, and needed to sleep. They finally agreed to move me to the 10th floor. So I packed my stuff and moved. I got to the floor and I was amazed. It was just a normal room, but it was still SUPER loud. Not as bad as the 11th floor, but still loud. I called again and told that I had to come the lobby. I get to the lobby and it was super loud there too. They have a lobby bar and it was crazy. I had to yell to the manager about my problem. They finally gave me a room on the 5th floor. It now way past midnight and I got my new key and headed back. I was then stopped by security and asked me where I was going? I told him to my room. He told me wait as there was too many people around trying to get upstairs?? I was blown away. I said I was guest and just wanted to go to my room. He stated "too bad". I then said I would just get a manager, then he said, OK, go ahead. WTF?? I checked out that next morning and was given points from my troubles.. Points dont cut it here. This club had runied what could have been a nice hotel. If you are 21 and looking to party, this is the spot for you. If you are a business traveler, SPG member, or looking for a quite weekend, avoid this place, its not worth it. I get the fact this place is trying to keep afloat with the club, but limit it to the weeked, but at the minium, TELL YOUR CLIENTS ABOUT THE CLUB. Put it on the website, tell them at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: number5alive
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood was right on: Brand new, sparkling clean, and full of the little touches that make a weekend getaway perfect. Best things about the W Hollywood: 1) it's new and clean, which is refreshing after a long day in dusty, smoggy LA. 2) the amenities are top notch: Good bar, good restaurant, good gym, nice pool with food/drink service at the pool (although not all day...) 3) service is nice. The concierge was thoughtful and knowledgeable, and the staff remembered my name. I absolutely love the fact that they change the elevator mats 3 times a day: In the morning the mat reads "Good Morning," then later in the day "Good Afternoon," and then finally "Good Evening." Little touches like that are memorable and delightful. The only problems we had were around getting Starwood Preferred Guest gold benefits. As a gold member, I was supposed to have free water and a late checkout. Staff had to be reminded about the free water, and my key was turned off before my late checkout time, which was an inconvenience but they promptly fixed the issues. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - Hollywood should be Wollywood. After all, it's the W”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_Contreras_R
Reviews.Content: Everything you can expect from the brand is delivered and exceeded. The "different" factor is all over the place, from the location to the aWesome customer service and customer-focused personalities of all the talent (staff). If you are traveling on a budget or if you are too conservative and expect the traditional hotel service this hotel is not for you. $9 for a bottle of water says it all...but believe me , it feels like it is worth it every single drop. In the Living Room (lobby), we had the chance to mingle with stars like Adam Sandler and Dave Spade. Where else can you do this? I found the bed too soft for me, but that is OK as I've heard everybody else complementing it. The location a little bit off the Hollywood main attractions, but hey, the walking was good. The ride on the Acura SUV was great and I certainly took advantage of it. Great cherry on the cake. I only encountered one Talent Member (won't say who) who did not adhere to the W lingo, pool? lobby? front desk? I am sure was a new talent...other than that everything was perfect. Compliments to the W Hollywood Talent for being such great hosts and amazing at delivering the brand promise.

Reviews.Title: “Only ok b/c we got a good deal through priceline”
Reviews.Author: Dinas1231
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at W hotels before this one was a wannabe hip hotel they try so hard but unfortunately didn't deliver. We tipped the help so we were treated nice but still they lost our luxury car for over a hour and we missed our dinner reservation. The room was small (no upgrade even though we tried) the bed was horrible Japanese style on the floor after 3 nights my back ached. The stay was ok nothing special, I feel bad for people who spend over $300 a night on this place. Book on priceline!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap, But Fun”
Reviews.Author: Adele302
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large, stylish 2 room suite with a view--we were upgraded, so our memories are warm and toasty. If you remember the old Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel--well, much remains, but it's been redone, all done up in cool blacks and whites. Staff was friendly and helpful, beds were divine, and we felt quite at ease--something of a surprise since we were there on our 45th anniversary--young we are not, but still felt at home among all the young and cool co-residents. If you are going to do Hollywood--which can be a bit of a letdown--this place should kick your trip up a notch or two. We'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Scott & Bob love the W Hollywood AND Brittany!”
Reviews.Author: BobLovesSRS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in Scottsdale last year. The hotel was beautiful, but I was disappointed with the service. I asked to see an upgrade room for DAYS (to see if I wanted to pay for an upgrade). On numerous occasions the staff were too busy to show me an upgrade room.On the 3rd day of my stay I was persistant enough that the "not very welcoming" welcome staff asked a concierge to show me an upgrade room, and I purchased it. So, I didn't have great expectations for my second stay at a W, the W Hollywood. After booking, I called to ask questions about the hotel, such as the parking options. Maureen was informative and personable. When we arrived, Blanca Leon in Housekeeping gave us a very warm welcome. Our meeting with her was a highlight of our stay. When we didn't think it could get any better, we met Brittany. Brittany was working the morning of 1/15. She chose the Absolute Perfect place for Paul, Doug, Scott and I to have breakfast. She had a surprise for us at check-out, as well! I have stayed in hotels in Spain, France, England, Costa Rica, Jamaica, Puerto Rico, New York, Philadelphia, Baltimore, Dallas, St. Thomas Virgin Islands, San Francisco, as well as others. My W Hollywood stay is one of my best hotel stays! Suggestion to the hotel: Let guests know about the "private sitting areas" at check-in. At check-out we discoverd an area on the 2nd floor that was like a hidden lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: dupedtourist
Reviews.Content: If you're going to stay at a W, you might as well get the whole experience- young, glamorous guests, modern decor, hip club scene and fancy cars coming and going from the valets. Throw in celebrity guests and a live band in the lobby and you've got the W Hollywood. I had a chance to stay here for 4 days and was impressed by the vibe and attitude of the place. It's very new and is breaking new ground in a once-seedy section of Hollywood. There's still the old-school walk of fame sidewalk and dive bars (the iconic Frolic Room across the street) nearby but the newly-built W condos and soon to be built luxury project across the street promise a definite upgrade for the neighborhood. TIP: Book this hotel through a wesite called Magellan Travel and save hundreds. We stayed here for $170 a night, at least a $100 off the rack rate. Speaking of upgrades, I was upgraded to a suite (I'm SPG Platinum) that was maybe the largest that I have ever stayed in. It featured an all white, 60s retro cool look with a circular couch, a mid-room curtain and electric shades. The all marble bathroom was larger than 2 normal hotel baths. Very impressive but I was annoyed by the bottles of booze, snacks, water, clothes, etc. with price tags on them scattered about. SPG- stop trying to sell me stuff. The lobby is spectacular, with high ceilings, a sweeping staircase and a bar scene that was lively. We were there during a Sunday night jazz promotion where the lobby was turned into a club-like scene and there was a glitzy turn out by the guests and locals. The disco on the top floor is apparently a hot spot, as there was a line of the young and the beautiful waiting behind the velvet ropes for the elevator to the club every night. TIP: Avoid any of the top floors near the disco if you want a quiet room. One night, the manager had a Gold/Platinum reception at the lobby bar, which are usually lame, but this was an open bar and a nice touch. The manger and his assistant were chatty and nice guys to talk to. Upon checking out, I had some problems with items on my bill that I had to argue with the clerk about (free movies that I was charged for, internet access on more than one laptop in my room, etc.) and it took a few calls to SPG and the hotel accounting department to get them deducted. This happens too often at all SPG hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMMM01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for work for a few nights in January. This was my second stay. The first was a year ago, when the hotel first opened, and it was a bit disastrous because the hotel was still getting its kinks out. I decided to give it another try, and am very happy that I did. This second stay was phenomenal and far exceeded all my expectations. The room was fabulous and very relaxing, which was great after a long day of work. It was very quiet at night, so I could sleep easily and very comfortably in the great bed. The amenities were great. The pool is gorgeous and the Bliss products are my favorite. The staff was uniformly friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. My car was always ready when I called for it, the front desk staff and concierge were great, and the W Insider was very helpful in getting us into the club, which is not run by the hotel. I hope to come back soon, and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Louise2222
Reviews.Content: Outstanding customer service received from the conciege at the W Hollywood. We were expecting a FedEx package which proved to be problematic as the shipper did not put our name on the package (ouch). The concierge was able to locate the package and email me withing 7 minutes - now that's action! She is getting the errant package to us ASAP. Asside from the many obvious features of the W Hollywood: beautifully appointed rooms, polite staff, great atmosphere it is the high level of customer satisfaction that stands out. A first class establishment. Bravo to management on every level for excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: NychaelaSymone
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel and centrally located to all things Hollywood but it truthfully is not a good hotel for the business traveler. I was quite disappointed in the $14.95 + tax a day internet charge. I'm sure most hotels have a fee but $14.95 a day is quite ridiculous. I stayed at the Hollywood location for a week and I wonder what happened to sound proof or sound reduction windows. You can hear EVERYTHING. I was on the fourth floor facing the parking lot and all night, I could hear the cab drivers talking and laughing. You can hear every word a person said while walking down the hall, no matter how soft they spoke. The room was very nice but I must complain about the shower and the overall lighting of the room. I'm sure the reason why they opted for a frosted glass panel in the bathroom is to allow for more light to enter the bathroom but if you have someone sharing your room, they will certainly wake up from the light shining through the shower. I'm sure they could put a shade or something in there to avoid this. Also, the bathrooms really don't provide that much privacy, you can hear everything going on in there too. Overall the hotel is just loud. Another disappointment is the mood lighting. My room was soooo dark, even with all the lights turned on it was just dim. I called it mood lighting but when your putting on make up or just want to get a good view of your outfit, that dim lighting simply makes it difficult. If you are looking for a place close to Hollywood, this hotel is sufficient just be aware that you may run into exclusive parties that result in you flashing your room key to gain entrance into the hotel. One major positive is the roof of this hotel. It's very beautiful with it's canopy beds and splash pool.

Reviews.Title: “We weren't cool enough for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluerainy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W because it had a central location with a metro station underneath the hotel. This was great as it allowed us easy access anywhere we wanted to go. Unfortunately, the hotel itself was a letdown. It is very young and hip, and we just weren't cool enough for this hotel. The rooms are lovely, but we had a few difficulties which did not get addressed in a timely manner. We also returned late one afternoon to change for dinner and our room was not made up yet--had to ask at the front desk. The reply was, "Oh, do you still want it done?" The security thing is weird and makes you feel like you don't want to leave the hotel at night as they are so suspicious of you. If you have a hotel passkey, how many times do you need to show it? Also, we could not get in any of the doors except the main door even after showing our passkey to security--apparently these are locked down. On a cold rainy night, it was really annoying to have to walk around the block to get into the hotel. Also, be prepared to pay a surcharge for just about everything from water to internet access. If you are cool and hip and don't plan to leave the hotel at night, this is a great place for you. The metro close by is a huge plus but not enough for me to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wherever, Whenever....Whatever”
Reviews.Author: Btw120
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very nice upgrade into a beautiful suite- thank you for that Negative: No matter how nice a place you stay @, room, hotel, etc- the service and treatment of staff can ruin the whole trip. I have stayed an many W's as a Platinum member and 9/10 enjoy my stay and have had an amazing time. This was that 1 in 10 time. This W Hollywood almost ruined my taste of SPG. I am a 30 year old young professional that am pretty amiable to whatever scene I am in- but for some reason the staff at W Hollywood thought they were better then anyone, infact I was told to leave my seat in the "Living Room" because if it was reserved for I'm assuming more important people- I mean c'mon it's a freakin Hotel Lobby- if they wanted me to buy a bottle- that could of been done easily. Anyways, Drai's of Hollywood was closed in which Chris Nelson, the W Insider, said he would get me and my sister in and it ruined our whole evening plans, I had to have a argument with matthew, the front desk manager who was trying to offer me free points (who cares) my experience was already ruined. Then as I was trying to get up to my room security thought I was trying to sneak into the hotel? Please- this is what I recommend to future SPG travelers- if you want a nice stay, stay at the SLS Beverly Hills, or if you want better treatment stay any other hotel, Westin, Aloft, Sheraton, believe me- i can tolerate attitude, but not from people who are wanna be actors and think they are better then everyone. I have never had one bad think to say about any of the W's I have been to several thru out the country- this one outdid itself and I'll think again the next time I hit up L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - not bad”
Reviews.Author: annlangton
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of W hotels as I work in the event field so I am often in and out of hotels during the weekends working on projects but this was the first one that I actually stayed in. I liked the decor which is fabulous. The front desk service was very good. I was lucky to stay on SPG cash and points so you cannot complain. It was a fabulous deal. I liked the restaurant in the hotel called Delfina or something like that. The breakfast was good. When you stay in a nice hotel you know that the food and anemiites aren't going to be "cheap" so I found the restaurant food very good. We had a lovely brunch and because it was lunch time, the hotel had a "card" for a dessert which the host gave me and it was fabulous. Having the SPG card is great when you stay at the Starwood property because we received a gift of 2 small bottles of fiji water a day which was nice. There was coffee in the morning also complimentary. Though we didn't use it, there was a 1 time car service with Acura or something like that. Quite nice. The area isn't what I had hoped but then again, I never stayed in Hollywood. We did walk around but mainly LA is a driving town. If you do drive, the car valet is almost $40 a day which is typical but to me that's like 2 nice cocktails so for 5 nights, the $200 not including all the tips was as bit of a sole point but that is typical and I only wish there was a self park option but we were told there was not. The roof top pool is awesome. Even though it was December we did lay out. We were there was one lovely couple and it felt like we owned the world. The design looks like something you would see in the TV show Entourage....all cool. I do have photos but I don't have time to post but it really is a nicely designed space. One strange thing I noticed...we don't get our shampoo or soap replaced. I think its all part of the green movement but it's so embarrassing to call the front desk to request soap, shampoo, etc. I wish they would just give it to you. And lastly, I love the closet with the automatic light. The nice dryer in the room, and the built in tv. There is a small mini bar and we actually never do this but one night we just "went" for it and splurged. It was fun. The bed is low but quite nice. Must say - great place. And I won't ruin it but when you get on the elevator - notice the changing greeting of the carpets. It's cute.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: perthguy6
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for a couple of nights just after Xmas and we loved it. Very modern as its new with great lobby area and funky rooms, the kids kept looking for Hollywood stars! An easy 10 min walk down to Grumans Chinese theatre and the kids loved the Elcapitan with the Tron movie showing, thanks for the recommendation by the front desk. I also noted the water cost of $9 a bottle and as a Gold SPG member that travels with the Sheraton brand around the world, I suggest just give us a bottle free, it works all over the rest of the world and I bet it would for you too. Small cost to put a smile on a customers face. Kids also loved the pool area but a little cold and wet while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Stay - Thank You Tess!”
Reviews.Author: Fezman1
Reviews.Content: We came to LA for a wedding and decided to spend a couple of extra days at the W Hollywood to celebrate our tenth anniversary. Despite the horrible LA weather, we had a great stay. Tess greeted us at the front desk and could not have been nicer. When we casually mentioned that it was our tenth, she immediately upgraded our room and later sent up a bottle of champagne! We were overwhelmed by her thoughtfulness. The hotel is beautiful, our corner room was spacious and comfortable and the staff was super friendly. We would love to stay here again next time we come to LA. Thank you Tess for your kindness and for making our anniversary even more special.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WHlywdFan
Reviews.Content: W is by far my favorite Starwood brand .... from the minute i drive up to the Valet i feel at home. The entire staff is amaaaaazing!! Valet, Front Desk, Room Service, Stylists, and the Welcome Desk Manager Alana is super FAB!!! I feel validated at the the W Hollywood for WHO i Am. It feeds my artistic hunger and the possibilities seem endless once i leave W Hollywood....i have even adopted a new slogan for myself after my W Hollywood stays and it is .... "W Hollywood!! Lights! Camera! Action! im Yours" Looking forward to many, many more W moments

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, but be prepared to be gouged for any extras”
Reviews.Author: chp37
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels over 90 days per year, so I have seen a lot. On the positive, the staff attitude and helpfulness was outstanding. The only shortcoming is not enough front desk staff and long long waits to check in or get service or even ask a question. The rooms were very stylish, yet comfortable and spotlessly clean, but I do miss having a soaking tub. Handy to have all the chargers and outlets on the desk, so you don't have to fumble through your bag to pull yours out. On the negative, there are no coffeemakers in the room, so to just get coffee ($8) on the menu was $17 after taxes, service charges and tip and $9 for in room water. I went to Trader Joes around the back of the hotel and stocked up for breakfast rather than overpay. The parking was $38/day with no discounts for guests. I pay less in Manhattan. Also, the pool area did not have a single lounge chair for sunning, but lots of cabanas, for which I am sure they charge for rental. Also, internet was $15/day, which is excessive, especially for US hotels.I would stay again, but bring my own food supplies, since even though I am on an expense account, I hate to feel that I am being ripped off just because they can. I was on the upper floors and could hear the disco at night, but I turned the Heat/AC fan to high and that helped drown the sound out. With all the velvet ropes and focus on the scene, it has a bit of an aura of exclusivity that I found off-putting. The bar was very pricy and hard to get a seat. It would be nice if they had more bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, don't stay here is you are needing sleep!”
Reviews.Author: rumerhazit
Reviews.Content: We came in for a quick concert at the Greek Theatre. The location is great and if you are looking for a scene, this is the spot. If you are wanting a W brand service with great rooms, this is your place. If you want to sleep at night, stay somewhere else. The place is a party, the halls at night are loud and the entire hotel becomes a nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood does not disappoint the brand... music, energy, excitement, even on a Sunday night!”
Reviews.Author: may0514
Reviews.Content: I flew into LA for a concert, and W Hollywood was the perfect location. From the moment I checked in, there was moment after moment of great service in this amazingly chic hotel. The front desk manager accommodated us with a room type change. The restaurant manager greeted and engaged us during our meal. The staff was so fun and friendly! After the concert, we returned to a packed Sunday night of jazz in the living room, and drai's was rocking upstairs! What a W-WOW!!!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Digs in a Prime Spot”
Reviews.Author: SoCalDan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with friends and had a great time! The room was modern but comfortable. The sexy silhouette panel in the shower was very cool. The bed was very comfortable and I loved the sheets. This is a great place to stay for a fun night out in Hollywood!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Weekend...Phenomenal Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: mbcali
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Hollywood to celebrate my 40th birthday and it was an absolutely perfect weekend. In addition to a spectacular suite, even by W standards, it was the incredible service and hospitality provided by the staff at the hotel that made the stay so enjoyable!! I would especially like to thank Chris Nelson, the VIP host and Mauren at the front desk for going above and beyond all weekend! Because of the service provided, I will definitely be back and will highly recommend to others! - Rob Powell

Reviews.Title: “W is for Wanted to stay longer and Want to go back”
Reviews.Author: jacwar58
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here, a family group of 6 people. Having read the previous reviews about the hotel having a fun vibe at weekends I contacted the hotel direct and requested rooms on a quiet floor. This request was not a problem and there was a lovely touch left in my room (thanks Jim!) which shows that customer care is paramount to the running of this hotel. From check in to check out the staff were nothing but friendly, courteous and helpful. The rooms were fabulous and the bed luxurious. The lights could be adjusted and dimmed to suit your mood accordingly. The quality and cleaning of the room couldn't have been better. The weather wasn't the best during our stay but we did pop up to the pool to take a look and I can imagine it on a lovely sunny day. I'm not the right age group to go to a club so I gave it a miss, but judging from the beautiful people in the lobby of the hotel on a weekend night I imagine it to be the place to go and be seen. Other reviews have mentioned the area where the hotel is. There is a metro station just outside and as far as I'm concerned it was a godsend as we relied on public transport to get back and forth from the airport (Flyaway bus to Union Station and red line metro direct to the hotel). Yes, there were a few homeless people there at night but they did not cause any problems or make us feel at any risk. It is at the end of Hollywood Blvd and there are some cheap underwear shops there, but there are equally as many fast food places and bars so you have to put it into perspective. It's only a short walk to Hollywood Highlands (or one metro stop) where you'll find plenty of places to eat, drink and better shop. All in all, I think this is a Wonderful hotel, far exceeded the quality of the other 4* hotels we stayed in during our 12 day trip to the USA. If I ever return to LA then this is where I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best W”
Reviews.Author: nyc_runnergirl
Reviews.Content: Room was small and poorly lit and shabby despite this hotel being basically new. They screwed up our room keys. Also quite loud due to the club upstairs.....However, biggest complaint is the Bliss Spa - extremely expensive and high pressure sales tactics to "upsell" you on things that should be included, like massage oil for my 1-hr, $175 massage (wtf?). Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “modern; good location”
Reviews.Author: markyboo
Reviews.Content: New and modern. Attractive inside and out. Impressive rooftop bar. Excellent gym (comp) Valet parking incl (only with a special package added to reservation) exceptional location. The rooftop bar, lobby bar, etc are all a serparate business to the hotel: lobby bar is too expensive (30mls of blue label for $50!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) + unfriendly belligerent bar staff = angry me. Note to the girl behind the bar: YOU ARE PAID TO SERVE GUESTS DRINKS AND I DONT CARE IF YOUR AN UNEMPLOYED ACTRESS WITH ATTITUDE. Bottom line: good hotel. avoid bar and related staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wow at the W Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: qddawg
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Hollywood the weekend before Thanksgiving, same weekend as the AMA's. I have nothing but praise for the entire team and my experience. I had some issues getting information from Drais's regarding table/cabana service. I contacted the hotel directlly asking if they could assist me (The W does not manage Drais). Within a few hours I had 2 phone calls and 3 emails offering me assistance with my needs and all were met making my friends b-day a night to remember. My flight from NYC to LA was delayed which caused my reservation time at Boa to pass, I had called Boa directly and was informed that their were no other reservations available. When I checked in at the W the front desk asked if I needed anything, I explained my situation with Boa and asked if they could recommend another restaraunt, one phone call later by the conceirge, a new reservation was available for me at Boa. The security at the hotel was top notch checking room keys for those coming and going late night, bartenders made well poured drinks - especially for the price. The rooms were slightly over average size, and quite large by NYC standards. A great place for people watching, partying, or just lounging around. They've got a great fitness center and pool area (although no swimming was had due to the weather). The price was pretty reasonable, i booked on line for a package that included overnight parking and 2 drinks (parking is $30/night+, drinks are easily $14+/each) for about $240/night. You get what you pay for and if you want to be treated like a star and live like one I'd recommend the W Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Sleep and they really nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: jackward77
Reviews.Content: With a Club upstairs and restaurants and lounges downstairs this is a busy hotel. It didn't help that there was a weird audible buzzing vibration in the wall and ceiling. The one thing that really bugged me was that there seemed to nickel and dime you. They had a nasty habit of adding mandatory service charges on a lot of bills and the fact that everything in the room had a price tag on it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow WOW!”
Reviews.Author: warytraveler01
Reviews.Content: I LOVED this place! I was lucky enough to get upgraded to their WOW suite and boy did it deliver! It was huge, comfy and very nicely decorated. It had 2 window seats with what seemed like a twin sized mattress in them with some comfy pillows. Perfect for taking a nap and relaxing in. I had friends up to the room and even w/ 6 guys and 2 ladies everyone fit comfortably on the couch or in the closest window seat. Service was wonderful, but I've come to expect that at a W. The room service was good and fast, also available 24 hours a day. We had drinks at Drai's one night and the drinks were great and the atmosphere was fun, perfect way to kick off a conference. All in all I really didn't want to check out when it came time to leave! Loved this place and would be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, Beautiful Hotel But Not A Great Place To Sleep”
Reviews.Author: IRCIA
Reviews.Content: Here' s a review of the hotel from two perspectives: one from a person who was in L.A. on a 2 week business trip (my husband) and one who was in L.A. on vacation for 5 days (me). The W Hollywood is a beautifully designed hotel with spacious, modern rooms. The clientelle tends to be primarily in their 20's and 30's (with a lot of money to spend it seems as this is not an inexpensive hotel). The hotel's Drai nightclub is a major draw and there lies the problem in trying to get a good night's sleep. Nightly at about 3 AM when the club closes you'll either be hearing the ruckus outside the hotel or in the hallway outside your room from those who had one too many drinks. We had to call security on more than one occasion during our stay. I'd suggest bringing heavy duty earplugs if sleep is important to you during your stay. That being said we did find the staff very courteous and extremely helpful especially those that worked the concierge desk. We appreciated the use of a nicely equipped gym but the rooftop swimming pool is more of a "set design piece" than a pool you can actually use. To enjoy your first cup of coffee of the day one needs to make the trek down to the lobby to get it as the rooms are not equipped with coffee machines. We did eventually ask for a coffee maker for the room and they were nice enough to provide one but they had to be reminded daily to provide the coffee for it. The location of the hotel was convenient for our purposes but the neighbourhood as such left a lot to be desired (unless you're looking for a tattoo parlour that is, there are lots of them in the area). So would I recommend this hotel? yes and no. It all depends on what you're looking for. It's a beautiful hotel, no doubt about it, with a well trained, courteous staff but the neighbourhood is not the best nor are your chances of getting a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Jina72
Reviews.Content: Jim McPartlin, the GM has a great team there and everyone was fantastic right from the beginning to the end. Having done my share of events at various properties throughout North America for the past 5 years, there are teams that should be noted for excellence. The banquet staff who worked on our event was exceptional - Donald, Cat and Daniel. Nothing was ever an obstacle even with the ever changing number of meals needed. They were so amazingly accommodating. And Albert was just the answer to everything. Never failed to help me out with whatever I needed. And a special thanks to Michael who took care of specific requests and needs and they just kind of happened. It's like asking the wizard and poof - DONE! Chantelle really came through for me with the short notice that I had with all the changes in our corporate schedule. I'm thankful that Chantelle was able to find us a meeting space and going through the contract phase with ease. And a special thanks to Jacky who really made everything easy from the moment we got on the phone to discuss BEOs and through the entire execution stage of the event. She was such a great help with the issues in space (our attendance grew) and all the other additional things outside of the actual event. Which definitely made getting through the weekend much easier for me. The entire front desk, housekeeping, valet, everyone was just a delight. I can say that the team at Hollywood truly does take the W's motto of "whatever, whenever" to heart and own it. Also the PSAV at this property were just fantastic and so quick to react to any glitches as they do happen. I just wanted to express my appreciation of having had such a great experience and congratulate the W Hollywood in having such an excellent team. Especially for one that is fairly new! Kudos! These events are so important to us and I was glad to see it was as important to the W that everything ran smoothly. I look forward to running another event at the W Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel... failing at some little things”
Reviews.Author: smatter
Reviews.Content: my wife and i recently spent 5 nights at the W over Halloween. pros: beautiful place, central location for exploring L.A., great service, my wife really enjoyed the bliss spa, trader joes around the block cons: insulation not great for a brand new hotel and oh, yes, the "mandatory" valet parking i know its a top-notch luxury hotel (and it really is) and all but lets face facts, i really don't want to pay $38 a day for parking and shouldn't have to. especially not in Hollywood where every other block is an open parking lot. luckily we figured out that the SAME garage they park the cars in is accessible on the back side of the block and its only $16 a day. on the other hand, there is free wi-fi in the "Living Room" which is a nice touch

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: LSquared1
Reviews.Content: Very courteous and concerned staff; overall experience exceeded our expectations. Our wishes were met with a fabulous level service and accommodation. The Bliss Spa was terrific also. If you're looking to be pampered, this is the place. Highly recommended for the ultimate Hollywood experience!

Reviews.Title: “The W Hollywood Is The Best Hotel Experience I Have Ever Had”
Reviews.Author: HugoD1963
Reviews.Content: I am a So. Ca. native and decided to try this W hotel everyone was talking about. I checked in Friday Nov, 5th and it was such a nice experience. The room was great, the view was incredible and the staff makes you always feel like a VIP. Manager Trent at Delphine Eatery and Bar also made our stay very enjoyable. His staff was very attentive and stopped at nothing to make sure we had a perfect dinner.. I highly recomend the W and Delphine to all locals and visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: vicquintana
Reviews.Content: I spent multiple nights at the W and got to know some of the staff very well. Everyone was incredibly accommodating and nice. I was there for business and I felt like everyone from the valet staff to the front desk staff was always looking out for my deliveries and packages. I can't imagine staying anywhere else! I've also had just about everything on the food and drink menu, because I was there for so long. I can definitely say that everything tastes great! They definitely lived up to their Whatever, Whenever motto.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool!”
Reviews.Author: ckdnl
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It definitely has the "Hollywood feel" and is truly unique. The staff was very friendly and the room was comfortable. The only minor issues would be the fact that is that the property is located approximately 15 minutes walk from Hollywood attractions and there were some nights that were a little noisy due to the rooftop bar. But overall, if you want to stay at a trendy spot during your Hollywood visit, this spot is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: travelinvasion
Reviews.Content: We spent a night last month as we were attending a concert at the Music Box just down the street. The hotel has a great location on Hollywood Blvd and seems to loom large over Hollywood. My girlfriend used her Staerwood points for the room. The desk clerk was fast and courteous. She told us the room rate was normally close to $400 a night. Charging another $40 for parking and wifi seems excessive. It's 2010 and the W can't even throw in wifi with the inflated rate? When we returned later that evening we decided to order room service from a very limited menu. The food consisting of a cheese plate and pasta bowl did arrive quickly although the portions were tiny for the price paid around $48. The bed was extremely comfortable, although the night was basically ruined when the fire alarm rang on two separate occasions between 3 and 4AM. The alarms were followed by a loud announcement over the intercom informing everyone that it was a false alarm. It appears the hotel is basically a party hotel on the weekends. I definitely would pass on the W if romance with your partner is what you are seeking.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PDXChick
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. I was a little nervous about the staff after reading some negative reviews, but I found them to be very helpful. The first room I was assigned to smelled strongly of cigarette smoke, my room was quickly switched and the woman who helped me was extremely apologetic. One thing to keep in mind is that there really isn't anything that great within walking distance. I knew this ahead of time so it was okay for me, but it is something to keep in mind when booking this hotel. Also, just a personal preference, but I find valet only parking to be a hassle, it is also expensive at around $35/night. I realize this is the going rate, and I did know of the charge ahead of time. I paid around $150/night using Hotwire, my review is based on that price. Would I pay the rack rate of $300/night.? No, I don't really see how I would get my money's worth especially when you add on the parking fee, and everything else that you have to pay separately for such as internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Expected better - wish I had stayed at Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: louisawoo
Reviews.Content: I managed to bid for a room at the W Hotel Hollywood, thorugh price line and managed to get a standard room for $120 a night plus taxes. Thought this was great and could not wait to stay there. When we arrived check in was fine. We had flown from New York at 5am so we settled down for an early night. But sadly until about 1am the room next door was playing thumping music and girls were screaming - I was actually really concerned that our room backed onto the club (as I heard they had a night club), I went out into the hall to investigate and no, it was all coming from a room next door. I could hear the lyrcis to each song they were playing through my ear plugs it was that loud. The next night those guests must have left but then we heard the music from the club/bar. no sleep again. I wanted to cry, we were out sightseeing all day and just wanted a decent nights sleep but did not get one during our stay. We did not venture to the rooftop pool or the club as once we saw the type of people that were going in, we felt we were not 'glam' enough and had heard stories from other guests that they had to wait at the rope just to get back into the hotel. it was all a bit pretencious with the red rope and loads of glammed up people despearatly trying to get into the club/pool- we left them to it. Location-wise, no really the best, depends what you want to see. We would stay over in West Hollywood next time or at the Beach. Once you leave the doors of the hotel you are right above the Hollywood/Vine station - which was great. What was not so great is that as soon as you get out of those doors you have homeless people asking you for money and ciggerettes - really opened my eyes to the real Hollyoowd. On our first evening we walked from the hotel to Hollywood/Highland. On the way (20 min walk) we saw one guy get arrseted, a police helicopter swooping over, the shops literally were all smoke shops, tour shop, sex shops and so on.....we did not walk back at night but got the subway as we did not really feel that safe. Servcie from the hotel - well non existant for us.We had a call on our last night from the conceirge/whatever, whenever guy asking if there was anything we needed? Was a bit late as we were checking out in the morning. On check out I knew we had not spent a penny at the hotel (would you buy a small bottle of water for $10?). The lady on the desk gave me a piece of paper with 'amount to be charged - 0' and said 'all good to go'. I thought that was it, no charge as I had pre-paid the room. Got in taxi and checked again, I had been charged $188 for Spa treatments I had never had! I had to phone the hotel 6 times and no one ever called me back apart from after 6 calls, a lovely lady from their finance dept. Guy on the desk was poor, Spa employees were poor, everytime someone took my number and said they would get back to me but never did. One guy on the desk even gave me the Spa's number but when I rang it was for Madam ussauds in Hollywood? I finally got my money back onto credit card a week later but am not lumbered with £35 worth of mobile phone charges. Wrote to the hotel over a week ago to compalin about the whole thing and my bill but surprisingly, no reply. If you have tons of money and money is no object then stay here and they will most probably give you great service. As a normal cusotmer who just wnated a room and to get some sleep, I did not have a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Abi1801
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for 4 nights during our anniversary stay after getting a bargain deal on Hotwire. Check in was easy and the staff are all really friendly. As it was our anniversary we were given a free drink each at the bar which was a nice touch. The room itself was clean and spacious. Yes we could hear the nightclub most nights and the pool party on a Sunday afternoon was quite loud but we knew it was going to be like this before we went. It never kept us awake anyway! It is a party hotel so if you want to come for a family holiday, it’s probably not the place for you. We parked the car at the W Hotel parking lots on the first night and after that we just used the parking lot at the back of the hotel as it was half the price and just as secure (we could see it from the room)! It was only when we got home did we realise that the W had billed our card for the whole trip even though we told them on check out that we hadn’t used the valet parking. They apologised immediately and refunded the charge so that was easily rectified. It’s in a good location for the Hollywood sights and we could just see the Hollywood Sign if we squashed our noses to the window! Its about a 15 minute stroll to the Chinese Theatre. In the day time it’s a great walk, but at night time it is not such a nice place! It is right by the tube/subway though which is convenient. We didn’t use the pool as we were out and about every day but we did go up there one afternoon to have a look and everyone looked like they were enjoying themselves! All in all we would come back here but we would only be prepared to pay the discount rates off somewhere like hotwire as the noise and party atmosphere do take the edge of it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ShocKs12
Reviews.Content: The W in Hollywood is without question the best hotel I have ever stayed at. Upon arrival, we checked into two Wonderful rooms and we were quickly looked after and treating like any other guest would have been treated, even if they had a suite. The rooms were good size and very modern and had good views of the Hollywood hills. I had a quick look around the pool area and the place was kicking! Lovely views from there and it had a great vibe. The lobby area had a great ambience and the food at Delphine's restaurant was amazing. We had a night at Drai's where we had bottle service and the service was unbelievably good! I could go on with how good this hotel is, but you will just have to experience it yourself. The facilities were second to none but they weren't the best part of the hotel...the service we received from the staff was unbelievable. I have not experience service like this at any hotel I have previously stayed at. I can't understand the bad reviews of service that you see on here... I guess they are just picky people and do not fit into the W Lifestyle! I can't wait for my return to Los Angeles next year and I will for sure be staying at The W once again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property, best staff and GM!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NathanHalliday
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel, and you can't get an experience like this anywhere else. The staff is top notch, and so is the GM Jim! Everyone is so on top of their game and will do everything to make you feel as welcome as possible here. Stay here if your coming to LA!

Reviews.Title: “You Don't Have To Actually Be An "A-List Celebratory" To Be Treated Like One!”
Reviews.Author: BabaDas
Reviews.Content: The W HOLLYWOOD: I have stayed multiple times at this top rated Starwood property and felt it high time to share the love with my fellow "Road Warriors" - When your ready to have the authentic "Hollywood Experience" don't settle for anything less then The W Hollywood. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION: The property is still less then a year old and still has that "Brand New feeling" when You walk into your room and feel like your the first one to stay there! The location is in the heart of Hollywood! - not too mention that the HOTTEST NIGHT CLUB in LA is outside your door! (Dre's) THE CREW: You come to now the Staff first hand and they are truly exceptional.Here' s why, when this property first as ready to open THOUSANDS of PROSPECTS applied and were narrowed down to the TOP few hundred as hand-picked by the General Manager. So you can expect the highest level of service because the privilege of being part The W Hollywood team is on that is highly sought after. On this past stay learned that one of the current Top Guest Relations Manager is a former volunteer for The Peace Corps (he spent several years in Africa) Talk about WELL ROUNDED! ROOMS: I suggest spending a little extra and securing one of th Cool Corner Suites- they are HUGE and you truly will impress the heck out of anyone that has taste and class! The Euro white leather circular couch in the center of the suite is mind blowing! The Marvelous Suite is a little less money but is still one of the finest suite rooms I have ever stayed in. The value for what you pay is unprecedented. INSIDER TIPS: Although you are offered an awesome selection of In-room wet bar and Munchies Bar the items are a bit pricey! They just opened a Trader Joe's right next to the property and it's with going there for snacks and bottle water to stock up your room. The best kept secret is Monday Night Happy Hour from 7PM - 10 PM They have a $1 Raw Bars at the Hotel's restaurant called Delphine's. They have the most amazing Raw Oysters, Clams, Garlic Shrimp, and fried Cod most of which is under $3 an appetizer! The freshest Seafood in LA! Try the "Delphine's Manhattan" drink it's a frigging Mind-Eraser! Also, on Sunday, just down the street is the Hollywood Farmer's Market! It is by far the BEST, FRESHEST, and most diverse Farmers Market in Southern Cali! And you can easily stay and shop for several hours. go hungry! Bottom line: Take it from a kindred soul traveler that spends 70 nights plus a year in a hotel room: The W Hollywood is THE PLACE to be when "you be" in Hollywood! -Mr. Mitch

Reviews.Title: “Young and Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: koko269
Reviews.Content: I loved that this hotel always had something going on at night. People were always drinking in the lounge and there was a club downstairs as well. The rooms are very modern and trendy. I love that. Housekeeping forgot to give me new soap and conditioner twice. They were really quick to answer my requests though. They brought them up within 10 minutes. When I requested for a phone book, it came up in about 15 minutes as well. It was a little noisy sometimes when I tried to sleep, but it wasn't overly loud. Just a quiet murmur when I slept. The doormen need to smile a bit more too, I know you're trying to have a cool vibe going on, but a bit more friendly to hotel guests wouldn't hurt. Other than that, the stay was great and convenient. Oh and parking is $24 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: LBET
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several W Hotels across the country, and this was not one of my favorites. It was a beautiful hotel. The rooms were clean, and the service at the reservations desk and the concierge were great. However, the link of this hotel with Drai's is what makes this place so overrated. Mainly, the racket of Drai's kind of makes this place less chill to stay at and seems to bring in a particularly Chachi clientele. There were lines to get into the pool, club, and even the lobby at night. We had drinks in the lobby one night, where friends who live in LA waited in line to have a cocktail with us in the lobby. We attempted to go to the outside space of the lobby once they got through the first line only to find another velvet rope and line to get to the outside part of the lobby, and even found a line that we had to wait in when we tried to leave. We had to wait for someone to open the velvet rope to leave! My friends and I immediately left and went to a more chill bar in Hollywood. (I used to live in LA, and my friends and I are late 20's/early 30's, so it's not like we were looking for some kind of Senior Center or something.) The pool and nightclub were the same scene. Now, if the scene once you were through all of the lines was awesome, I wouldn't have a problem with it, but once we were through all of the lines, we were like, "This is it?" The whole overrated racket of Drai's kind of made our stay at the hotel less relaxing. Not sure we'd stay there again. It was like Disneyland for Chaches.

Reviews.Title: “This W is phoning it in...”
Reviews.Author: cstaples
Reviews.Content: Generally we love the whole W vibe-- the W Hollywood is a pale imitation of some of their best properties. You expect these hotels to make an immediate statement-- the lobby here is cavernous and more than a little boring. The rooms are fine, but again, very predictable. The roof top pool was crowded, expensive and dirty (even at opening, there was gunk in the corners that would make you lose your appetite). And for such a new facility, the pool area was already looking beaten up and shabby. If you want real Hollywood glamour, stay at the SLS in Beverly Hills or the London. Both put this place to shame.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: ruth057
Reviews.Content: I couldn't get over how nice all the staff was to the time I got out of the car to the time I left. The valet, the check in staff, the servers, maintenance people, everyone. In times like this it was so refreshing. Although modern decor is not my style, it just didn't bother me with such welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: ThaisNewYork
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to LA and stayed at the new W Hollywood. I don't usually write reviews but in this case I had to. I loved the hotel. The staff was great, the hotel was beautiful, the food was excellent and the experience was great fun. It was like an oasis in Hollywood. I would recommend it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad place but watch out for the club!!”
Reviews.Author: underwoodadam
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the second leg of our holiday journey, and where met with a fairly unwelcoming receptionist who seemed to busy to acknowledge four of us despite the fact that we where the only ones in the reception checking in. good thing to know if you drive to the trader joes car park it $16 for a day not £35 in the valet and a secure underground car park that im sure they use for valeted car. the rooms where nice and we all stayed on the 10th floor, however the glass panel in a room with two double beds is very odd and sure must course them problems with people sharing a room who are not a couple as we had. it took over 4 hours to get some on to tape up the glass so our friends sharing a room could use the shower. the location is good with ease access to the metro which will take you all over so good plus point, however on a nigth time it becomes full of people due to the club and getting a place in the bar is tp go early and stake a claim (best bet if you fancy a drink head to dillions across the road good service and cheap beers $3 a pint for all drafts even imports great stuff. The pool is owned by the club so dont expect to fit in a late nigth swim. the only real down side is the noise from the club and the fact that they are very proactive about making sure that if have not paid to get in the club you dont get in, or access the pool at nigth but not bother once the people in the club end up on the room floors for the hotel twice had groups of women very drunk having a picnic outside my room and was not impressed that they where not residence of the hotel! surely a security guard on the lifts would be better up at the pool to prevent this. but seemed not to be bothered with this when we told the desk. we stayed on the 10th floor so i say the lower the less the sound as the clubs on the 11th the hotel as a whole is nice and very flash but the atmosphere is a little strange if your not somebody they percieve of worth you dont get the best treatment as by the 5th nigth i was fed up of being constantly asked for my key card to prove i was a resident by the same secruity guards. but overall the hotel is a good base and close to all the iconic places in hollywood. but be prepared to be questioned at nearly every turn and expect lots of velvet ropes.

Reviews.Title: “Refused entry and pushed aside even though hotel guests”
Reviews.Author: LAR0cks
Reviews.Content: We are from Scotland and visit Erwin (Venice) every year or Georgian (Santa Monica).we always stay middle weekend in up market Hollywood Hotel. W looked amazing so booked there this year.We went for meal to Katsuyi and on our return some very arrogant gentleman( i use this phrase loosely)put his arm across me, blocking my entrance to the Hotel. I tried to explain I was a guest but he put his hand up to face and proceeded to talk to someone else. We tried to go to the outside bar but again were blocked ( hand up at face)and advised there was a private function on! So our exciting night in the W ended in going to bed as the Lobby Bar was boring.We were extremely well dressed and groomed yet treated like this ,felt it was Ageism.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightclub that Doubles as a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: limajt91279
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel Hollywood is located in picturesque Hollywood near the Pantages Theatre, the Capitol Records building and tons of tourists. The hotel, which is located on Hollywood boulevard and Argyle, is centrally located and provides the “Hollywood” experience – good and bad. I stayed at the hotel for four nights in September and was pleased with its aesthetic and the cordial staff. Everyone was really nice, especially the waitresses in the lobby bar. I checked in on a Wednesday night and was greeted by a long line of club-goers who were anxiously waiting to get into the hotels new roof-top club, Drais. I alerted the greeters that I was checking in and they let me pass through the velvet rope and into the lobby. Check-in was quick once I got into the hotel. I stayed on the 11th floor in a Wonderful room that overlooked the parking lot but had a clear view of Downtown L.A. The room was spacious and the bed amazing. The bathroom has a window that looks into the living space, which is interesting. Thankfully I was traveling alone or my companion could view me relieving myself. Yikes! Take note: when staying on the higher floors, you can hear the music from Drais nightclub. One evening I arrived to my hotel room to find a young woman passed out in the hallway, shoeless with a garbage bag for vomiting (sophistication at its finest). I utilized “Sweat” often during my stay and laud the W Hotel Hollywood for providing a large workout area with nice equipment. Delphine, the hotel’s French restaurant was nice and the manager was extremely attentive. I ordered a burger and was satisfied with the portion. The W Hotel Hollywood isn’t a bad hotel it’s just set up to be a nightclub. The lobby is expansive and usually fills up quickly at night with party-goers sashaying around flaunting their designer clothing. From my review you’d think I was elderly and out of place at the W Hotel but I’m in my early thirties. Don’t get me wrong, I love to party and have a good time, but getting to my hotel room shouldn’t require getting by a bouncer at the elevator bank.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient....”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Located next to the hollywood and vine station it was pretty easy to walk about a mile or so to the Gruman Theatre...nice pool on the roof and since it wasn't a weekend, there wasn't too much of the overbearing hollywood vibe that might intimidate families. There were a couple of photographers taking pictures of some relatively no name reality tv stars near the entrance. Rooms were clean and nice and really didn't feel that the neighborhood was dangerous (then again i'm from NY). You can get a nice picture and view of the hollywood sign from the rooftop corner.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic vibe, great decor, superior service”
Reviews.Author: ck_spencer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth every penny. Great Hollywood vibe, decor is very modern and hip, rooms have every amenity and are comfortable. Service was outstanding. Restaurant has good food and not overpriced. They even accomodated a kids meal! Parking is expensive $35/night.

Reviews.Title: “Definition of cool.”
Reviews.Author: jzabs
Reviews.Content: Los Angeles is experiencing a serious heat wave. I couldn't take my hot apartment so I checked into the W Hollywood for a night. I loved it so much I stayed for two! The GM, Jim McPartlin treats everyone like family. It may be a big hotel in a big city but every employee makes you feel special. My room looked at the famous Capitol Records building and The Pantages Theater and as anyone who's ever stayed at a W knows... the beds can't be beat! Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy and the "Wish" idea is good but just that...an idea.”
Reviews.Author: djcrafa
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning is too noisy. Halls and bar kept me awake all night. People in halls yelling and screaming and laughing until 4 am. No door on shower is weird and means the bathroom, which is awesome, gets soaked. Very expensive parking @ $35/night. If you intend to use the spa, book way in advance as getting appts. are difficult. They couldn't accommodate 2 of us for mani-pedi's and yet we found out they only had 1 person working Sat and Sun. Crazy. Champagne in spa is cool idea, but bad champagne. Beautiful hotel but very expensive food, extra resort charges, etc. Wouldn't accommodate early check-in or late check out either. Very busy. They also told us at 11th hour that the night we were there, they were closing the nice restaurant, pool and night club for a charity cancer event. We had already paid so too late to cancel. That was disappointing. We had a Marvelous Suite which was very cool, large and fun. Nothing wrong with the room itself except we had to get an engineer up to fix our phones. Argh! I don't know if I'd stay again unless I got a really good deal and ensured the spa, pool, restaurant and night club was going to be able to accommodate us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Service is horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Newyork1801
Reviews.Content: All levels of service at this hotel is sub standard, and lacks management training. More attention is paid to the over rated and hyped up hotel restaurants and bars with uneducated door men and service host. The room was average and over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: luke7011
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was amazing even though we didn’t arrive until 1:30 in the morning we were still welcomed with a smile and quick check in. The rooms and Facilities were all modern and elegant with amazing decor that made you feel like you were in Hollywood. The only disappointing thing I had to say about this hotel is the parking charges for hotel guests they only have valet for 38 dollars a night I find that be excessive so I found parking nearby. The hotel crowd here is younger especially at night but I did see families staying here. The rooms are quite I herd people partying a couples doors down while I was walking by but I couldn’t hear them in my room. The nightlife around the area is very popular if you plan on going out go early or you will end up waiting for 30 minutes. The concierge is also helpful if you need help on finding places to go. We walked to the Chinese theater one day with stopping and taking pictures and looking at shops it took about 30 minutes. However there is a subway station right at the front door of the hotel and the theater is only one station down so we took that coming back and it took less than 5 minutes. On Sunday we were out walking around the area looking for lunch and we saw a farmers market where we ate lunch it was great food at good price. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and hopefully next time we can make it to the pool which we just didn’t have time for and the hotel’s club on the roof (The line was to Long)

Reviews.Title: “A nightmare !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: milou9
Reviews.Content: Impossible to sleep, it's a party all night on every floor, the breakfast was cold, and the jams containers had been previously opened and used and still made their way to my tray !!!! DO NOT STAY THERE. The police was there all night arresting people outside in the streets, non stop sirens, non stop screaming. Every one was drunk, screaming in the hall ways. I felt I was in a party house. That hotel is all about the booze, the girls, the drugs and nothing else.... I sent them a letter the next day, still no reply.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly LA”
Reviews.Author: beglisc
Reviews.Content: We spent a quick night at the W while on a business trip, and enjoyed it very much. It's hip, it's stylish, and it was fun to participate in all of that for one night. The hotel is brand new, and there were a few things that didn't look quite finished--we noted a loud rattle in the air conditioning unit, for example. We notified the desk, then walked out for dinner, expecting it would be repaired before we returned--but the repairman was already right outside our door--so there definitely weren't issues with the quality and timeliness of service. The lobby and room were lovely--I really enjoyed the bath products, the "rainforest" shower, and the bed was comfortable. We had a nice view of miscellaneous LA out the window, and were able to watch the sunset from the window seat--all very lovely. Parking was atrociously expensive, but we found a secure lot one block away for half the price. Cocktails in the lobby were also pricey--but we completely expected them to be--that's what comes with hip and trendy. All in all, it seems like a good hotel that's on its way to being great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Expect Noise and Typical Hollywood Scene”
Reviews.Author: greenlakegirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the new W Hotel in Hollywood while visiting my sister in L.A. following a trip I made to the South Pacific. I stayed here being an SPG Gold member so wanted to check out this new hotel. The hotel lobby has a "hip" ambiance - high ceilings, spacious, clean, and trendy decor. If you want to be in the thick of the Hollywood party scene - stay here. If you are actually looking to get some rest or sleep, you may want to look elsewhere to stay.
