I arrived on Sunday evening expecting the scene to be a bit mellow. What was I thinking, right? The place was hopping and looked like a pool party had been going on for hours. It was filled with the young 20 something Hollywood wannabe types. It's definitely a place to see and be seen - nothing more. The check-in process was average. Don't get me wrong, the staff was friendly but the line was filled with drunken fraternity type boys who were cutting in line with the staff completely ignoring their behavior. The rooms were nice (though a bit on the small size) - comfortable beds, nice bathroom, large flat screen TV, and Bliss products in the bathroom. I really had no complaints on the room and amenities. The noise level at the hotel was high at all times. There were parties and drunken people in the hotel hallways at 3 am on a Sunday night. But, I shouldn't be surprised by that - it is Hollywood, isn't it? The hotel also has the latest hot new Hollywood nightclub called Drai's on the rooftop. The thing that I found most funny is the W motto of "Whatever/Whenever". After I checked in I was told this is the W motto for their guests and we should call them for whatever our needs are at anytime. However, when I called them to inquire about getting into Drai's nightclub, I was told that Drai's is a separate entity from the hotel and admission is determined by the bouncers downstairs. So, even if you are a guest of the W Hotel in Hollywood, in true Hollywood style and attitude, getting into the club is ultimately about how you look, who you know, and how you are dressed. In my opinion, that's a little bit deceiving & irritating, especially since they market this nightclub being in their hotel. Again, the hotel itself and rooms and amenities are nice. If you are looking to party and stay up all night, then stay at this hotel. If you want a quieter scene in Hollywood, you may want to stay at the Renaissance Hotel in Hollywood. I would selectively recommend this hotel to others I know based on the ambiance & clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorette Weekend”
Reviews.Author: kdelgado71
Reviews.Content: You must stay here everytime you visit Los Angeles and even if you live in LA, you should put it on your to-do-list. Great hotel, room, staff, restaurant (Delphine), bars, food, wine - I can go on and on. And even though it's in the heart of Hollywood, I didn't feel any pretentiousness from anyone working at the W. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is all about glamour and cool.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFamily60614
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a perfect stepping off point at the intersection of Hollywood and Vine. Right out the doorstep is the Hollywood Walk of Fame, and withing easy walking distance is Grauman's Chinese Theater, the El Capitan Theater, and plenty of views of the Hollywood sign. Even better is staying within the confines of the hotel - every single staff member was courteous, professional and somehow hip. While we somewhat impractically picked this uber hot nightspot for a weekend with children, our daughters loved the environment and were treated with respect - and pampered with welcome gifts upon arrival. From the rooftop pool to the Living Room to the coffee shop to Sweat, the workout space, we took advantage of all the W had to offer and loved every minute of it. Our daughters are 9 and 11 so very much appreciated the fringes of all the beautiful people; this probably isn't a place for very young children.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hip experience”
Reviews.Author: RockvilleTpf
Reviews.Content: I had my reservations about booking a room at the W in Hollywood as I've stayed in other W Hotels and especially in NYC found the rooms extremely small. I was pleasantly surprised when ushered to our room. I loved it as it was sized just right, had plenty of storage space, was well appointed and extremely comfortable complete with a chair and ottoman and king bed, large screen TV, good closet, ample drawer space, and very good lighting. The bathroom was lovely and under the sink there was an open shelf area where toiletries could be stored. The shower was large and as a design feature, the lower portion of the stall wall has open glass that looks into the bedroom. I shared the room with my husband, but don't think I would want to share the room with anyone else for that reason. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful and followed up to be sure any of our requests had been addressed. Even though most of the guests were considerably younger than us, we were not made to feel out of place. Our stay was during an awards weekend for the entertainment industry, so the hotel was completely booked. The service we received did not suffer despite the number of guests and visitors. The public areas were spotless, halls cleaned immediately if food was put outside the door, and our room was perfectly cleaned. The concierge service was great. They were never too busy to spend ample time and they were full of suggestions. When we weren't able to obtain a reservation at a certain restaurant, they kept calling back for us until they secured a reservation and then notified us on our cell phone. We ate at the restaurant each morning for breakfast and the food was fresh and delicious. I have dietary restrictions, and they were extremely flexible and understanding in accommodating my needs. I have nothing negative to say about the hotel and look forward to a return visit. There aren't many hotels that I can honestly make that statement...

Reviews.Title: “High cost and poor facilities outweighs cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: newnhb
Reviews.Content: Is there anything at this hotel that does not cost extra? Virtually nothing is included in your room. This hotel is out to make a quick $ on every customer. $38 a night parking? Are you kidding me? No complementary Wi-FI - Jeez even the Holiday Inn throws wi-fi into the overnight price. How much profit is that making the W? Well it's costs them a lot more in guests feeling peeved. The cost of the minibar will make you think they printed the decimal places wrongly. $15 for some M&M's? - yeah, that seems so cheap.... The pool facilities are laughably poor - read tiny - and there is no space there unless a guest is prepared to buy a cabana $3500 per day. I'm not poor but if it means spending the value of a new car for 2 hours by the pool then forget it. The bed was fashionable. But fashionably uncomfortable and 2 inches off the ground (and non king size). To get into the hotel at night means aggressively pushing through crowds of beautiful people going to Drai (the club) . I go to clubs, and to be honest that's what I was in LA for, but hey W hotel, if your guests are carrying a large suitcase then frankly making guests push past 400 people is not nice. Jeez - W hotel please open another door for guests! Impossible to get a cab because there is no doorman and the so called complementary hotel car runs only when guests are least likely to need it. Oooo, I thought - a free car shuttle into town that saves me a cab fare. Dream on. Read the details and you'll find that this "free car" thing is just a dream. Why? Because the hotel restrict the hours (no doubt because someone was not paying extra $$) to during the day when the least amount of people would need it. The aircon in the room sucked. If indeed it was aircon. It had about as much strength as a fart. The bathroom came with a vast super fashionable "I'm in a rainforest" showerhead that was useless. Why? Because on 3rd floor my room had zero water pressure. The water dribbled out so slowly - it was like being slowly peed upon at a frat party. I would of got a better shower by throwing a bucket of water over myself. By the way, the rooms are so cool that they completely forget to add any storage whatsoever. yes, get ready everyone for leaving all your clothes on the floor. The Lobby is exceptionally cool looking but be prepared to wait while the preening staff chat to each other. Oh lord have mercy if you want the concierge - as a guest you are an annoyance to their fantasy of working in a nightclub.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ilovepeaches
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing hotel. Gorgeous rooms and good service. Perfect for a girls getaway. Fun, party atmosphere. Drai's was fabulous - a bit on the pricey side but you would expect that from LA.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot say enough good things about our experience at this hotel – but here is why the experience was so good.”
Reviews.Author: Shmees
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about our experience at this hotel – but here is why the experience was so good. I am not a VIP/celebrity, so I prepared in advance. I emailed and telephoned the General Manager, his assistant (Sabrinna Newton – who always answered emails right away), the Concierge (specifically I want to mention Adam Schon & Jonathan) and the W Insider (Chris Nelson – extremely nice and very helpful), about twenty times before we arrived, starting months in advance, telling them it was our honeymoon and advising them of everything I hoped for during my stay. And it paid off. I want to specifically thank them for so much… for the champagne (V.C.) and the amazing room upgrade (absolutely huge and stunning… BTW we had booked it on Starwood points) and great help with dinner reservations (e.g. adding someone to a table at BOA with 2 hrs notice on a Saturday night). When I approached the concierge desk just to ask a question, Adam knew who I was and knew my husband’s name etc. And we didn’t even get to thank him for the craziest thing, because we didn’t find out about it until after we left the hotel: Adam had somehow called my assistant back in Montreal, and she gave him my dad’s phone number, and then Adam called my dad to ask how he could make our W Hollywood experience better for us, what special things they could do for us and what we might like. That is crazy, unreal service. There was also the Acura car service but we didn’t get to use it because we didn’t ask early enough and by the time we asked it was all booked – so if you want to use it, ask in advance. I did go to the Bliss Spa, just walked in (without an appointment) and it was very good – better service than at the Bliss Spa @ W Fort Lauderdale. The gym is very nice with cool views from the treadmills. We also spent all of Sunday by the pool on the roof, at Drai’s, which was very fun especially when they started up the pool party. It did get very busy so if you want to be there, get there early and find a table in the shade. We never bothered to go to Drai’s at night but had we wanted to, it was going to be easily arranged… there is a separate line in the lobby that you wait in which is not very long. I feel like I should add some complaints to balance out this review… but I really cannot think of any. We felt like VIPs and we loved every minute of it. It was our second visit to the W Hollywood, and obviously we will only stay there from now on when we go to L.A., but we will follow the same plan: make everyone aware of your presence and your “special requests” before you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood treats you like an "A lister!"...even if your a "Z lister ;-) "”
Reviews.Author: CharlyandAngela
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel using SPG reward points never the less we were given the red carpet treatment. Be warned this property is a little pricey but if you want a weekend to feel and be treated like a rock star, this is the place. The hotel is located within walking distance of Theaters, Pubs and night clubs which makes this property ideally located. The hotel's rooftop pool/club offers an awesome view of Hollywood. The only down side was that we heard people working out above our room since we stayed in the 10th floor. Overall we had an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great suite. Party atmosphere was just...”
Reviews.Author: El_Chiflero
Reviews.Content: Great suite. Party atmosphere was just what i was looking for. Service was impeccable. Better integration with Drai would be my only suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful W Hollywood. .”
Reviews.Author: NapaNose
Reviews.Content: Beware this hotel if you are looking for a quality lodging experience. This is a party pad and not even a good one. Kind of like “Animal House” meets “Girls Gone Wild”. . If W is trying to replicate the scene at Mondrian, and it appears they are, it’s a very sad effort. Mondrian is an upscale, lively scene with beautiful people, great amenities and professional management. W Hollywood is the “bridge and tunnel” version in an otherwise lovely setting. Among the issues during our stay: the “rope” system whereby registered guests must “prove” they are staying in the hotel in order get into the hotel after an evening out – and the attitude of the guardians. . “dude, I’m sooo not interested in what's happening on the roof;” in the lobby bar, they take and hold your driver’s license until you sign/pay your bill!. . After our stay and seeing the clientele, that won’t happen again – we’ll be lucky if our identity hasn’t been sold for a carton of cigarettes; complimentary car service – two reservations an evening and none after 6:00 on Sunday isn’t a complimentary car service; garage fee is $35 per night while our room overlooked a ¼ block parking lot that charges $10; bellmen watch you carry your bags to your room while they wait beside the baggage of young women arriving for the weekend; HVAC system is very noisy and clanks on and off all night. Unfortunately, the startup sounds like someone opening the door to the hotel room; The window that opens is about 8”x14” so you can’t rely on fresh air instead of the air conditioning; Who is using a leaf blower at 2 am?. . The décor of the room is quite nice. . until you get into bed and are confronted with all the cords, connections, outlets, etc., under the desk immediately in front of you. frayed bath towels (didn’t the hotel just open?); We used the little hang-it-on-the-door room service menu the first night we were there and then never had one again. Around midnight and thereafter, the “weekenders” start working the hallways from room to room, slamming doors, partying in the hallways. . making “noises” in the rooms until all hours. At least, the guy in the next room was considerate, taking care of her before himself. . . . If you’re traveling with a guy, make sure you know him well because the hand towel rack in the bathroom is situated directly in front of the sink. . . if he isn’t dressed when using the sink, he’s dragging “it” all over the hand (face) towels. The bar on the roof plays music, LOUD music, until 2:00 am. . I can’t imagine how the people who live in the Hollywood hills haven’t complained. We were only on the 7th floor and it was thump, thump until wee hours; Dinner in the restaurant was quite good and the server was quite efficient, although the room kind of looks like a college cafeteria. . maybe that’s to make the clientele comfortable. Finally dawned on us that the combination of literature books and liquor bottles in the bookcases also fed that comfort. . The wicker chairs in the cafeteria have cushions that immediately try to eject you onto the floor. . very uncomfortable chairs. The staff at breakfast was like watching a movie. People cancelling orders because they didn’t get what they ordered. Checks being re-written because they were wrong, spilled glasses, crashing dishware from the kitchen. Worst part of breakfast?. . Soured napkins. . you know, that awful smell of something that was either left in the laundry basket or the washer too long. . yecch.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not bad”
Reviews.Author: sheridan_10
Reviews.Content: My initial impression of the hotel was it looked amazing, very new and very fancy. The staff at the front desk were very friendly, but after reading the reviews on here, I have just realised I had no idea there was a pool at all. Was given a room right next to an elevator so the noise from people coming in and out and also the elevators going was annoying. After about 30 mins in the room, I asked the front desk if there was any possibility of another room and without any hesitation I was relocated to a better room. The rooms themselves were lovely. very new and very very clean. On the 2nd night however, I managed to get very little sleep due to the loud music coming from either the bar or the club(assuming the bar due to the floor level). This went on until about 2am. Not great. However, when I enquired the next day if this was going to go on for the next few days, I was immediately moved to a higher floor away from the noise. That was excellent service. I didnt even have to ask. Once again, the room was very clean, but check out the appliances as I found a large number missing from the room. I reported them just incase they thought I had taken them and to my surprise, they were instantly replaced. Overall a nice stay with great customer service!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern style, busy nightclub and pool to improve your LA experience”
Reviews.Author: Diogo_Rio_de_Janeiro
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you're looking for nightlife, since it has one of the best nightclubs and lounges in LA. Can be a bit noisy at night, but not to disturbing for night adventurers. Hotel could improve assistance to guests access to the nightclub...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: rscottb
Reviews.Content: W is always a great expereince and the new W Hollywood exceeded our expectations. It's a perfect location for walking to anything in Hollywood and convenient to everything. The gym and pool area were nice and the staff were a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but lots of hidden costs you can avoid”
Reviews.Author: smbbeb
Reviews.Content: Yes - if you have stayed in the W hotels before this is a great one. Beautiful lobby, outer couryard that turns into a bar at night with a huge projection tv screen (they were showing the football game). Everything is very clean and new which is wonderful - esp. in Hollywood where 'good' clean and reasonable hotels are hard to come by - esp. so close to the chinese theatre area if you are looking for the touristy stuff. However, I have to agree with other posters - I wonder if the staff are aspiring models or actors and are just there to make connections? They are certainly not as helpful as other W hotels we have stayed in (or other 4 - 5 star hotels in general). We drove. When we pulled in the valet automatically came and took our car. We said "we're just checking in" and the valet said "that's fine - I'll go park your car". When we asked how much it was they said $38 with in-and-out privileges. We asked if there was self-park and they said no self park in the hotel -but you could self park across the street but there was no in and out. When we asked at check in they said that yes you could park across the street for $10 for the day (from 6 am up until 3 am - although the front desk didn't tell us this - they just said "yes,you can park there" - it was the ppl at the parking lot that gave us the times) and an extra $10 for overnight (if you were going to be there between 3 am and 6 am). Had we not asked the valet would never have told us this - just taken our car - and the lot is LITERALLY across the street. The valet must take the cars there because I don't know where would be closer? We ended up parking there and when we asked at the lot they said that you COULD go in and out. Also, the pool closes at 7:00 as it turns into a bar later in the night. If you have kids or if you just want to swim you can only go until 7 and then they will close everything down and reopen it later. We werent told about this when we checked in. We weren't even told there was a pool or anything about the hotel. It's only when I saw people in the elevator in bathings suits that they told me they are trying to get a quick swim in as the pool would be closing at 7. We ran up just to take a peek at the pool before it closed and figured we would come back later for a drink as we were on our way out. When we came back at around 9:00 and tried to go up for a drink we were told that it was a bar that was not 'associated' with the hotel and the cover is $20 a person to get up (they lock off the elevators so you have to put your key in to get to the rooms and the key doesn't work to get you to the pool after 7 - you have to enter through the bar elavator). The guy at the front that was with the W said "oh yes, we make sure and tell all our guests that there is a cover - even if you are a guest". Well, the woman who checked us in never said anything about it. We weren't going to bother paying $40 just to get upstairs as we weren't going to stay long - we just wanted a quick drink and to see the place as we didn't have time earlier. So know this before you go - we wish we did we would have planned better. Also, in the past the cds that they give out in the room were complimentary. We took ours to listen to in the car as we've enjoyed the music on these. When we checked out (early the next morning - so too early to see the pool again) of course the guy at the front asked "how was your stay" and I said "great, except for not being told about the pool turning into a bar and the cover charge" and he said "oh, sorry about that - she should have said something" and that was it. Then I realized I had the cd in the car so ran it back in and said "I forgot I took this from the room - do you charge for them? Can i just leave it here with you?" and he said "yes, there is a charge, if it's missing from the room you will be billed, would you like to purchase it?" (and it wasn't that great compared to other cd plus by now I just thought "geez - the least you coulda done was offer to let me keep the lousy cd after the whole pool mix-up") so I said "no thanks - if you can just put it back for me". But come on? That's not "4 star" treatment and not treatment I expect from the W which in the past has been so into customer service. So again, be careful if you 'take' the cd by mistake. Also, like with many hotels, the mini fridge items are on sensors, so they will charge you if you move anything (even if you don't consume it and leave it back but take it out) - so make sure and check your bill if you use the minbar to make sure they didn't charge you for more than you took just because you moved stuff. That being said it is a really nice property. You can't beat the "newness" of it. Like I said - there's not much of a selection down there in Hollywood. (we've been a few times on business so stayed in a number of hotels there - including the "haunted" Roosevelt hotel - yuck). This is by far the nicest one in the area - unless you want to go all the way over to Beverly Hills and stay at the Luxe or somewhere like that. But it is a bit of a hike. The metro is connected to the hotel if you aren't driving so it's really convenient - and if you are driving - like I said - just self park - it's really easy. It's a 1 minute drive to the freeway which is also really handy. We took the kids to Universal Studios and it was about a 5 minute drive - but so much handier than the Universal hotels as it's so close to the Walk of Fame and the new city area they recently built. And nicer than any Sheraton or Marriott or other hotels closer to Universal. We've been to Hollywood without kids and yes, the W hotel would be more fun without kids (like, we could actually stay for a longer drink ...) but it's also fine with kids. I didn't feel out of place having my kids there and I saw lots of other kids there. My only other problem is I booked a "fabulous" room and as an SPG member I'm entitled to an upgrade to the next level which would be some sort of suite. Having the kids I really wanted something a bit bigger than just 2 double beds but the girl at the front said "no, sorry, the next level up from what you booked are the suites, and we only have 8 suites in the whole hotel and they are all booked". EIGHT suites in the whole hotel? That didin't sound right. But maybe I'm just projecting because I'm still bitter about the pool ;-) . I thought the 'fabulous' room would have had 2 beds and a couch area to give a bit more space but she said all the rooms are exactly the same (except for having either 2 queens or 1 king) except for the 8 suites. hmmmmm ... seems strange in such a big hotel. Also, all the views from the rooms aren't good. They face the parking lot, or street - no rooms face the hollywood sign or anything which is to be expected as the hotel is right in the town and the rooms aren't high enough to give much of a view. Just a point if a view is really important to you. As another poster said, the rooftop would have nice views ... just not the rooms. I paid $155 so I was really pleased for that rate - but it still doesn't excuse the lack of service. If I paid close to $300 as I know the rates can get that high I would have been really mad. But for one night - close enough to get to the sights, comfy bed, clean and really fun lobby and vibe - totally worth it. Esp. with the cheap parking across the street. If you plan on going for the nighlife be warned about the cover and plan for it - or just plan to stay by the lobby bar - it's nice there too - and was busy. Yes, it can get loud - so be warned and ask for a room away from the bar as it stays open till 3:30 if you don't want the noise. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood - their best yet”
Reviews.Author: calstars
Reviews.Content: Spent a great evening at the nicest W in their portfolio - Hollywood. The service was outstanding as the staff was wildly attentive without being oppressive. The decor is a pleasant change from the normal dark wood and black tinged rooms. It is vibrantly light, with a spectacular chandelier in the common area. A very welcoming scene. Stayed in a corner suite that was worth every penny - huge couch and tv, great views, electric shades to turn an otherwise bright room into a perfect sleeping chamber. The Bliss amenities are great - as always. The metro station at the hotel makes getting downtown for business shockingly easy - no traffic in L.A.! Having visited more 8 or 9 other W's - this one was the best. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes being cool isn't cool enough!”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: The relaxed and informal easy-going attitude of the reception staff has gone a bit further. Firstly, they chat with each other in a loud voice behind the reception curtain and leave guests stranded and eagerly waiting for their conversation to end to get assistance. Then, they show up, preauthorize an extra USD 500 on the credit card without notifying the guest; who given an aggressive answer "every hotel has its own policy" . The over-doing act of having to present a photo ID for every transaction or even when accessing the room is very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical 4 star hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: marspice
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is beautiful. Very crisp, clean, and will impress anyone. The hotel is defiantly not for everyone. We had read the reviews before staying, and someone had written ... if you're over 30 you're not cool enough for this hotel. Well, I totally agree, and I'm 34. Defiantly a hip 20-something crowd. That aside, the rooms were beautiful. Comfy beds, nice TV, IPOD and every other cell phone chargers, well stocked mini-bar, $9 water, window seat, funky decor, spa-brand BLISS Shampoo,Conditioner, Face wash, and shower gel. Paid $161 nt on name-your-own-price on Price Line. Staff were overall very friendly. Free wi-fi in the "Living Room" lounge, beautiful view from the 12th floor rooftop pool, can see the Hollywood sign. Only 12 lounge/sun chairs. Pool converts into Drai's Nightclub Wed-Sun and it is LOUD. Either you won't care about this OR you need to request a "quiet room", request in advance. Front desk does have earplugs available. Walls are very thin no matter what floor you are on, so be warned. Not kid friendly, you would feel really out of place (I know I would never bring my small children there). Across street there is Dhillions Irish Pub which has EXCELLENT large menu, $3 beer, free wi-fi, and is very reasonable. Katsuya is right around the corner, celebrities haunt there nightly and so does the paparazzi. Trader Joe's grocery store is close too. The Metro underground train is right out the front door, can take it right to Universal $1.50. Use the Acura service for free transport to close by attractions... .we took it to Rodeo Dr. Overall, very nice hotel. Not sure if I'd stay there again though ... only based on the huge night-club-party scene.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fresh, really nice!”
Reviews.Author: Natacha_murphy
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed at the W Hollywood for 5 nights. It was so nice, really modern but luxurious. We stayed in a Spectacular room, which was a free upgrade as part of the deal we got. The price of the hotel is up there, but not crazy and you definitely get what you pay for. All the staff were super nice, everything was well presented, and the toiletries in the bathroom were made by the spa that is in the hotel. The spa was also great. Again, modern and fresh. The gym was great, with views, and the pool was amazing. I will go back to this hotel when I go back to LA without a doubt! All the celebrities come to the hotel too, they had an after party for a film launch one night, and they have filmed TV shows at the pool! The hotel is about 10 blocks from the Chinese Theatre on Hollywood Blvd, so about a 15 minute walk. Hollywood boulevard is not as glamourous as Beverly Hills, but safe and interesting to walk along.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel in a great location with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: junior97
Reviews.Content: Hotel was new, trendy and Tess at the front desk was incredibly helpful. Spent time at the pool for a drink and downstairs at the Station and both were very chill but fun for a Wednesday night. It's right near some great restaurants which was a plus since they were within walking distance! At night, Chris Nelson took care of us when my girl and I wanted to go to Drai's. For someone that loves the NYC nightlife and has heard the horror stories of the LA scene, Chris treated us like superstars and made the experience worth repeating! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone in the neighborhood and for anyone that wants to hit up Drai's, get in touch with Chris!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel-Almost Too Trendy”
Reviews.Author: JTF_1977
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. Room type was not exactly what was promised. Type of room selected was to be view of either the Hollywood Sign or Hollywood Station (which is the Hollywood Blvd entrance to the hotel). Our view was of a parking lot. Not so amazing. However, the hotel, lobby, and room was very clean, neat, and stylish. THe location was also very central to the areas in LA we traveled too. Also, everyone we dealt with was very accommodating and friendly, and we were provided with the type of service we look forward to when staying at Starwood Hotels. Other then the view issue described above, I have no major complaints about this hotel (other than the outrageous parking fees and paying for high speed internet which is with just about every Starwood Hotel). I would think since we only stay at Starwood Hotels and I am an SPG member, parking/internet would be comped or something. Even Holiday Inn offers free WIFI. Drais night club (in W Hotel) is a big Hollywood Hot Spot with a long line forming every night. During this time it would be hard to get in the hotel because of the amount of people/cars. If I was a night club type of person, this would have been a great place to stay and I could have just stumbled back to my room at the end of the night. I would recommend this hotel mostly for younger hipper people who are looking for a good nightlife scene. I am 32 and from the midwest, and felt a bit old and out of place at this hotel. If I return and stay in the same area, I think I will pick a different hotel just for that reason (and that reason alone).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a clubby vibe.”
Reviews.Author: jfoxy82207
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hollywood with my younger sister for 3 nights at the beginning of August. We got a great deal on Priceline (about 120$ a night). I had contacted the hotel manager beforehand to ask for a quiet room. I mentioned my email again upon checkin and we were given a room on the 7th floor facing the side street. We never heard any of the loud music that other people have mentioned. The pool is indeed only open to hotel guests during certain hours of the day. I loved the pool. There was only one bathrobe in the room when we checked in even though the room had two queen sized beds. I had to call the Whenever serive 3 times until the 2nd robe was finally delivered. This was a bit annoying as it was 6:30pm and we wanted to use the pool before it closed at 7pm. The gym was also great. Definitely talk to the concierge if you want to go to the nightclub. He was able to get us right ahead of the line. I loved the nightclub. The drinks were very strong and therefore good value for money. The free WiFi in the Living Room was very convenient. We order room service once late at night. Nothing special though. The fries arrived cold and we complained when we checked out. The charge for thr fries was taken off our bill. The room cleaning service could be improved. The maid forgot to replace our wine glasses, provide us with new ice bags etcs. I loved the interior of the room. I now want to buy one these bars that they have in every room. We parked the car for 16$ a day in the Trader's Joe parking lot right around on the corner on the same block. I can't wait to come back with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W! - Pretentious, a bit, but worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: OzTink
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 day stay at the W Hollywood with my SIL. We finished off a 2 night stay at the W after spending a week in Vegas. I really enjoyed this hotel and it has been my favourite over the last six 4+* US hotels I've stayed in. Yes it is a little pretentious with all the ropes and bouncers but it is in Hollywood. I loved the design of the hotel and the rooms are beautifully furnished. However I wasn't fond of the glass window dividing the shower and beds and thought this was a bit much for a shared queen room. Check in was great - loved the girl at the desk. She was very warm and friendly and thankfully gave us an early check in at 11:30. I had booked through Hotwire after working out it would be the W and there was no problems with upgrading us to a double queen room. I thought this may have been a problem as when I tried to book through their direct website it stated that a double queen room was not available for the dates specified! So it was a big bonus! We hadn't decided if we were going to use their valet parking (a bit pricey at $35 a day when there is a car park across the street) but upon check in and entering our room, the concierge rang to inform us that they had removed our bags from the car and were bringing them straight up. We hadn't even asked for this so it was very nice to not have to worry about it. They then did valet our car and the service for this was wonderful. There were also a few times when we arrived back from some shopping and parked out the front with a line of people waiting for entry and we wouldn't even be required to show our instant access passes, and would just receive a welcome back! with an immediate opening of the ropes. We used whatever/whenever a few times and they were super helpful and we also had an experience of the LA nightlife downstairs on a Friday night. It wasn't really our style but it was nice to try it out. On checkout the same lovely girl remembered my (long) name. I would definitely return to the W Hollywood and now am finding it hard to look past other W hotels.

Reviews.Title: “phenomenal property with top service”
Reviews.Author: dk14
Reviews.Content: have stayed at many Ws around the world and this ranks near the top (HK is a step up). rooms are beautifully designed and of great quality. service is terrific with personal outreach to guests to arrange whatever is needed. had a great time at the sunday pool party thanks to the staff taking care of us.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but not on par with other Ws”
Reviews.Author: latertaters
Reviews.Content: I need to preface this review by saying I am comparing this hotel to my experiences at W hotels in other major cities (San Francisco, New York, Seattle) where the W is my preferred place to stay - and comparing this hotel to other high end, trendy hotels I have stayed at. If this was a general review for style, location, amenities compared to say the Holiday Inns of this world, I would give it a higher rating. Upon hours of travel I arrived and went up to my room (no one even offered to help with my bags once they got them to the lobby, which was odd, but I could handle it). The room itself is similar in design to other Ws, so was nice, but the view was of an ugly parking lot. The lighting is mood lighting meaning even with every light on, you can't really see, which for a business traveler is not ideal, though typical of these trendy-style hotels. The main place the lighting bothered me was in the bathroom. I think that room should at least be bright enough to put in my contacts without struggling, but the mood lighting extended to the bathroom. A few minutes after I arrived a man came in to check on restocking the room and fridge; I thought this should have been handled prior to my check-in. He came back 10 minutes later, forgetting he had already done my room. The internet connection didn't work at first even though it charged me so I had to go down and talk to the front desk who refunded my money and I reconnected. So my first half an hour set the tone. After that it was just minor service things. My floor towel was never replaced in the 4 days I was there and had a big black shoe print, obviously from the housekeeper, on it all 4 days (in general, the cleaning job was sub-par). I never got new moisturizer despite using it up (though they did replace shampoo etc. which I didn't need). Room service didn't bring milk for my tea; upon calling to have them remove my tray one night they never came. My colleague had a broken toilet upon check-in; her in-room checkout was broken (she was only there 1 night and only in the room to sleep so these were annoyances in a brief stay). These are little things but are a-typical of what service level I have been treated to at other Ws or the other similar class hotels. I had good experiences at Delfine - nice servers and when one made 2 minor mistakes he treated us to 2 free desserts to make up, which was nice. The food/wine was pretty good and outside was nice though the inside atmosphere is a bit dull. The hotel concierges were friendly though I didn't rely on them for much. I agree with other reviewers re: Drai's. You should think of this as Drai's nightclub with an associated hotel and not the W hotel with Drai's nightclub. I find it rude and annoying that getting back into my hotel at night the bouncers (even on the parking side of the hotel) treated hotel guests a bit rudely and I had to queue up (!) and show my room key at multiple ropes inside & out just to get through to my room. Also, as there were private events daily while I was there, this closes off one of the hotel entrances I would have used out onto Hollywood Blvd. Hotel guests have to exit via "the back door" into parking lot like 2nd class citizens. They seem to be running a successful club, but I think the effort put into the hotel service (in relation to other Ws) is dubious. This hotel would have been nice if I was there for a clubbing weekend but if you are not going to have a fun weekend partying at Drai's, there are much better hotels in the same class and price range.

Reviews.Title: “Decadently decorated, top shelf service and hospitality, the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ked44
Reviews.Content: The whole package! This hotel is second to none! It was tastefully decorated like a boutique hotel with all of the comforts you expect of a five star hotel. The service and hospitality were exceptional and our every wish was granted. We enjoyed the pampering at the spa, as well as the beautiful bar area and pool. I highly recommend the "W" to those of you the expect the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel unless you expect to actually sleep”
Reviews.Author: Avondaletraveler
Reviews.Content: First- the positives. It's beautiful, and the location is amazing, and contrary to what I've read, I received great service from everyone from the front desk to the concierge (who we utilized several times) to the bellman. We were able to get into Drai's after a bit of a wait on Thursday, we found it nice enough but not someplace we HAD to return to. When I requested a song of the DJ I was very rudly shot down. As I work as a DJ myself I never would have said what he said to a patron. The songs I requested were right in line with what he was actually playing, so Drai's did not really impress us. We actually turned down an invitation to return on Fri evening. The room was very nice and ultra modern although I kept banging my right shin on the edge of the platform bed, I still have the bruises. But the reason why I don't see myself returning was the noise at night. You hear EVERYTHING from doors closing to regular conversations from all directions. After a rather sleepless Thursday I asked the front desk for earplugs which I was shocked to see she had right onhand, prepackaged and ready to go! However Sat night the earplugs did nothing to mask the people who decied that the hallway outside our room was the place to party at 3am. At first I politely poked my head outside to the couple who sat on the floor in bathrobes with food and drinks laid out picnic style in front of them and asked if they would mind taking it inside as we were trying to sleep. They apoligized, then moved maybe 5 feet away and keep on their conversation. After that I called the front desk and explained the situation. Their reply was not an apology but to ask if I had earplugs. After I explained they weren't making a dent they sent up security. I was prepared for a party hotel, as I've stayed in several other W's including Mahatten but nothing prepared me for the noice level at night. We were on the 10th floor and could hear the nighclub two floors up quite well. Of the 3 nights I was there, I didn't sleep for two of them. At checkout when they asked how my stay was I relayed the above. They took my info and promised a manager would be in touch right away but so far I have not heard anything. I'm in the industry and know what is normal and what is not. Unless you are in a drunken stupor, I can't see how anyone gets a decent night's rest at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the young and beautiful--seriously”
Reviews.Author: Oldink
Reviews.Content: Are you older than thirty? If younger than thirty are you not trendy, hip, hot, beautiful, buff? Find another hotel. Los Angeles has great hotels in Beverly Hills, Pasadena and even downtown. But my evaluation isn't based on my being old and everyone else in the place being right at fifty years younger. I made a mistake in choosing the place, my fault. Even the homeless people who hang out in front on Hollywood Boulevard were younger. My gripe has to do with service, my wanting to read in my (expensive) room. Read. In a chair. Under a light. A reading light. Which did not exist in the lamp above the chair. I'd rate what was there at 40 to 60 watts. So I called down to the desk. They pride themselves on something they call "Whatever, Whenever" and answer the phones that way. So having heard, "Whatever, Whenever, Mr......" I told them that the lamp had a dim bulb, too low in wattage. "What?" Said Mr. Whatever Whenever. "Yes, watt" I said. " "What?" he said. It went on that way for a while. "The wattage is too dim for reading, I said. "What?" He didn't get my drift. A young fella, used to reading online I guess and because I knew that I was the oldest person in the hotel or outside the hotel for that matter, I explained it to him Slowly. "Light. Dim. Lamp. Read. Book. Chair." "Oh," he said. He finally understood and said that he would call engineering. And a few minutes later he called back. I won't do the caps thing here; it's rude. But he said that they didn't have any brighter bulbs and he wasn't talking about himself. No brighter light bulbs in the hotel. Ah. the hotel (expensive) had no light bulbs for reading. So they don't really mean, "Whatever. Whenever." Unless you fall into a certain demographic and that would be young hotties and buffies (?) who want to hang at Drai, the pool on the roof. Los Angeles has some great hotels. This isn't one of them. And I'm sorry. I know that the Hollywood Betterment-Improvement-Disinfectant Association is really trying, but W (expensive) ain't in a great neighborhood and "whatever, whenever" can't do anything about that even if you're young and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay at this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: LuvNY75
Reviews.Content: First of all, I can't blame the staff for our horrendous experience. They were all very attentive and courteous. The room was lovely and clean except for the extremely filthy air filter which we asked to have changed and never was. What I would like to blame is the overall policy of the hotel in regards to Drai's. My 24 year old daughter wanted to go to the Drai's pool party with her friend. After waiting in the "special" hotel line for 45 minutes and seeing that people were getting in ahead of her she finally asked why and was told she wasn't "HOT" enough. At that point I asked at the desk if there at least was another pool that we could all go to and relax after this experience and they said there was not. Now regardless of whether or not Drai's is their own special entity they are still connected with the hotel and guests should be treating accordingly . I certainly don't feel I should pay to stay at a high end hotel and have my daughter insulted in this manner. In addition, this is California, and people expect use of a pool. If the pool is not for use at a particular time they should al least have another pool for clients to use with a shuttle service. In the past, we usually stay at the W in Westwood whenever we visit my daughter. As you can well imagine this experience has made my husband and I extremely angry and we do not intend on staying at another W again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be in the middle of everything (not always a good thing)”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: Right on the end of booming Hollywood Blvd -- tons of tourists and scenesters and well desirables. I stayed here for a company conference and usually stay at the W Westwood and this confirms why I prefer Westwood: traffic, noise, scenesters to the Club & Rooftop pool. Just too much and too loud, even in rooms... if that's your thing, you will be in heaven. But I prefer to be able to sleep without crowd noise from the street as well as be able to park without having to wait and prove that I am a hotel guest. Rooms are smaller than Westwood though well designed and chic. Love the multi-outlet plugs on the desk. If you know what you are getting into -- being in the middle of the scene, you will be in Heaven but not for everyone

Reviews.Title: “It's okay but at $400+ per they should not treat their bar regulars better than hotel guests.”
Reviews.Author: jrh301
Reviews.Content: For $400+ per night I want a shower that gets me wet and doesnt just look like it should, which is a metaphor for this hotel. Overall, I was not impressed compared to W in many other locations or even select Westins. Nice location at Holly and Vine, all the tools to be great but rather aloof, posey and they make you present your room card 200 times a day. Add this to the impersonal feel of the hotel and the fact that they make you walk around large roped off areas that they feel their hotel guests are not quite worthy of and this isnt my thing. In essence I was alone and just wanted a drink after a long flight and still in my business suit, so I walked to their bar called Drais or the like. I was told that I need to stand behind this roped off area and wait to get into their bar while I stood watching people who didnt pay to stay at the hotel, just walk off the street given priority access while they made me pay my respects. I must admit, this irked me big time but it didnt last more than a couple of minutes before I just walked across the street to another bar on Hollywood, cancelled the next night at this hotel and gave them my wallets middle finger. For $400 per night you can do better in LA. And with staff that do not seem to enjoy making a guest feel unwelcome or unfit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--But Annoying at Times”
Reviews.Author: MBM33
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the W Hollywood are nice and what you would expect from the W brand (although this W is in my opinion a bit "overdone"). But, for the price, I would skip it next time I'm in L.A. At night, I found the hotel staff to be more focused on managing the crowd trying to get in to the hotel than its own guests. It annoyed me after a long day of traveling or sight seeing to have to elbow through a crowd to get to the front of a roped off area and show a card to be able to get into a hotel I paid good money to stay in. (How about a separate entrance?). A nice touch was the young man with the clipboard looking us up and down (granted we were dressed very casually for a concert at the Hollywood Bowl) and saying "Can I help you?" with a tone indicating that we were obviously not going to be let in. Also lacking was attention to small details. For instance, we were at one point informed that the Acura car service would take us up to 5 miles from the hotel--only to be informed after making plans to use it that it could only take us 2 miles during certain times of the day--we needed to go 2.3 miles but the 2 mile rule was apparently set in stone. Also, we requested a high room to avoid traffic noise. We avoided the traffic noise on the 11th floor, but we could hear the bass from the nightclub for hours that night--it would have been nice if the person who noted our request had informed us that we might be better off on a lower floor. (We were moved quickly with no problem, but it could have been avoided). Also--note that this hotel attracts the kind of people who will be screaming up and down the halls at 4 in the morning. Room service was good (late night and breakfast). Our air conditioner would not work the first day, but it was fixed promptly and a request for additional toiletries was fulfilled quickly. Overall, service for the most part was acceptable, but the overall experience was not nice enough in my opinion to outweigh the annoyance factor created by the nightclub/lobby scene. If you like for your hotel to be a sanctuary for rest after travel, I would not recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Velvet Rope Must Go!”
Reviews.Author: GoneTrippn
Reviews.Content: What would be a good option if you have reason to be in Hollywood, is somewhat soured by their weird, obnoxious velvet rope convention. At most fine hotels the doorman welcomes you with a smile, yet when you enter the W you submit yourself to their judgment. (on the list? do you belong?) If security is an issue, why not place someone at the elevator? They were clearly encouraging non-hotel guests to mingle in their bars. At other times it was empty. But the ropers were ever present. When we had friends meet us for a drink at the hotel, they had trouble getting in. We were paying guests, they were our guests, what’s the deal? No, I’m not old and hopelessly out of touch (well, not terribly old, I did live through NYC club life in the 1990s and velvet ropes were a cliché even then.) If it’s supposed to make the guests feel important, then they are appealing to a very insecure crowd that likes that sort of thing. I’d stay elsewhere. The rooms were quite fun, though.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lismell
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here while in LA early July. We got a good deal on hotwire. The room was very nice. Its minimalistic and we like that style. The bed was very, very comfy. But our sleep was interrupted by slamming of doors but it wasnt too bad. Its was only one night I think. The staff were all very polite and welcoming, but having to get past several people to get in at night time does seem a bit strange and pretentious :) The parking was quite expensive, but I guess thats how it is in LA. The valet service was very fast so that was good. We paid for internet one day but the connection was super, super slow so it hardly worked at all. We mentioned this at check out and we didnt have to pay for the charge. The rooftop pool looked great as well. But we weren't able to use it because all the loungers and sofas were booked when we got there. The view and food was very nice. Breakfast at Delphine's was also very good! I would recommend this hotel if you want a nice hotel and feel the LA vibe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: fsufan
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here in April as we were attending a wedding in LA. The bride to be recommended this hotel and was able to get a "wedding rate" for us. The rooms are very modern and minimalistic. Not really my style, but it was nice. We had a room on a low floor and did not hear any music or noise at all on our stay. Since we had a low rate, we had no view - no big deal. There was no bathtub - only a shower (fiance likes to take baths). My only real complaint about our room is that we came back one day at about 4:30 and the room was still not clean. We needed to get ready for the wedding and I was hoping that the room would have been cleaned already. We did eat at Drai's one night for dinner (we are not club people, so went early for dinner). The view is FANTASTIC! Everyone should at least check out the view. We did see Ryan O'Neal eating dinner there as well that night. We rented a car, but the bride-to-be did recommend this hotel since there is a Metro stop right by it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelThat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Hollywood for several nights for Business in April, 2010. I had some hesitation booking, after reading some of the reviews about the rude staff etc... However, after spending several nights, I couldn't disagree more with the bad reviews. Upon check in, I was greeted by a friendly host at the front desk. While I wasn't offered an upgrade for my Gold Starwood status, I was placed in a good sized room with a driveway view. I was a little disappointed by the view, but very impressed by the room. Everything was fresh, new, clean, and very chic. The bathroom was clean, well apportioned. The big screen TV and charger with adaptors was a nice touch. The room was very quiet and I slept well on a so-so comfortable bed. The gym was large, with all of equipment that you need for a workout. There was a large stretch room with amazing views of the city and Hollywood Hills. The lobby of the hotel, and adjacent lounge area was spectacular. I enjoyed drinks several evenings on the outdoor bar/lounge area with out door fire pits and comfortable lounge furniture. The bar tenders were friendly and the drinks were decent, with prices that I'd expect at this type of venue. I was a little disappointed that one evening when I tried to get up to the upstairs lounge/bar, I was told that I wasn't on the list. Apparently the hotel throws some private parties, which means you have to be VIP (which I'm not) to get in. On my check out, I was greeted by a manager who promptly assigned a desk attendant to handle my check out. The valet parking was expensive, but I was able to self park in the lot directly across the street for $20/night, with in/out privileges. I'm not afraid to write a critical review, but I can honestly say that my stay at the W Hollywood was a pleasure. As long as you don't expect to roll in and be treated like a star (when you're not), then you'll be fine. I was treated professionally, and thought the accommodations were excellent. Pros: Clean New Fresh Exciting Chic Friendly Staff Very cool ambiance Cons Expensive parking Some areas are for VIP only

Reviews.Title: “More Like a Bridge & Tunnel Club Than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TylerBT
Reviews.Content: I actually thought the room was pretty nice and comfortable, but the service is just god awful. The biggest selling point of the place -- the rooftop pool -- closes down at 6:00 p.m. for use by Drai's dinner service. Also, on weekends the pool is completely mobbed by what i would have assumed to be a Jersey Shore crowd if I wasn't in LA and the pounding 90's trance techno music. Seriously there is no area reserved for hotel guests. Other negatives: had to call at 5 pm to have room made up despite being out all day; rude bouncers at every turn; loud at all times; exterior looks like a Hampton Inn. To sum up: if you don't want a party hotel, don't go; if you do, go to the Roosevelt it is much better.

Reviews.Title: “awesome room, poor service and sleeping quality”
Reviews.Author: evz32
Reviews.Content: when we arrived we wanted to park in the valet parking. First they forgot to give us the valet ticket for our car. There was no service to get your luggage inside offered. When we got in, carrying all our luggage, they told us our room was not ready yet and we had to wait for over an hour. No service was offered like a drink or so. We walked for one hour in the neigbourhood and after that we wanted to get back in the hotel. But the security man at the door would not let us get in because we didnt have our room keys yet.... So we had to walk another half block to the other entrance. Again we had to wait almost 30 minutes for the check in desk until we got our room keys, then we asked for our luggage that had been placed in the luggage room. They said they forgot to label our luggage and didn't knew what luggage was ours, so we had to get in the luggage room ourselves to search for our bags and then take it to our rooms ourselves! Incredible bad service for a 4* hotel! When we arrived at our room we were pleasantly surprised, very nice large room with very trendy furniture and decoration. We found it a bit odd that you had to pay extra for everything in the room, up to 9$ for a bottle of water. That night there were 2 parties in the hotel, one on the roof near the pool, and another one in the lounge, just beneath our window. It went on until 4 am with very loud music, and because of that very bad sleep. The following day we made a trip to warner bros (very nice) and when we came back, the elevator didn't respond to our room keys. When another friendly guest helped us to get to our floor, we noticed that our room keys were totally not working anymore. So again back to reception and got new keys. Fortunately second night less noise! When we checked out we discussed all of our problems, and we got the costs for the valet parking creditted. Yesterday we arrived home after our trip and saw that the hotel did charge our CC. Concluding: when you want to go to a trendy hotel with a lot of parties and less sleep, and you have lots of money, go to the W. When you want a comfortable night of sleep in a good 4* hotel, think twice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: jasperblueeyes
Reviews.Content: Promised great things from this hotel, the theme is whatever/whenever and even if your prepared to pay for it, its not available. If you want to live/eat/sleep in a nightclub this is the place for you, however the quality and sophistication is severely lacking. The rooms are clean and minimal, I stayed in a "wonderful' room and there was very little wonderful about it. If your stay is all about night life and you're prepared t pay substantially extra, over the room price for it , as opposed to a comfortable hotel this is the place for you. I wont stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood W provides exceptional service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: dofranco
Reviews.Content: I'm writing regarding my recent stay that at the W Hollywood during the July 4th weekend. During this stay I was extremely impressed with the high quality of service provided by W Hollywood personnel -- from the service staff to the guest staff, everyone was friendly, accommodating, and helpful . I would particularly like to recognize Chris Nelson, whom acted as a liason between my guests and the club Drai's. This was a special weekend as it was my fiance, Tira, and my anniversary, as well as our best friend's birthday. Without having made arrangements ahead of time, it didn't look like we would be able to gain admittance into the very popular Drai's. However, once Chris learned of the situation and its importance, he assured me that he would be able to make it happen -- and he did. With minimal effort, we were escorted right up to the club, seated at a great table, and all our needs accommodated -- all the guests (especially Tira) had an fantastic time. It is clear that that W Hollywood sets the highest standards for its services and staff; and I greatly appreciate the efforts of Chris and the rest of the staff. I have stayed in many of the Starwood properties but find your hotel to be exceptional and will be sure to recommend the W Hollywood to my friends, family, and colleagues. Thank you again, I look forward to staying with you again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadiangirl13
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the W and had a great experience! We had been watching and reading the reviews for this hotel daily before our trip and to be honest was anticipating the stay to be not so pleasant....... Well I can honestly say that the negative reviews are way off base. We checked in on Friday of the July 4 long weekend and was in our hotel room within minutes after a long day at Universal Studios. The rooms are impecably clean, and have yummy spa products and a huge rain shower head...my boyfriend literally showered 3 times in one day!!! It was like a mini spa. The bed was heaven after exploring LA during the days and the maids did an awesome job tidying our rooms and providing fresh towels and linens and of course refilling the spa products! There is anything you could want in the room from Figi water to grey goose vodka even with a martini shaker and of course lots of yummy treats! Our room was on the third floor facing the Living Room Lounge and was a bit loud into the night...but I called "Whatever/Whenever" for ear plugs and shortly fell asleep. The other nights we didn't seem to notice...but perhaps may have been due to the fatigue or wine consumption... Overall every inch of the hotel is spotless and stunning to look at. All of the staff were very friendly to us and didn't feel it was an act. The valet was easy, we never had to wait for our car (but usually called ahead from the room). The much anticipated line to pass to enter the hotel from Hollywood Blvd was not an issue....ever. We were greated pleasantly and almost escorted to the door. We also had no problem getting past the line to go to Drai's as there is a seperate line inside the hotel for guests. When asked who to talk to for access into the club a staff member directed us to Chris Nelson...who actually existed and was right on his word to get into the club! Also there is a seperate elevator to Drai's and the pool during the day for non hotel guests. The pool scene was pretty chill...not a big pool but the fun of it is that its on the roof!! There is a pool party during the day on Sundays that we weren't interested in going to, but I had asked the doorman if we had to pay or wait in the line and he pleasantly replied "No mam! Just put your suit on and go have some fun!". This hotel stands out for service in the details....there is a car service that will take you anywhere in the LA vicinity and we really enjoyed that service for a ride to Madeo. We were considering on not keeping our reservation for dinner as did not want to taxi or drive there, but after being offered a complimentary ride how could you turn that down!!! We didn't eat in any of the restaurants but did order room service for dessert and of course it was delicious. There is complimentary coffee in the lobby in the mornings which was very nice. We also used the gym and had great workouts!! Lots of equipment and top of the line cardio machines with personal TV's and plenty of water to hydrate. Overall this hotel far exceeded our expectations in every way! I don't know how anyone could not enjoy this hotel! Seems like the kinks have been addressed!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Patrick613
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The W Hollywood for a week on vacation. I had booked this trip months in advance and was following the reviews on this site quite regularly. After visiting this property, I can tell you that all the negative reviews are off...way off! Upon our arrival, we were greeted by friendly driveway staff who directed us into the absolutely incredible lobby. We were check-in by Theresa who informed us that we had been upgraded! We made our way up to our floor, past the diamond-studded peep-hole into our home for the next week. Although some of the surrounding area (Hollywood Blvd.) could use a bit of sprucing up, the hotel was definately a gem. We would often walk to Hollywood & Highland (about 15 mins) for shops restaurants and attractions such as Kodak Theare, Chinese Theatre and El Capitan. This hotel is absolutely the place to see and be seen and I truly believe Drai's and W have had a big meeting because entering the hotel was never an issue (contrary to past reviews). Speaking of which, Drai's is an amazing club (we saw Paris Hilton there) and the pool is a popular spot even during the day. It is true that the chairs are limited, but we were told we could lie on our towels on the deck of a unoccupied cabana until chairs were available. The staff in the Living Room (bar in the loby) was extremely friendly and we ended up having a drink there almost every night. I also recommend trying their chocolate fondue as it is delicious. I should also mention that for the people who want to use internet to check e-mails etc. and don't want to pay the daily charge, can use the free wi-fi in the Living Room. Delphine (the in-house restaurant) is well decorated and although we only had a small bite there, was very good. The hotel also had infused water or coffee (depending on the time) available in the lobby which was very appreciated! As far as notable staff, Chris (W Insider) is definately someone you should contact if you are looking to plan an unforgettable night in the city. He was well informed about shows and events going on around town and was a lot of help for getting information about Drai's. Once we met him, he always recognized us and always said hi (props and hugs) to us whenever he saw us around the hotel. The concierge desk was also very helpful and was able to get us recommendations for restaurants and directions for places we were visiting. Adam was the concierge we delt with the most and he was very helpful. Finally, although I do not know her name, the lady in Style (housekeeping) made our room feel like home. Everyday we would come back to find our shopping bags organized and our toileteries perfectly arranged and placed on a fresh towel. I know these ladies often don't get the credit they deserve for their hard work, but it was very much appreciated. It was an overall great experience and I wish I could go back! ps: we were on the 8th floor and although we could here Drai's music in the distance, it was never enough to keep us awake!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Glitzy Hotel...but, beware of the bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: Okay, I get it...It's 2010, modern, minimalist sexy chic is what the W Hotel is all about but please, need we carry this trend into the bathroom? There's no question, this hotel is gorgeous, from the lobby to the elevator to the ultra luxurious corridors. The room was fantastic, everything about the place screams "Sexy Hollywood"...my only issue is with the shower, because let's face it, we aren't all here to perform. Some of us are just on holiday with friends and do not see it necessary to have to shower in plain view of others. Yes, this is what each and every room at the W offers you. A glass shower that offers a floor to ceiling window view right out into the bedroom area. Sure, the glass is 'frosted' from about your knees to your chest but let's just say it's not frosted ENOUGH! And even if you aren't in the bathroom to use the shower, whatever it is you are doing in there, whether you're on the toilet, brushing your teeth, changing clothes, you won't be doing any of this in privacy (unless you are staying alone) because if no one is in the shower, we get a clear view of whatever is going on there. If this doesn't bother you than you're all set. Our solution was to tape Madame Tussauds brochures all over the bathroom window. Didn't expect to have to add tape and miscelaneous brochures to my shopping list, but hey, over all, it turned out to be a minor inconvenience. This is my only complaint. Aside from the window in the bathroom, everything at the W is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel exceeded my expectations in every way”
Reviews.Author: TXGNLA
Reviews.Content: A recent booking at the W Hotel for a business meeting was a complete success. My colleagues guests had nothing but praise for the W's wait staff, accommodations, meeting facilities and the overall quality of the hotel, food, etc. We will definetely book again at the W-Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Matt435
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the W Hollywood - just as great as the first. Was there for the weekend and true to form, the part was going strong. Come for the fun on the weekend (especially the rooftop pool party) but hang around for a couple of weekdays when the pace slows down a little and you'll have more time to take in the fantastic rooftop views and hike the adjacent hollywood hills. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Sexy W Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: sallybls
Reviews.Content: Next time you're in LA you have to check out the sexy new W Hollywood! The beautiful new hotel had every ammenity - pool, spa, restaurant, bars, and the service and staff was on point- making our stay Wonderful! The fresh new hotel had lovely rooms that were quite spacious and very clean! The friendly staff made our stay enjoyable from the moment we pulled up to the valet to the moment we checked out- and their whatever/whenever service motto was exactly that- they sent a staff member to the drug store for us to pick up some shoe insoles!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling/snobby service, fantastic rooms. Avoid.”
Reviews.Author: foiegras99
Reviews.Content: As a regular W customer with SPG status, I often stay in W hotels. I was working in LA, so we booked a group of 4 of us (3 of us SPG gold card holders) into the W Hotel Hollywood. W is considered an aspirational brand, and most W hotels are fun, funky and supposed to be trendy. This hotel seemed to have its very own ego. Walking past the disinterested doorman (roped off, presumably to "keep the riff-raff out"?), upon entry they require guests to deposit $500 on a credit card (yes, $500!) even if your room & tax are pre-paid. Now one of our party didn't have $500 left on his card, and had arrived a day earlier while we made our way to LA. The hotel staff were quite happy to send him back out into the street without negotiation (even though his room had been pre-paid!). Thankfully (though after a lot of persuasion to largely deaf ears) we were able to use one of our own cards over the phone to place the deposit. Why they couldn't have just taken a smaller deposit of $150 or held his passport until we arrived, I do not know. Perhaps they were expecting him to steal the TV? This made us look bad as the colleague in question was working for us, and was technically under our hospitality. Not a nice experience after a 10 hour long haul flight. A day later the rest of the party arrived and checked in. Well, we tried. Despite having high status with SPG and it being nearly 4pm, our rooms were not ready. We were offered a room DOWNGRADE (note that normally you are offered an upgrade) if we needed to check into our rooms, which we did. We took the room downgrade as we were working at night at a concert. I would have expected to have some kind of credit applied to my room ($20 or so or a free drink? Would have made me feel a lot happier about the experience). At the outside bar we ordered snacks from a waitress that can only be described as indifferent and obnoxious, firing verbal abuse at our party when we were annoyed at slow service. Once the bill arrived, we discovered why - service is added to all bills. Normally in the USA service in restaurants and bars is impeccable, because the staff have to work for it. Not here - they get it added anyway, so there is no need to go the extra mile as they do in the rest of LA. My experience of the W hotel Hollywood has tarnished the whole W brand for me. Thankfully I understand SPG hotels are owned by different companies - important as I would not want to give any more of my money to this particular organisation. I have stayed in W Hotels cities all over the USA and never had a problem. I should point out at this point that the rooms in the West Hollywood W are extremely nice. Comfortable beds etc. It is the staff that let the hotel down (and the whole W brand nationally as a result), with their snobby attitude towards guests. Totally unnecessary, and to think we PAID to stay there. Surely you pay to be treated with respect in a hotel, and equally guests should respect the staff? It is even an effort to get in and out of the hotel, with guests treated as rather incidental to the whole "party scene" of the property. There is more. My friend ordered room service and received completely the wrong order, and I was charged 3 times for internet access despite being there for under 24 hours. Thankfully after having to ask twice, this was removed, as was the room service charge. Will the management contact me to resolve this? I seriously doubt it. It takes something for me to take the time and effort to complain, but I shall be on the phone to SPG to let them know of my experience. The sad thing is that this hotel will always be successful anyway, due to it being a W in Hollywood, so the company likely has absolutely no interest in whether customers are happy or not.

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood isn't really an hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Ruimmgoncalo
Reviews.Content: ...It's more likely a club / pool party site! I've stayed in this hotel for two nights, and i've had a mixed experience. Location is great, as the quality of the rooms and most of the personal. But one thing made me regret the choice: the location of the hotel plus the fact of being in LA makes this hotel a well known club, that makes your life hard if your just trying to relax. Worst of all: the pool closes for pool parties, for people outside the hotel, and the restaurant in the building, they say, has no affiliation with W Hollywood. In fact, they should just say they have no pool at all... So... if your willing to feel the buzz of the city, you should consider the place. But if your just trying to visit LA and had some relax moments, then forget it.

Reviews.Title: “Live the Dream!”
Reviews.Author: kdem52
Reviews.Content: If you want a taste of the Hollywood Life and a chance to live like a star, then try the W Hollywood. From the gracious staff to the killer views and lively bar scene this could very well be the hottest hotel in the US right now. General Manager Jim Mc Partlin has put together a great staff and runs a tight ship. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a celeb!”
Reviews.Author: Scatterling
Reviews.Content: We so enjoyed staying in this hotel. The room was wonderful. I loved all the little mod cons. We felt like celebs coming home at night and bypassing the queue and being let through the "ropes". The staff at the reception desk were great, the concierge desk were really helpful and printed out our Laker game tickets and gave us good directions to a shop to buy a sim card. The free Wifi is not so great in the business area ... kept dropping out, but was great in the lounge area downstairs. Only problem is if you wanted to use it at night, it was a bit daunting with the huge crowd of party goers!! Still ... could just work around it, and do our blogging in the mornings when it was all quiet. Being on top of the railway station was also great and convenient. All in all ... it was a real treat to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Karen & Her Team at the W made our experience Easy and Fantastic - we left with VERY happy clients”
Reviews.Author: Cannyc26
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hollywood recently for a large-scale event we were having nearby. While we were running around managing logistics, Karen Daily and her team were behind the scenes helping us greet our clients with a smile and a bottle of champagne. The service, grounds, and overall experience were fantastic thanks to all of the people that make this hotel tick. We're back in LA every month or two, and undoubtedly, will call this location our home away from home. Thanks Karen!!

Reviews.Title: “A new standard for W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: stylo4444
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in LA, and after carefully reading about a billion reviews on Starwood hotels in Los Angeles...I decided on the W Hollywood. An excellent decision on my part, and I would say that this is my new favorite hotel. The staff at this hotel, they really do all they can to make you feel like a valued guest and to see that your stay is as comfortable as possible. I've always had good experiences at W hotels, and this was easily the best. The rooms were very modern and comfortable, and the hotel itself is a fabulous property that is located in a great area. I really enjoyed my time here, and it was mostly due to the staff that went above and beyond what is expected of them. Some might not like the fact that there is a nightclub...and a hot nightclub (beautiful people, plush venue), and this might attract younger guests...but I saw a great mix ranging from couples, families, and even a few older people. If one is looking to stay in a great area of LA, I recommend staying in Hollywood and I recommend the W Hollywood without hesitation. You will not be disappointed! I am counting down the days till I fly out to LA again, and staying at this hotel is a big reason for that!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Hip Property in Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: SoCalDan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for a birthday weekend in a Marvelous suite that was "MARVELOUS!" It was sleek and modern, but comfortable. There was ample space, and the bed was sumptuous. The bathroom was large and well-appointed. If you want a taste of the fast-paced world that is Hollywood, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood is the new "it" spot in Los Angeles”
