Reviews.Author: ckapranos
Reviews.Content: I came here to have a great time and ended up having one of those memories I will never forget. I came mainly to party at the pool on Memorial Day weekend. I was treated like VIP from the moment I arrived with my girlfriend and the rest of the experience was one for the record books. This hotel transports you to a different mind set, one that will have you forget all your worries and elevate your mood to an out of body experience. The ambiance and atmosphere of this hotel is that of a James Bond movie meets lifestyles of the rich and famous. Basically the story goes like this...we arrived, took private elevator with host to pool...entered a world of excitement and fun (aka the pool area)...went straight to the top balcony...hung out next to great people while listening to LMFAO.... partied with LMFAO...then had another celebrity in the cabana next to us. Basically if you want to experience something extraordinary and out of the ordinary I would recommend trying the W Hollywood. If you do you will most definitely want to come back soon. I know I do.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vancouverite154943
Reviews.Content: W Hollywood has everything you need in the hotel. You basically never have to leave. The pool area is amazing, the food is great, the bars are all unique and the service is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: travel-4452
Reviews.Content: -Didn't find the staff particularly friendly or helpful -Room wasn't ready until about 45minutes after check in time, but they did store our luggage in the meantime -The women at the concierge desk wasn't helpful at all when I asked about transportation to Disneyland, acted as if it wasn't worth her time to help us -Location is great, about a 10 minute walk to the Grauman's Chinese Theater & Kodak Theater. On the way there are souvenir shops & restaurants. There are some weird people around that talk to themselves or shout things at you, but I guess it's expected in bigger cities. A little convenience store on the same block as the hotel, great for grabbing a bottle of water for $3.00 verses the $9.00 bottle in the room -About a $20 cab ride to Universal City -They had a line up for the pool party but it was off to the side, did not an issue to get back into the hotel at night, they do have the velvet rope and people letting you in or out -Rooms were fine, the day bed a nice touch, the see through part from the shower into the room is frosted so you just see the persons silhouette, loved the ipod desk and the phone chargers (they have several types in the room, didn't have to get mine out of the suitcase) -Loved whoever cleaned our room, they lined up all our make-up and hair products, everything was neat and orderly My overall experience was Ok ... nothing amazing or too horrible about it

Reviews.Title: “Staff here are some of the BEST in the...”
Reviews.Author: Oofc
Reviews.Content: Staff here are some of the BEST in the country. Great rooms, great location, great service, and a specatular roof top pool with one of the best views in Los Angeles.....What more could you ask for???? Did I mention the great staff??? We will be back next time we are in LA for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mrfrankel
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the W Hollywood just this past weekend. I originally only planned one night Saturday but in the midst of having a blast extended my stay an extra night. I didn't want to leave. The Hotel is smartly designed and the staff was amazing. The "W" Insider Chris went above and beyond great service and even booked our second night for us while we remained poolside. Just an excellent time and I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: Gordon_Ingle
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the W Hollywood. Rooms were really nice. Hotel staff were very helpful. Had a great time at the Drais pool party on Sunday May 30, 2010. The general manager was extremely helpful in helping gain entrance to the pool party. Chris Nelson was also great during our stay. Will definitely stay here again this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nightclub with a hotel attached”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneIsy
Reviews.Content: This was one of our worst hotel experiences in four weeks in the USA - if you can describe it as a hotel. This is actually a nightclub and a bar full of wankers, with a hotel attached. At night we were looked up and down when trying to get in the door of the hotel (we were asked several times by LARGE bounces if our names were 'on the list'). We asked whether hotel guests are given any sort of priority entrance to the club and we were told that the manager would meet us and make a decision as to whether or not to admit us. (!) The rooms were full of amazing gadgets and ipod docks and whatever, but the bathroom didn't have a sealable door for when someone is using the toilet and the rooms were ridiculously small, given the high cost of the rooms. The staff were very attractive and trendy, but all appeared extremely young, inexperienced and not particularly interested. Would NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, outstanding staff, beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: christinasb
Reviews.Content: we live not too far away, so often book 1 and 2-nighters in los angeles. was soooo looking forward to checking out the new w. i inadvertently booked the westwood w (through the aaa site) and, although the rate was pre-paid/non-changeable, ava @ the front desk took the time to work with the other property and book us in at the same rate. this was especially important, as the plans we had made were for venues just near the hollywood w. brian, and others, in security was very helpful in getting us through the crowd, even as saturday evening became (wonderfully) chaotic. i don't know how they all remembered who was a guest and who wasn't, but we never had trouble getting to/from out room. beds super comfy, rooms were nice, as was lobby bar/staff. next time we'll stay for food!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Rooms/Views/Best Service in LA!”
Reviews.Author: lalocalolita
Reviews.Content: Now, I have lived in LA all my life, and never had a more beautiful corner suite w/amazing views of the Hills of Hollywood AND the skyline of Los Angeles to enjoy, while sipping champagne on a Sunday afternoon... the W has it all! Great pool and bar, the mai tais are to die for, breakfast at Delphine - the eggs benedict were hot and cooked to perfection .. and I can honestly say I had the best service in any area of the hotel we visited, from the parking attendant to the electrician guy who helped me figure out the flat screen TV/DVD thingee in minutes, as I wanted to hear a CD and didn't have a clue..LOL Friendly and professional, a younger fresh looking staff that gave an older person like me respect and treated me like a celebrity! I will definitely be coming back here when I want some R&R or feel up to doing the dance by the club/rooftop pool.. again, this is the IT place to be if you are in your 20-30's, and a stylish and sophisticated hotel to visit when just wanting to get away. I mean why waste time driving far when the Emerald City is right here in our back yards!

Reviews.Title: “if you like to party with a bunch of teenagers and get no sleep, this is your place”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen75
Reviews.Content: I'm here on a business trip and since I've arrived a few days ago couldn't sleep or relax properly as there is a constant noise level in the hotel. Either it's techno music from the pool upstairs on the 12th floor, which you can hear even down to the 3rd, a false fire alarm (twice since we've arrived - quote: we're working on it...) or a bunch of teenagers who party in their room! yes, it's supposed to be a trendy hotel, but if I'd like to sleep in a Club, I'd go somewhere else and wouldn't pay for it. At one point the guys from W have to question themselves what's the purpose of a hotel: acting like a nightclub for 50 people while disturbing 500 paying guests in their sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great new addition to the W family”
Reviews.Author: DeltaFlyer_Boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for one night while in LA for a weekend supporting the LA Kings in the playoffs (other night stayed downtown so we could walk to Staples Center) and really enjoyed the W. We couldn't have asked for anything more. The service was impeccable, rooms and all public areas were spotless and the vibe throughout the hotel was pretty fun. Sunday afernoon we went up on the roof to Wet - fun crowd, awesome views and also had a few drinks downstairs on the outdoor patio. The prices weren't necessarily cheap, but perfectly in line with what I would expect to pay at a hotel such as the W. My friend used the spa in the afternoon and felt it was a very good. The only gripe I have is the nightly parking - but no hotels in LA are cheap on that front. Will definitely consider the W when I'm in LA again.

Reviews.Title: “THE HOTTEST HOTEL IN LA”
Reviews.Author: norajan24
Reviews.Content: The W Hollywood is amazing! The rooms are spacious and trendy and the service is great! I went there for a weekend getaway and had the best time of my life. I come out to LA often but this hotel was different! it was so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Really Hip Hotel. Amazing Rooms. Scary Service.”
Reviews.Author: floydio
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have gotten 5 stars were it not for the questionable maid service: it is stunningly beautiful, an in-spot for the LA 20-somethings, and uber hip. I was upgraded to a suite which was amazing--it had a circular couch--and the lobby is so cool. However, maids kept coming in my room despite my do not disturb sign on the door. This on top of the fact the AC wasn't working correctly and I had partied a bit the night before, they actually came in when I was naked and without knocking. Truly weird. Also, although I called 4X, they never could fix the AC. I told the management, and if they fix the issue with the maids (???!) and get a solid service staff there, this is a great place.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING W - LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: JNLNY
Reviews.Content: WOW- that's all I have to say. I've heard so many positive things about this new W from friends and colleagues who have stayed here within the past couple months and it definitely didn't disappoint!!! Everything from the attractive and super friendly and helpful front desk staff, professional and fast bellman, AWESOME bar scene, and AMAZING room decor made this for a great weekend for my buddy's bachelor party. I've been to the W Westwood and the SLS, bu the W Hollywood is definitely where I'll be staying next time I'm in LA!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and swanky, yet very comfortable rooms to chill out in”
Reviews.Author: sbjenn
Reviews.Content: I felt glamorous here...who wouldn't? From the moment you pull your car into the valet under 1000's of little white lights, you know you are somewhere special. The lobby was busy and bustling with people lounging around checking their laptops on the trendy couches covered with pillows, while others hung out at the popular bar. Our "fabulous" room (that's what the room type category is) was indeed fab...wonderfully comfortable bed, window seat, i-pod docking system, flat screen tv, dvr player, and bliss prodcuts galore. The shower was especially cool with it's glass door that had a peek through spot into the main room. They truly thought of everything you would want for the after party as well...for a small price. The restaurant had amazing seafood with a French flair and creative cocktail creations. We thoroughly enjoyed our desert and were delighted when they inscribed in chocolate "Happy Date Night" for us. As for the spa, it was nice with wonderful products, thoughtful staff, and yummy treats to sample while you were relaxing, not to mention the champagne. :) Pool area was actually a hip spot for locals and really loud music jams, but exciting and the place to be seen. $$$ drinks. The Acura service was a great asset for guests who wish to explore the area and need a lift...I believe it is free based on availability for a 3 mile radius. All in all, this place was exciting, swanky, and so much fun! If you go, make sure you read the mirror outside the ladie' s room before heading out on the town. It is very enlightening and a huge ego boost! :)

Reviews.Title: “Uber-trendy hotel, fabulous customer service, very noisy at weekends”
Reviews.Author: Kemper_Forbes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights after travelling from the UK. The room was fabulous, and the customer service displayed throughout our stay was fantastic. What we didn't know was that there is an extremely popular nightclub at the hotel with an outdoor lounge area which was very loud - we were lullaby-ed to sleep on the first night by bongo-drums! In fairness, it was Saturday night and we were extremely jet-lagged so it did not keep us awake. The valet parking is steep at $35 per night - better deal is to park at Hollywood & Highland for $10 (self parking, only $15 for valet) for 24 hours and they have security. Would recommend this hotel, but not at weekends (unless you are uber-cool).

Reviews.Title: “I think i just found my favorite hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: rickalvarado
Reviews.Content: The room was fantastic and we found the design to be very chic, modern yet keeping things within the realm of comfort. I travel to get away for a few days here and there and am a frequent guest at the W-Hotel chain and am never disappointed with the service and level of amenities.I have to say the staff at W-Hollywood did a great job too and the young lady at the front desk greeted me with a huge smile and was pleasant. She set the tone for your hotel and the first impression I got from her was that she enjoyed her job and wanted to make sure I had a wonderful experience. I will be returning in June and think the hotel has become one of my favorites! Thank You, Enrique Alvarado

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Do Not Stay With Children”
Reviews.Author: mike060219
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Gold Member and I used points for my one night stay. Our experience was horrible. First they charge you $35 a night to park. That is the most that I have ever had to pay to park at a hotel. Second dont take your kids to this hotel. We went up to the pool area on the top floor and it was like being in Vegas with no kids and a bunch of tiny swimsuits and studs trying to impress everyone. Dont stay at this hotel if you want to get sleep at night. The nightclub on the roof at bongo drums going along with loud music so you could not get any sleep. The walls are paper thin in the room as we hear the a lady next door screaming while having sex. The location is nice to be in Hollywood but the Hotel is just a young status place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip - maybe a bit too cool for us”
Reviews.Author: pharaohgirl
Reviews.Content: The W is always a safe brand to go with in my opinion, and I always expect the whole modern groovy trendy thing when we get there - its the W - that's how they roll - so if you want to stay somewhere hip, happening, groovy, modern, in the scene - this is your place - if you're in bed by 9 like me then this place will not mean much to you. Overall the stay was fine - not thrilling but fine. Pros: Bed is incredibly comfy, nice shower, excellent concierge, location. Cons: Overpriced, too trendy (will not age gracefully), VERY BAD coffee (and I am a coffee grump in the mornings), terrible valet - very disorganized, the whole velvet rope crap at night - a bit silly - but its the whole L.A. celebrity young be scene thing going on....I would recommend it to my friends who love the night life and the whole modern thing - to my more laid back friends - no.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to access all areas”
Reviews.Author: readysetpack
Reviews.Content: Well located and nicely fitted out hotel with helpful staff. Sadly this positive impression was outweighed by the fact that you can't access all areas. It's painful that you need to get a pass to get back in after a night out. Even more disappointing is the fact that you cannot access the courtyard or roof top bar as they are independently operated. It might look like its all part of the deal but it's not. Hotels like the LKF in Hong Kong do a much better job - if you are a guest at the hotel you are not prevented from accessing the roof top bar which makes it a really fun place to stay. The whole set up made the hotel feel rather pretentious - the lingering message was, "never mind that you are a paying hotel guest, you can't come in!" Unfortunately this marred what would otherwise have been a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average ... not really for me”
Reviews.Author: fasaleh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with 2 nights free through my points. This hotel is not for everyone and for certain purposes. I came to LA for a vacation but my experience at the hotel was a headache. The hotel has positives and negatives but I will not stay here again. On the other hand my friend said he will likely stay here. Positives: - new and therefore clean. It was my main reason for staying here - metro is outside the hotel. The terminal was new and nice. The ceiling contained rounded movie films. Used the metro to get to Universal Studios. Took around 15-20 minutes. - 10 -15 minute walk gets you to the tourist areas of Hollywood such as the Kodak theater - Universal mobile charger system. - My room was high up and I had a fairly nice view. - Comfortable bed / nice shower. - Had dinner and breakfast in the hotel restaurant and I had no complaints. Food was great. - Did not use the pool but the area is nice. It is on the balcony with nice views of the city. Negatives - Hotel was constantly busy at night. Tables in the lobby and outdoor patio were always full. I do not mind a busy atmosphere but I am in the mood in relaxing at my hotel not competing for a table. - I went through 3 layers of security to get to my room at night. I do not mind the security but it was a headache. Security is to monitor people from not getting to the club on the top floor. - Even though the bed was comfortable I have a personal preference to sleep on an elevated bed. Appears all rooms contain beds with no boxes. - My friend enjoyed the modern room. I thought the room was plain. 75% of the room is white. In my opinion it was boring. I did not use valet. From LAX I took a taxi. Taxi will cost $60-70 dollars. On my last day I took the city tour. I highly recommend this method to see the city. It is a great way to tour the city without driving around. If I had time I would have bought the 2 day ticket instead of the 1 day ticket. Santa Monica is great! This hotel is more of a "party hotel" If I ever come back to Hollywood and in a party mood I will stay at the hotel. If I am in the mood to relax I will stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Sales Kickoff meeting ever!”
Reviews.Author: adeemoore
Reviews.Content: Our colleagues traveled from all over the world and all were in agreement the W was the best venue ever for our Sales conference. The professional service, attention to detail, atmosphere, restaurant and bar, quality rooms and reasonable rates were superb. We can't wait to come back...maybe next time just for the fun of it.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Spunkyzgal
Reviews.Content: Great looking brand new hotel although we found the location gritty (not the best part of Hollywood Boulevard and although seasoned travellers we at times felt a little unsafe). Staff were a highlight – above and beyond helpful and friendly! We got a complimentary room upgrade on check in too which was much appreciated. Room was very nice and Bliss bathroom products are amazing –mmmm lemon and sage soap-my favourite. We had a great view of Hollywood Boulevard from the day bed in our room. Hotel becomes a hot spot at night and is a maze of security and velvet ropes – we had to get special passes to show security just to get back in but we had no problems with this as security were great. Just a word of caution- music blares into early morning from downstairs so if you are a light sleeper this might not be the place for you (we didn’t mind this at all). Complimentary lemon water and cake available in lobby in the afternoon. Acura free car service also available although with the time/distance restrictions we didn’t bother. Only thing that spoiled our stay were the insane phone charges. We had a phone card and were having trouble using it so ended up going out to an operator several times when trying to connect. We also later gave up and phoned home. The result- $2 per every time we tried to connect to phone card ($20 in total) plus $62 for a few minutes call to Australia. We nearly fell over when we got the bill. When we enquired at the front desk about why call rates were not posted near the phone she shrugged and said something about checking the inroom manual. We never found it though. Also wifi available for $16 per day in room or free in lobby (although the one time we did this we felt pressured to buy drinks from the lobby bar there so just ended up getting wifi in the room). Didn’t use pool or restaurant but both seemed nice. We usually stay in Beverly Hills or Santa Monica but wanted to try something different. We probably wouldn’t come back because my husband hated the location which is a shame because the hotel itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous but misleading”
Reviews.Author: JBH_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as we wanted to be in 'the thick' of Hollywood, which the W is. It's a very glamorous hotel with great reception staff and a beautiful lobby. The room was nice but frankly the descriptions used by W - 'Wonderful, Spectacular, Fabulous' are more confusing than aspirational. Just seemed like a standard hotel room to me. A week before arriving, I sent a request for a booking in Drai's lounge for drinks one evening before going out to dinner which was left unanswered and when we inquired at check in were told that we would have to contact Drai's directly as there was no relationship between them and the W. If this is the case, I don't understand why Drai's are listed on he W website as facilities of the hotel. The rooftop pool is lovely and I believe accessible during the day but not at all at night when the club is operating. Can you believe that you need special passes during these times just to get into the lobby and up to your room but as before, this doesn't give access to many of the facilities listed on the website. Valet is very expensive but there is a $10 carpark just across the road, which is not only much cheaper but would be quicker than waiting for your car to arrive during busy periods. We only had breakfast in Delphine once, which was OK but they had run out of English Muffins for the Eggs Benedict and the service was erratic. An explanation was given at the end of the meal that the waiter had just started but I don't see why that should have been our problem. This is undoubtedly a hip and happening hotel in an up and coming part of town but we felt that we had been misled and at the end of the day is was a disappointing rather than a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite W Destination – The W Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: peter_vpnet
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I would say this is definitely one of my most favorite trips of all time. The entire experience from beginning to end was fantastic. I really enjoyed the elegant Hollywood ambience, the beautiful W suite, and the top-notch staff who were very attentive to all my needs. They even had a “W Insider” on staff that acted as the super concierge for the hotel guests. This is something I have never experienced before. Here is just a little taste on how my day went. I arrived in the early afternoon via car. The valet person took my bags and brought it to the room. After settling in, I enjoyed a light lunch poolside. The view of Hollywood was very picturesque, which made me very relaxed. At this point I started to feel in vacation mode. After the food settled, I went to the W gym and worked out for about an hour. I especially enjoyed using the punching bag. In the evening, I dined at the Dephine restaurant and had the “le grande delphine”. This was one of the largest seafood towers I have ever attempted to eat. I think the petite would have been more appropriate for two people. After my pleasant dining experience, I enjoyed the new rooftop nightclub called Drai’s. This really reminded me of being in Las Vegas. After a few drinks the day was already almost over. I wished that I could of stayed another night but had to get back home for Easter. I really look forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “W Hollywood-”
Reviews.Author: sfbayvip
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many W Hotels across the globe and I have to say after spending the weekend at the W Hollywood and enjoying the atmosphere, food, gym, pool, bars and restaurants it is now my favorite hotel in California. Upon check in ask for the W Insider: Chris Nelson to assist in your W Hotel experience. http://www.starwoodhotels.com/whotels/property/overview/index.html?propertyID=1789 When going to the W Hotel Hollywood ensure to book in advance and also make sure to go to Drai's Nightclub. http://draishollywood.com/flash/index.php

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by how GOOD it is!”
Reviews.Author: BGinOC
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I almost didn't book at the W, but I was attending a concert at the Pantages Theatre and you can't get any more convenient than the W. For those using mass transit, it's literally on top of the Hollywood and Vine station - take the Red Line from Union Station. ATTITUDE: yes, this is a new and very hip hotel. But every staff member I met was friendly and totally committed to service. From the valet parking to the front desk to room service to the Men in Black (security folks needed for the club scene), everyone was great. FOOD: I always sample room service my first time at any property. Food arrived earlier than promised and I was impressed. The onion soup gratinee was simply the best I've ever had. A simple prime beef cheeseburger was great: a hand formed patty in a light bun with the usual trimmings and condiments. And the French fries... I've never been impressed by fries before but now I am. ROOM: Trendy, well appointed and comfortable. The universal cell phone (or other gizmo) charger was handy. If you're worried about party noise from the clubs, spend a few extra bucks for an exterior-facing room. I did and had no trouble with noise. SUMMARY: Would I come here again? Absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: mishottie
Reviews.Content: I don't even have the energy to provide a detailed account of our experience, but I can tell you that I have stayed at Starwood properties all over the United States and this was the worst experience I have had and I only stayed one night. The GM may turn the negative reviews around as I have heard good things about him through the grapevine. There were a couple of exceptional staff (CJ and Marc), but for the most part it was pretentious, insulting, discriminating, and overrated. Don't: Expect to get into the nightclub if you are not "someone" or know "someone" (Yes, Drai's is owned by another entity - Victor Drai). This will eventually wear off as all new L.A. Clubs do. Count on using the pool if they have a private event up there. Expect to be able to have a cocktail and/or sit out on the patio off the Living Room in the lobby (as there was a private party there, too). Expect courtesy Expect air conditioning or temperature control. "WISH" for anything reasonable because wishes really DO NOT COME TRUE HERE. Do: Save your money and stay somewhere you will be treated with class Stop in for a poorly made cocktail just to see the Living Room Wait and "WISH" the GM, Jim McPartlin, listens to all the negative feedback and does something to change it

Reviews.Title: “Guest not allowed to use POOL!”
Reviews.Author: kch2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a quick business trip. The hotel advertises a pool on their website but when you try to use it you will be turned away. Someone else manages it and controls access, hotel guests are not included!

Reviews.Title: “The new "it" place to be. So swanky you...”
Reviews.Author: alibee1
Reviews.Content: The new "it" place to be. So swanky you feel you should even dress up to go to sleep...especially when it's impossible to sleep with all the clubbing going on around you. Might as well look like a hip insomniac

Reviews.Title: “Guests are NOT allowed to use pool”
Reviews.Author: summertraveler2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not allow hotel guests to use the hotel pool. This is pretty bad for a Starwood brand!! Starwood unforunately, contracted promoters from Las Vegas to run its clubs which includes the rooftop "WET" similar to WET in Las Vegas. The hotel NEEDS to inform its guests prior to staying there that there is limited access to some of the hotels clubs and other areas. I am writing a letter to the CMO and President of Starwood, clearly, their time spent in business school was non existant. Whatever happened to brand loyal and integrity. The W Hollywood is taking the brand staright to hell!

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant and typical hollywood attitude”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveler100
Reviews.Content: As a gold preferred guest, I have never been so disappointed with a Starwood property in my life. I have been a starwood member for the past 8 years and have never been so misinformed and deceived until I stayed at the W in hollywood. First, I asked what rooms they had available when I came into registration. When I was told that every type of room was available, I then asked for an upgrade as a gold member, and was not given one. Okay fine, I didn't want to argue or call SPG and try to figure out why I was being denied an upgrade. It happens. This wasn't a big deal. Second, I had bottle service reservations at the hotel's restaurant, Drai's and was later told that I didn't have any. I contacted the W staff and complained about the situation, and a guy named Chris, who works for "Whatever, whenever" said he'd take care of it. I had a client coming in from across town to discuss some business over dinner and drinks. To my surprise, I was denied entrance to Drai's, or their restaurant. Chris kept giving me the run around. I was very embarrassed at this situation and couldn't believe that this so called friendly staff did not do enough to remedy the situation. Their excuse was that Drai's was a separate entity, when in fact, Drai's is on every phone speed dial in every room, advertised in each room, and highlighted on the W's website. If this is not misleading, then I do not know what is. Third, just because you are staying here doesn't mean you can dine at their restaurant or hang out at their pool or even have a drink at the bar. In fact, you are in par with the general public, which is absolutely absurd. I witnessed people who were not guests in the hotel gain entrance to the hotel's restaurant. I had to look for a restaurant outside the hotel. This is a big problem. Lastly, the staff here have a lot to learn about running a hotel and treating their customers with some respect. All I got was a bunch fake attitudes. Unless you are some millionaire or a celebrity, this isn't the place for you. They pretend to care and be nice when they really aren't.

Reviews.Title: “Like the cast of "Jersey Shore"?.....well,that's what you get at W Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: TracyLee13
Reviews.Content: Whatever Whenever....yea, if you are craving to be a cast member of some MTV show. Most everyone visiting the hotel dressed in Affliction and Ed Hardy and girls wearing almost nothing. Hey, if that's your scene then this is the place for you. But it is NOT what the W hotels are supposedly known for. I was under the assumption that the W hotels were stylish hotels that cater to a metropolitan clientele...wrong....at least the W Hollywood is not. Upon check in we were told that we could be put on a floor that is quiet and that was completely untrue...they put us on the 11th floor close to the pool with the music blaring AND right next to the gym so, at 4AM we were awoken to someone running while listening to music!!!4AM!!!! Have they heard of SOUNDPROOFING?...So,we called downstairs and were told they could move us to another room....7th floor with a view of the brick wall!Really????Okay,I guess we'll try it...We leave for the day and come back to a dirty room!?Call down to the desk,AGAIN..and they responded with "Oh,you wanted it cleaned?"...WHAT?Umm, yes we'd like it cleaned like most EVERY hotel in the world even the flea-bag variety hotels try to clean your room with fresh towels and etc..Thinking about a nice drink at the rooftop pool,nope, you need a reservation..for the POOL? Okay, so we decided, let's have a drink downstairs,RUDE waitresses more concerned with looking good than customer service..Now ONE shining beacon to this crappy experience is Mina, the front desk agent.Mina has tried to make amends for the awful experience that has been this stay at W Hollywood. Thank you Mina for all you've tried to do. Advice for the W:...if you want to be the party hotel...bill it as such,play it up..say ON THE WEBSITE that you are for YOUNG adults,Spring Breakers,Hollywood douchebag types... capitalize on it,because this is NOT for discerning clients who have stayed at other W hotels and love the style and ambiance of what other W's offer.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to be in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: wpier7
Reviews.Content: the W is THE official place to be in LA, period. i used to stay at the andaz - west hollywood, but wanted to be closer to the nightclubs on hollywood blvd. little did i know, all the night life entertainment i was seeking for the weekend took place right in my hotel! upon arriving, i learned that the new nightclub drai's (which is on the 12th floor of the hotel) was opening the same weekend. the entire place was like a huge party - but with exceptional service. the rooms were GREAT: plasma tv on the wall, huge walk-in shower, comfortable beds, a nice window seat with a great view of hollywood, etc. honestly, i started jumping up and down like a little kid when i walked into the room lol. if you're willing to splurge, try a suite. our neighbors next door invited us over, and their room was fabulous. back to the partying: getting into drai's seemed to be a hassle, but the lobby is a great place to hang out. i ran into terrell owens and jamie fox on the elevator - and later learned that jamie fox was staying right across from my room! fyi parking is around $35/night. and if you need sleep, try to request a room on a lower floor because you will hear music from the nightclub (we stayed on the 11th floor, but the noise wasn't an issue to me). the w is my new official hotel in LA from now on, and I highly recommend it to anyone seeking a complete hollywood experience.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful but not really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: truthkeystone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very noisey. There is quite a party atmosphere and there is noise from the roof top and bars. You can hear noise in the hall very clearly and there is alot of people roaming late at night. We had a "spectacular" room that was pretty ordinary. No bathtub?? No turn down service?? The air conditioner was quite loud. You may not have access to the pool. It was closed at 10 Am for cleaning and was also closed during the day for a party. Pool is not available after 5. Beautiful common areas and quiet in day time.

Reviews.Title: “The most sexiest hotel experience I have had........”
Reviews.Author: normanrt
Reviews.Content: Thie W Hotel is the "sexiest" hotel I have ever stayed at. Everything was perfect from customer service all the way to their presentation. I am already in the process of planning another stay at the hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome general manager and staff!”
Reviews.Author: JudySpeech
Reviews.Content: Everyone that worked there treated myself, my sister, and my daughter like we were "movie stars". We had a great time. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Snobby, noisy, and rude”
Reviews.Author: xanderfinch
Reviews.Content: Normally I love Starwood Hotels, and the W is beautifully designed, there's no two ways around it. However, the service at the W Hollywood is among the worst I have ever experienced. Our bed was layered with: flat sheet - dirty duvet with no cover - and another flat sheet on top of that. Nothing else. We called down to see if it could be remade properly, someone came up and dropped a stack of flat sheets at our door and scurried away. Not that we were able to sleep anyway... The noise of the club downstairs echo'ed into our room (bass drum sounds all night) well past 2am on weeknights, and we woke up at 7am to incessant hammering. When we finally called the front desk at 7:30am to complain about the noise, the front desk person audibly snickered. She actually laughed out loud at my complaint. When I asked her why she thought it was funny, she said "oh, ummm sorry, it's not funny, we can hear it too and it's really loud" -- OK, then thanks for doing something about the racket. Isn't it your job to attend to these things before people complain? Or to offer any kind of solution? She then put me on hold for 10 minutes listening to music that ensured I wouldn't be able to fall asleep even if the hammering stopped. And then, of course, the hammering never stopped, and the front desk person was unapologetic, and didn't offer earplugs OR COMPASSION. This is the kind of place where earplugs should be dropped in your hand along with the room key when you check in. We slept less than 3 hours that night due to all the noise at night and in the morning. Rude and absurd, uncourteous and unclassy. We ordered breakfast in the room and my $20 waffle had three pathetic strawberries on it and tasted & looked like a stale Eggo. We got a slab of bacon heaped on top of my husband's meal -- Thanks, DUMMIES, we're vegetarians! Final total for inedible crap: $53. Our wake up calls never came through. Our toiletries were never replenished. Our final bill was incorrect. A friend who came to pick us up was told that he wasn't allowed to pull into the stadium-sized driveway to wait TWO MINUTES for us to descend in the elevator, told that he would have to circle the block and call us to have us meet him on the street. We didn't feel we were treated kindly or with respect as guests at any point. This hotel is loud and obnoxious and snobby, and is perfect for guests who are loud and obnoxious and snobby. - - - - - Weird sidenote: don't share a room unless you're totally comfortable seeing your roommate naked. There's a full length frosted window from the shower into the suite, thus defeating any sort of potential for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “The charm of LAX two days before Christmas in the TSA wore black suits”
Reviews.Author: Skye24F
Reviews.Content: Excited about the W opening and reading good restaurant reviews, we made a reservation at Delphines. We pulled up in front of the hotel, gave the car to the valet and were greeted with a chain of velvet ropes and men in black suits who did not say "Welcome to the W," but rather "Where are you going?" We told them we were going to Delphines. We were asked if we had a reservation. We said yes. We were asked our names. We told them. We were then passed through the velvet ropes and into reception area. The restaurant was on the other side of the lobby (which is essentially a giant nightclub). To cross the lobby we met Man in Black Suit #2. He asked us where we where going, did we have a reservation, what were our names? Testly we answered again and we were passed through. On the far side of the lobby Man in Black Suit #3 allowed us to pass into the restaurant where the hostess said "How are you doing?" To which we replied, "Not so happy about all the velvet ropes." She was nice, seated us and we proceeded to have a lovely meal, fabulous food, reasonably priced, great service and we were wiling to let the bad experience pass because the food was so great. We paid our bill and then proceeded to leave the restaurant where upon we encounter Man in Black Suit #4 who said "Where are you going?" By this time we were ready to blow up. We said "TO OUR CAR" After spending over a $100 we now have to go through the indignity of three more Men in Black Suits and three more velvet ropes to leave! The manager was called. Two "managers" arrived. One listened, the other yelled directly in our faces. We both blew up. So here you have two men in their 50's, well traveled, sober, properly dressed screaming at the top of our lungs in front of reception with this evil "manager-bouncer" while peopel are checking in to $300 a night rooms. While we did not stay in a room and we cannot vouch for the rooms themselves, I can assure you we will never set foot in the place again. If you want to experience the indignity of the old Studio 54 in New York where people begged in get in to spend their money, then this is the place for you. A perfectly lovely meal was ruined by hotel staff who have no idea what real security is about. And never once was the phrase "What can we do to make this right?" uttered amid the staff shouting. Ironically this morning in the LA Times there was a review of the restaurant/club on the roof where the owner bragged about turning away 2 to 3 thousand people a night. The implication being that they were just not beautiful enough. Please.....

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: annaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: I am a Southern California local and like to go have a good night on the town once in a while and will stay in Los Angeles. I was really excited when the W opened so I decided to check it out. Liked- The hotel lobby is extremely beautiful and the bar is fun to hang out in and enjoy a cocktail before your night. The pool is definitely a seen and been seen kind of place. There are really nice cabanas to rent which will be the place to be in the summer. The valet staff and front desk staff were very pleasant. Disliked- Ok, where do I begin? The security at the hotel is some of the rudest I have ever experienced. There were 3 guests staying in the room, all registered with the front desk. However, security would not let all 3 of us up to the room. He told us that he would only allow 2 people per room to go up. We went to the front desk and they tried to talk to security but security wouldn't budge! We waited for a manager for about 10 minutes before I asked another friend of ours for his key so that we could get my guest to my room. I understand they are trying to keep non guests out of the hotel but let the guests in! It took 6 hours to bring bags to the room. I was waiting until 3:30 in the morning for the bags, not even sure if the hotel had lost them or not. We just kept getting told the bags were on their way. The Restaurant downstairs was amongst the worst food I had ever had. Almost nothing we ordered was even edible- I will say the Ahi was decent though. Even though I said the lobby bar was fun, the bartenders had HORRIBLE attitudes. A smile goes a long way The rooms are so/so. They are new and decent for the price but I wouldn't say they are up to W standards by any means. The waters on the night stand were $9 each. I don't know how they justify that. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that you can have a much better experience at without the hassle and headache.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: euro7999
Reviews.Content: from the second I walked in at 1AM in the morning I loved it. I had a late arrival, coming from freezing NY and was welcomed by some very good looking friendly staff, check in was quick and very efficient. big party in the lobby and my room on the 3rd floor was as silence as it could be, heard nothing! LOVE the W bedding. next morning we had an amazing breakfast in the restaurant, friendly staff again and fresh, amazing food. returned the same evening and we ordered room service, 18 Minutes it was up there, great presentation and again very tasteful! will come back for sure, the hotel is just perfect and that for a brand new opening. Well done and my compliments to the General Manager and his amazing team!

Reviews.Title: “WOW! For a Brand New hotel, they've got it together!”
Reviews.Author: MTdawn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels; a lot of really, really nice hotels. But I just had the most incredible stay at the brand spankin' new "W Hollywood"! A lot of the hotel wasn't even up & running yet (there was only one restaurant open, "Delphine's", which is honestly AMAZING!, the Bliss spa, pool, hotel store, etc... BUT it didn't matter at all! A hotel is all about it's accommodations - which were truly wonderful & comfortable (except for the 7th Floor wrap around view suite which is unfortunately situated above a large billboard with spotlights. It might be fine for some, but I like a dark room when I sleep) while being very modern/European/sleek. It is also only as good as the people who work at it, and I have to let you (and the GM) know that the staff at here is without question the absolute best I have ever dealt with! Intelligent, knowledgeable, incredibly accommodating, fun, nice, attractive...people I want to actually have as friends - all of them! Seriously! From the room service waitstaff , "guest ambassadors" (bellhops), parking attendants, concierge, front desk, etc! Thanks to you all! I can't wait to come back when everything is open!!

Reviews.Title: “New hotel but no excuse for bad service”
Reviews.Author: bigeyed
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was beautiful very posh vibe. Stayed on the 7th floor in the Fabulous suite. Comfy and great bathroom. Ordered breakfast room service for the morning and were surprised to wake up to it already had been 2 hours late. Called room service to get help and they rushed us up an order that wasnt even ours. Called them again to ask when our food was coming. They called back 30 minutes later to tell us Sorry and 20 more minutes. This is 2.5 hours of waiting for our coffee and breakfast. We finally got fed up and ended up going to the restaurant called Delphine which was delicious and offered great service. The managers were not very eager to try to correct the service situation. All in all they seemed to be very bothered by us wanting the food that we previously ordered the night before and then gave excuses about how they are a NEW hotel and that they did not have a good groove yet. We were highly disappointed. Lastly, they did not have a pool or hot tub available yet and when we asked about the spa services the staff didnt know much about the services offered or when the pool would be ready.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing more amazing than the W Hollywood are the people who work there.”
Reviews.Author: romanrushlv
Reviews.Content: Walking in with my eyes bouncing from wall to wall and from floor to ceiling, I am only brought back to earth by the staff asking to assist me with my bag. My eyes go right back up to the ceiling and around until the front desk asked me to come forward. Now I am looking at everyone around me and thinking how cool this place is. I come back down to earth and ride up the elevator to my room, and I am in the clouds again. This room was spectacular! The complete white marble shower with the huge shower head and a peek-a-boo partially smoked glass that you can watch the 50 inch plasma screen through-Wow! They really have thought of everything this time. There was a big party going on downstairs the night I was there and I could not hear a sound. Once I got into that big white cloud of a bed, it was lights out. This place truly has the service of Southeast Asia; the style of Europe; and the edge of Hollywood. Well done.

HotelInfo.Name: W Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 6250 Hollywood Blvd, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
